One gets the feeling that perhaps some of the actors, like maybe Tom Neyman or John Reynolds would have better served their art with a better script. One also gets the feeling that each and every person associated with this that saw the script, or met the director, or even smelled the manure on him should be drawn and quartered. It seems, though, that the cast DID indeed see how bad this movie was going to be by making fun of it, as they started calling it "Mangos: The Cans of Fruit".

So, should you watch this movie? Oh yes, you must! ONLY if you rent the MST3000 version (I heard that an unedited version is now available, now THAT must be eye-gouging torture). It's good to see how bad a movie can get and still laugh at it. I give the movie a rating of 1, and the MST3000 version a 9!

I was interested enough to try to find out as much information about this movie as I could when I found that a documentary called Hotel Torgo (2004) exists. There, they interview one of the last surviving members of the cast (I don't think they found any others that may still be alive) and even bring him to the location of the set, an old run down house in the middle of nowhere. It's worth a watch.

A review of another film within a review? It can only happen with Manos: The Hands of Fate!

review_title: A Film with a Well-Deserved Reputation
review_detailed_main: I went into this film knowing of its reputation as the 'worst horror movie ever made' but nevertheless, I still tried to be open-minded and watch it without any preconceived notions as I do with any other film. I gotta tell you... I never give out one-star ratings but this film was just so poorly made, I couldn't help myself but laugh at how awful some of the scenes were whether it was due to the editing, the acting, the storyline, the script or the sound design.

review_title: A historic failure you must watch
review_detailed_main: This movie is like watching a baby take it's first steps. Every few seconds it falls over flat on it's face. The story behind this movie is more interesting than the movie itself. I hope we can get a disaster artist style movie about this movie.

The first 15 to 30 minutes of the movie with the couple driving around lost was mind numbing. When TV's Frank and Dr. Clayton Forrester apologize to Joel, you know this has to be the most unbelievably awful movie of all time. If by chance you watch this waste of time you will be shaking your head in shock for years to come. I would put my name but I don't want anybody to know that I actually watched the entire movie.

review_title: Pretty bad, but I give it a 2 for effort
A guide on how to not film a movie
review_detailed_main:
MANOS: THE HAND OF FATE is so infamously bad that it has attained novelty cult status. The plot, acting, cinematography, editing, dialogue, set and costume design and audiovisual synchronization are so amateurish that the movie can well serve as an example to learn from on what not to do when attempting to make a movie.

Evidently, a fertilizer and insurance salesman made this movie because he lost a bet. Assuming this story is true, I have to give him credit for holding up his end of the bet, no matter how awful the final product.

The one positive thing I can say about this movie is that for all its disjointness, silliness, and WTFery it captures a glimmer of a long bygone era that feels nostalgic in today's day and age.

review_title: "Well, where did this place come from? It wasn't here before."

review_detailed_main:
What can I say besides well, this movie is the 'Chinese water torture of movies'(i.e so painful to watch that it will have you wanting to scrape you're eyes out with rusty spoons.) Now if you must watch this movies by any means make sure it is the MST3K version. If you do watch the non MST3K version then I have two things to say to you. One, you are far beyond my help and please email to tell me why you did watch the original version. And second you apparently must have the favor of the gods on your side if you can sit through this mess of a film.

Well now that I've got that out of my system. So... how is your week going? Are you going to go see King Kong? yep.

Overall I would like to give this movie a negative score but it has Torgo, the villain with knee problems and a haunting theme song so I'll give it a 2/10

It is unbelievable that this movie has a higher rating than Hobgoblins. This movie apparently does not believe in jumping right into the action as the first twenty minutes is nothing more than voice lessons for the MST3K crew, as they can say nothing but "Manos: Hands of Fate". The first part of the film could have been made into a short entitled "Stock Footage: How Far Can You Go". There is a truly unique film technique used as one scene fades away to the exact same scene. The best scene is a pathetic mass fight scene between Manos's wives. And how could you comment on this movie without mentioning the king of husky sized pants, Torgo. I consider my life a failure for having seen this movie.

review_title: ... but is it WORTHY of a sequel?? I say YES!
review_detailed_main: I hear that director Tony Trombo (who made the film "Hick Trek 2: The Next Aggravation") is looking into making the sequel to this fine little 1960s film! I hope it's just as good (or as bad) as the original! I've always thought that Manos was a great film, although it IS the WORST movie ever made! I say, If you're gonna make a crappy flick, do it right! Never mind about the script, or the acting, or the lighting, or the camera work, or the sets, or the special effects, or the really, REALLY long opening driving scene that doesn't have the credits rolling (like it should!) No sir, just go out and shoot footage and cut it together later, regardless of the outcome, or the popularity of the film afterward. Quentin Tarintino owns a 35mm copy... and that should be good enough for you!

This movie is astonishing at just how ridiculously bad it is. It's the ultimate test for Mystery Science Theatre 3000 fans at how strong their tolerance level for Z movie garbage is. This uniquely inept film really is a challenge to sit through, even with the Bots hammering it with some of the best riffs of their career. Where "Night of the Living Dead" proved a great horror movie could be made on a shoestring budget; Manos proves exactly the opposite.

The film opens with an excruciatingly drawn out road trip of bland scenery. There's a couple in a sports car making out every time you see them, and two cops with nothing much to do except constantly annoy the couple. Neither cops nor couple have anything whatsoever to do with the plot (if there is a plot, that is). The grainy film is obviously cheap Super 8 that the director Hal Warren, the auteur behind this, bought at a dime store somewhere, all dialogue is poorly dubbed by the same three people, and the acting defies description by any adjective in the English vocabulary.

You must see Torgo. It is the Master's will. You must see Torgo. He has obtrusively huge knees, a deteriorating hat, goes through odd muscular convulsions when he's about to talk, mumbles and stutters, and always repeats phrases twice in a speech. The family's first encounter with Torgo is probably about 30 seconds worth of information, and runs about 3 hours. Rivalling Torgo are the Wives, and their Battle Royale pillow fight, so funny it's painful. Because of them, Torgo, and the laughs this movie offers, this ponderous work of art staggers into a 2 rating.

The Master would approve. Only MST3K would dare unleash this upon an unsuspecting world. The Master would approve.

review_title: An almost unwatchable mess of a movie.
review_detailed_main: Mix a ridiculous title, horrible actors, and laughable direction with virtually no plot, and you get "Manos." I thank God that I haven't seen the un-MSTied version. Until the day I die, I will always wonder about Torgo. Does he have watermelons in his pants? If Crow, Tom, and Joel aren't at the bottom of your screen, above this pile of crap at all costs.

review_title: long pauses in the conversation might be awkward, but not scary
An extraordinary turkey experience from the wastelands of space
review_detailed_main:
(The first thing that must be said, is that I think MST3k is totally pointless. I love watching cheesy old oddball B-movies, but not with a bunch of silly robots ruining the experience. I treated "Manos" as it should be treated -- I let it speak for itself.)

There's not much to be said that's already been said about this movie's lack of... just about everything. I saw it for the first time just now, and I'm still baffled. This is not a case of "so bad, it's good". It's not even a case of "so bad, I want to spew my run screaming into the woods, using my own hand for a torch".

This movie reaches beyond "bad", and comes out on the other side. It's set entirely in a parallel universe, where time and logic are twisted beyond recognition for mortals. What looks like Texas is actually the other end of a worm hole, where the fabric of space has turned itself inside-out.

It HAS TO be this way. How else could a movie be so indescribably... not "bad", that word is to simple and two-dimensional... mesmerising, but yet so extraordinary painful and genuinely creepy... you feel the movie slowly pressing a pole into your blackened heart, and you make sure to keep the remote control near in case you should feel a psychosis coming... but still you're always on the verge of laughing your head off... and at the end, you can almost feel your brain suppressing the whole experience, and you will never, never be sure what actually happened during these 80 minutes.

THIS MOVIE IS EVIL. If you're looking for a great turkey experience, something out of this world, that leaves you with a smile on your face and a somewhat altered way of relating to movies in general, I suggest "Glen or Glenda".

I guess I will never look upon more ordinary B-movies the same way again. The thought isn't pleasant, but I still don't regret watching "Manos" for a second. It had to be done.

review_title: The pet project of a certain fertilizer salesman from El Paso.
review_detailed_main:
Update: 11-5-16 - !!!HAPPY 50th BIRTHDAY MANOS: THE HANDS OF FATE!!! I'm off to Arby's....

*********** *********** *********** *********** *********** *********** ***********

Manos: The Hands of Fate, one cinema's best known and most beloved bad movies. It's by-product-on-celluloid created from the singular mind of a certain fertilizer salesman from El Paso, namely: Hal P. Warren. How old Hal thought he had the knowledge and ability to make a movie (that people would actually want to/pay to see) is anyone's guess, but he did try and I'm very,very glad he did; because Manos: The Hands of Fate is, indisputably, one of the pinnacle of achievements of crap-cinema.

A man with a vision! Hal P. Warren, a man of many talents, not only sold fertilizer, but also wrote the script, served as director and "starred" in his own movie, in the role of "Michael" clad throughout the film in a hip white cardigan, combined with one of the wickedest widow peaks ever seen in a movie. Then there's his wife "Margaret".....does anyone hold the same opinion that she sets a new level for on-screen patheticness? Because she can't do ANYTHING without, crying and whining, falling down or repetitively yelling "Mike! Mike!, where in the world could he be, Mike!". I challenge anyone to find a character in a movie who's less capable then her. Then there's the couples, 5 year-old daughter "Debbie", who like all other characters, had her dialog dubbed in after filming, except for her they chose a middle-aged women to do her lines - with less than convincing results. It sounds like she's channeling the voice of her dead grandma some have said, it's certainly a somewhat creepy and unnatural sounding voice. And let us not to forget their little black dog "Peppy".

Does anyone really not yet know the plot of this movie? The plot is so pointless - so it's pointless to talk about it. Things really get interesting when Torgo shows up, "I am Tor-go, I take care of the place, while the mas-ter is away!". He functions as the motels caretaker, a rather short, bearded, quirky fellow with big, puffy, highly abnormal knee's and is always carrying a staff, presumably to help him maintain his balance as he slowly and awkwardly shambles to and fro. Torgo is propelled forward by "The Haunting Torgo Theme" an exceptionally catchy and charming little ditty, consisting of a repeating 3-note keyboard pattern, a pulsing bass drum and crystallized with tinkling xylophone. Torgo has a highly memorable introductory scene, with some funny dialog, which is often repetitive and contradictory - his opening line is a one of the all-time greats. Without a doubt Torgo is one of the oddest and quirkiest characters ever depicted in any movie. The actor who played Torgo, was the doomed 25 year-old John Reynolds Jr., who was reportedly very depressed and on drugs when filming the movie, to further make life miserable for him, the rigging that he wore under his pant-legs was unknowingly worn wrong and caused him to have chronicle knee pain. He killed himself with a gunshot to the head on October 16th 1966, about three weeks before Manos' world premiere in El Paso Texas, which occurred on November 5th 1966, a highly laughable, budget-restricted event (just like the movie itself) from what I've read. Torgo has several great scenes, watch and be rewarded.

Then there's The Master.....Torgo's boss, along with his six wives, who apparently hang out in the desert and sleep during the day. I've always loved The Master's awesome robe, it's jet-black with gigantic bright red hands, with splayed fingers, one hand on each side (purportedly, Hal P. Warren kept the robe after filming and for years afterward wore it on Halloween night when greeting the trick-or-treater's - THAT ROBE should definitely be in some sort of movie museum) and it simply looks spectacular when The Master raises his arms when he prays to Manos, which happens frequently. Played by actor Tom Neuman, who pretty much has the perfect look happening for this role, especially his great villainous mustache. His lunatic rantings and raving are even more ridiculous and repetitive then Torgo's. Then there's The Master's six wives, dressed in all white, partially see-through gown's of some sort, which you THINK would look sexy, but I assure they do NOT look sexy, these six harpies's proceed to bicker at each other and get into cat-fights in the night, some of that cattiness is eventually directed at Torgo. The plot of this movie was an afterthought, but they had to give the ladies something to do. They proceed to clumsily (that word is particularly apt for Torgo) harass Mike and his family in and around the motel at night, apparently there's an undead angle to their existence, because they're solely nocturnal.

Primitively filmed, by an assortment of novices and semi-pros 50 years ago, on 16mm film, with a camera that was unable to record sound, the end result, not surprisingly is pretty wretched looking to say the least and the editing in this movie is among the very worst ever seen. Though it has, within the past several years been restored and thankfully, from a visual standpoint greatly improved. Reportedly Hal P. Warren had a real short-fuse, did a lot of yelling and was hated by his entire cast and crew. Also there's the fact that Hal was so ignorant about film-making, that his cinematographer said that he often feed him lines such as "We'll fix it in the lab." which was pure BS, just to speed up production, Hal must have been hell to work with. But I must say I wish the man had made more movies, he could have been the next Ed Wood, but sadly that never happened and Manos: The Hands of Fate remains the one and only Hal P. Warren production.

.....................................................but the guy sure could sell some fertilizer, couldn't he??!!

review_title: Made my stomach cramp just 20 minutes in.
Worst movie EVER released in theaters.
review_detailed_main:
Y'know, people often cite *Plan 9 From Outer Space* as the worst movie ever made, but it truly isn't even close.

No, not even c-l-o-s-e !!

I mean, the most obvious defense you can make, that anyone can see, is that the camera operator had some concept of how to "pull focus", that is, the entire picture isn't in FuzzyVision.

No, I would argue that the worst movie ever made -- certainly the worst one I'm aware of -- which got any kind of theatrical release, is "Manos, The Hands Of Fate"

Amongst its many qualifying "features" are: a) Entirely filmed in full power FuzzyVision. No cameras were properly focused during the production of this film. b) Most, if not all of the footage is poorly chroma keyed -- it's washed out and dull looking. This impacts not only the overall film, but also makes "c" below even worse... c) It's about 30 minutes worth of actual footage/story padded out to 74 minutes by endless -- and yes, I do mean truly interminable -- shots of passing scenery -- along with throwaway scenes of people and events who appear nowhere else in the film and have no relevance to the plot or the story or anything except adding time to the movie. d) Oh, gad, the dialog is soooo slow and boring you want to rip your ears off just so something interesting will happen. e) Acting? Wut dat? f) Music. Ewwww. Just ewwww.... Either the soundtrack was also sold as the intermission music used in Drive-Ins throughout the 60s and 70s, or the other way around.

In fact, it would be hard to list a single redeeming feature ANYWHERE in this movie. The only reason it got a "1" rating from me is because they don't allow negative numbers.

I do not recommend you find an original copy. It's only tolerable with the MST3k commentary track. In fact, it's so full of things to complain about and make fun of that this is clearly the only way to watch it -- either with friends just as capable as the Mistie writers, or with the assistance of the Mistie writers.

review_title: Above criticism, as far as I am concerned
review_detailed_main: Some films are strange enough that they defy classification. This is one of them. There are many weird low-budget films out there, but this one is one of the rare examples that becomes genuine outsider art (Tales From The Quadead Zone, The Meateater, A Night To Dismember, Weasels Rip My Flesh, Fateful Findings, and Death Bed: The Bed That Eats are the other films that I would consider to be outsider art). Yes, I am an unrepentant fan of trashy b-movies, but I don't care what any of you mainstream clowns think. This is a masterpiece.

review_title: 1 hour of my life I would never get back
review_detailed_main: Damn, this movie was just terrible. You have the funny terribly and you have the painfully terrible. This was painful to watch.

This film is the result of a bet between a screenwriter and a fertilizer seller. The result is fantastic: every dollar you see in the film, you can see the love for what is before our eyes, there is that love that distinguishes the genius from the amateur. While the performances are horrible, the music is distinguished, certain sequences that provoke hilarity and a couple of shots that show that almost anyone can make good cinema. It's a bad movie but made with so much love that it became a classic.

review_title: Should have been final episode of MST3K!
review_detailed_main:
After seeing the MST3K episode in which this movie plays I realized that never in the history of cinema has there ever been, nor can anyone ever achieve, a worse film than 'Manos' The Hands of Fate (I wish there was something lower than 1 I could give this piece of carp). It is so incredibly bad that if it were broadcast on every channel in the world simultaneously, non-stop around the clock, it would have succeeded in breaking the will of every human being on Earth and forced them to obey the one man capable of turning it off: Clayton Forrester! This movie should have been the final episode of MST3K in which Mike/Joel/Crow/Servo's will is finally and permanently destroyed and they bow before Dr. Forrester and beg him to end the movie (Crow's line's lifted from 'Aliens' during this episode "Game over man, game over!"). Thus the series should have ended with Dr. F. sitting in a throne wearing 'the Master's robe with T.V.'s Frank beside him holding the Torgo staff in his hands and stock footage of various people bowing in worship. If anyone that has actually seen this film thinks they have found one even worse please post it's name here so that I, and everyone else, can be forewarned of the potential terrors that lie behind that seemingly harmless Blockbuster rental that exists in our future.

P.S. Vote to make 'Manos' #1 on the bottom 100!

review_title: so bad & ridiculous that it's a must see!
review_detailed_main: So bad & ridiculous that it's a must see! one of those "we got lost in Texas" films. in some ways precursor to Texas Chainsaw Massacre. One wonders if Toby Hooper had seen this film. The bright red hands robe costume it is actually pretty effective. the music is really strange as well. might've been fun to see at a drive in theater back in the day.
With the help of MST3K, this is a pretty funny movie, funny enough to be rather enjoyable. Without MST3K, the production value of this movie is so bad that it's close to unwatchable.

review_title: Why this isn't #1 on the bottom 100 is beyond me.
review_detailed_main:
I watched the MST3K version just to see how bad the worst movie ever could be. Could it really be that bad? Simply put, yes it is. Every aspect of this movie is horrible. Any present day filmmaker (professional or amateur) would have to work awfully hard to deliberately make a worse movie. The acting, dialog, sound, cinematography, plot, subplot, action, and music are all the worst I've ever seen. I'm a screen writing major and amateur filmmaker myself, so I've sat through a lot of movies. I was laughing hysterically (mostly at the MST3K's jokes) at how bad and horrendously this movie was put together.

For anyone out there making a movie of your own, and tormented with feelings of inadequacy or doubt at your own talents, I would advise you to watch this (the MST3K version first). Nothing you make could possibly be this bad. FYI: The regular version is available on DVD. I bought it cheap online to see if I can stand to view it.

And as the movie's stupid, insulting ending finally faded out, I got up with an uneasy feeling in my body, knowing I'd never sit through a movie that bad as long as I shall live. I think I've made my point.

This movie was awful in ways that cannot be expressed with any human language. After having watched it, even with the help of MST3K, I was surprised to find the universe allowed this movie to continue existing.

Worst. Movie. Ever.

review_title: You've heard it before, but here it is again
review_detailed_main:
I'm sure you've read other reviews of this movie. Having seen the movie myself, I can safely say that it is true what they say about this movie being the worst in cinematic history.

I heard about this movie from a friend, he then showed it to a few other friends. The verdict was unanimous. "It was the worst film in cinematic history".

Now, I've heard this phrase a few times, but the look of sheer stun and shock in their eyes told me that this time, it was for real. So my friend shows me the movie, and I feel like I've learned something about the world. You know, the way that third -orld criminals learn something when they have their eyes gouged out.

This movie is a must-see for anyone who has an under appreciation for movies. The phrase "at least it wasn't Manos" will become the new norm.

I'm usually pretty generous with movies. I work in a theater and see films for free on the big screen on opening night (or later if the former statement is not possible). I've even come to appreciate Steven Seagal's career as a result of Manos.

It isn't possible to explain WHY it's such a bad movie, I guess the only real purpose of this review is to help put Manos back on the top of the worst 100 list. Back where it belongs.

See it, and you too be awed at shocked at what is without question the reigning lord of all terrible movies.

I ought to convey the impact of Manos, its vital importance, and fan the flames of MANOS. OH! The great meaning MANOS consequently give to one! If desire to open ones mind, to view without elite, bias, stubborn, and easily influenced eyes, necessary. Bleakness shines through IMDb ratings, encouraging or rather discouraging viewing MANOS! I FIGHT BACK! I presume the ratings done that of distasteful, disrespectful, and with a dash of repugnance. (In relation to Manos being in the top 100 worst films of all time.) I am more than keen on Manos; this film is in the top ten of my personal favorite films. The character TORGO (rip) will for eternity stay in my spirit, psyche, and core. Thinking of him encourages an excited fuel of happiness to fire up into my heart and convey through sounds of laughter. Torgo plays character that of a horrendous monster; the deformities Torgo contains still disturb my psyche. THE END?

I recently picked up a copy of MST3K's "Manos: The Hands of Fate" and have watched it twice (so I could see if it was really as bad as I thought it was the first time).

It was WORSE.

The ONLY credit I will give to this film is that the underlying (more like buried) concept is actually somewhat scary when you think about it (for those that have seen it, of course).

Thing is, they did NOTHING right in this movie.

The acting was so awful that it was mind-boggling. The plot was almost non-existent. The cinematography was hideous. The design was shoddy. Half the scenes had no relevance to whatever minor flow the movie had to begin with. It was, however, another one of MST3K's shining moments (but even they were often in awe of how miserable this flick is!)

To date, this is the worst movie I have ever seen. Though not by much, it's worse than "Space Mutiny" (and that's saying A LOT). I REALLY don't want to imagine this movie without Joel and the robots.

review_title: Bad, but I kinda enjoy it.

review_detailed_main: This movie is almost glorious in it's terrible nature. It's shot with a hand-held camera has no really cohesive or logical plot. The characters are ridiculous (mainly Torgo) and the storyline itself is all over the place. The Master's outfit is pretty cool however, especially with the large red hands (the manos perhaps?) that are on his robe. From the weird opening song, to the ending (which is so horrible that it makes the rest of the movie even more painful.)Yea, this movie is best watched in some altered state of consciousness, because otherwise, by the time you hit the one hour mark, you'll want to commit suicide like the director did. However, the MST3K version is delightful and highly recommended.

review_title: The worst movie i've ever seen
review_detailed_main: It was so bad, even Mystery Science Theater 3000 couldn't help it. I still talk about it. The only part I found memorable was an *extended* helicopter shot of the car driving past cornfields, and Crow (from MST3000) narrating, "We drove on for what seemed like minutes." There, now you don't have to watch it!

review_title: The sound of one jaw dropping
review_detailed_main:
I finally caught up with this. . .ummm, "film". . .not realizing it occupied the Number One spot on the IMDb Bottom 100. Subsequently discovering that fact did not surprise me in the least. This movie is not just bad, it's astoundingly bad. Everything about it, and I mean everything, from the wholly inappropriate soundtrack and pathetic sets to the leaden-paced direction and bizarre "plot", is about as inept as could be. Yet somehow it actually seems to be a sincere attempt at making a serious thriller! Equally surprising is that this appears to have been created by (apparently) functioning adults and not a group of 10-year-olds who have been given a camera and some cheesy costumes. The tired phrase, "What could they have been thinking?" only begins to express one's incredulity. Most people view this in its MST3K version, which is probably the only way to view it without sustaining serious injury from having your jaw drop onto the floor.

To have to award this "film" even 1 star is giving it WAY too much credit. Even the most boring family's camcorder footage of their last vacation to the Poconos would put this to shame.

Nothing in this world compares to the level that this movie has sunk to. I watched it as the MST3K version, and not even they could make the movie bearable. If you ever hear someone suggest watching this movie, stop them and pick out ANY other movie. Do not waste your life like I have. The acting is horrible and makes even the worst Hollywood actor today seem like award material. The plot, well I'm still searching for its point. The writer who penned out this script must be a very badly trained monkey. I'm sorry for the insult, but this movie has no redeeming quality. Even the "evil" scientists in MST3K were apologizing for showing Joe and the robots the movie. I hope that no one else will have to go through the pain that is watching this movie. I can now tell why it was on MST3K, but even then, its not bearable. Do not watch this movie at all costs.

Where do I start with this one? There's not a single thing about this that prevents it from being one of the worst films I've ever seen.

The amount of technical problems become very clear very quickly. The painfully obvious continuity errors, the awful overdubbing (which was supposedly done my three people - voicing all the actors in the film), the abysmal acting and the fact that the film is a complete bore (despite its runtime of just over an hour).

I mean, this film isn't even worthy of a 'so-bad-it's-good' status. It really is that bad.

However, the Torgo character is definitely intriguing especially after reading up on John Reynolds (the actor who plays Torgo) which explained many things about his character.

Overall, I think Manos is better studied than enjoyed since the latter is virtually impossible.

1/10

Okay, so there's this mad cult-type demonic dude trying to get more wives. The so-called "scary" part of this movie is the couple who end up at this shack where the demonic dude lives, and they can't get out. The whole movie is wrapped around one question...should the couple's 6 year-old daughter also be a wife, or be killed? At the end of the movie, there is one scene where the husband points the gun directly into the camera and fires. At that point you really wish it was loaded and did hit you to end the misery. The creature, Torgo, turns out is supposed to be a satyr. The director, apparently, just decided to stuff his knees with pillows and had him walk funny. If you really hate the director, well...he's the husband in the movie. He is a fertilizer salesman in real life, and this movie was done on a bet that anyone could make a movie. Boy, does it show!

I'm talking about Manos: Hands of Fate, which is widely regarded as the worst film ever. I first saw it thru MST3K, like most people. I found myself wondering what the "uncut" version had been like (the MST DVD did not come with the "original" version of the movie, like many MST DVDs do.) I finally broke down and bought the unMSTed DVD on Amazon, just to see the "unedited" version. (I'll say this, the MST version was actually in better, less crackly shape.) Yes, the original "Manos" is still slow-moving, with endless shots of countryside that serve no purpose. Yes, the acting is atrocious. Yes, there's continuity holes galore (When exactly is the Master going to actually kill Torgo, anyway??). These are all things that can also be said about the original "Carnival Of Souls", which is (rightly) considered a classic camp/horror masterpiece.

The characters of the Master and Torgo are two of the most widely laughed at in film history, but they're also the best performances in this film. Tom Neyman as the Master is honestly evil-looking and scary, especially in the couple of scenes they cut out for the MST version. The late John Reynolds' spazzy performance as Torgo can only half be attributed to the drugs he was allegedly on at the time; the guy was either a for-real mental case, or he was damn good at acting like one. Director/Father Harold P. Warren voiced all the male characters in the widely-razzed voice-over-- and I happen to think he did a rather good job. Sure, they all sound alike-- but only a little bit. And tell me you can imagine Torgo with any other voice! In nearly every frame, you can see what they were *trying* to do (and might have succeeded at, had they been in more capable hands). The seemingly pointless teens kissing in the car serve as part of the "fate" concept-- if only the cops hadn't come along and shoved them off, the father might have been able to ask them for proper directions to get out of there. Or perhaps the teens are prisoners of the Master themselves! The ludicrous name of the "god" Manos-- actually quite fitting, since the cult is worshipping the fickle hands of fate. The ending is honestly skincrawly, finding out what happened to the couple's little girl-- and what's about to happen to the two new, roadtripping girlfriends.

It's said that various people (Tarantino for one) are thinking of actually remaking "Manos". Here's hoping they never do. The fact that no one ever heard of any of the cast before or since contributes greatly to the eerie, last-known-photograph feel of the film. To see it remade with big name actors who are only capable of playing themselves-as-cult-hero would make it every bit as inane and bad as people are already saying the original "Manos" is. Let's leave it with the little bit of dignity is has, shall we?

Cinema Saints forgive me, I love this film, but I'm giving it a 1 star rating in order to have it enjoy the status of THE WORST MOVIE EVER! Of course it's not, it's a fun watch and the more the merrier. Many other bad films will be forgotten - rightly so; this one - NEVER!

As a connoisseur of crummy films I thought I'd seen some bad movies. Little did I realize how bad movies could really be, until I came across this piece of dross. Ed Wood, everyones favourite failure, actually turns out to be a fairly competent film-maker when compared to Hal Warren. After sitting through Manos (if you can) you'd pay big money to watch Glen or Glenda instead, so excruciating is the experience. Even watching the much lauded MST3K treatment of Manos proved to be a chore, even with Joel and the Bots mercilessly ripping the film to shreds with wisecracks. I don't think I've actually stayed awake through the entire movie in one sitting yet, only catching it in installments between lapsing into defensive comas during several viewings.

I realize people might read these reviews or check out the bottom 100 listings here at IMDb and think, "wow, I must watch this film that's getting all these comments" but you have to believe me when I say that you REALLY don't want to sit through this garbage if you can at all avoid it. Films like 'Space Mutiny' and 'Future War' are hilariously bad, something you can laugh at because they're so ineptly made, but this one lowers the bar even more and frankly it just hurts to watch. It's very very slow, stupid, poorly lit, badly acted and the highlight of this crap is Torgo, a character that in any other movie would get about a minute of screen time and be forgotten. In this crud he shines like a silver coin in a chimney-sweeps earhole.

review_title: It's....well....you've gotta watch it to understand
review_detailed_main:
I don't think there's much that I can say about this film that hasn't yet been said, but really it's just a fun waste of and hour or two. But make sure not to watch it alone, because your head might explode. Get the MST3K version (buy the essentials) and get some friends together and get ready to have a good time. I laughed until it hurt.

A quick introduction to the movie if you haven't heard anything of it: A father, mother, and daughter (with their trusty poodle) are en route to some sort of lodge for vacation, when they are lost. They find a shack in the middle of nowhere, where a crazy guy named Torgo lets them stay but warns them of the master. I don't want to give any more away because something has to keep you going. Good Luck!

I saw this movie (as most people probably did) as a Mystery Science Theater 3000 show. The constant rips into the film by the Satellite of Love crew is the only way I would have been able to sit through this steaming pile of wonderment. The camera work, acing, pacing, ah, who am I kidding? The drive to the doomed hotel is torture alone.

Everything was bad is this film. I think the people who made this movie were clinically dead creatively. While I support low-budget film, there is not one single clever, original or memorable moment in this film. At best the film borderlines on gratuitous exploitation.

Wait, I take that back.

Redemption comes via the infamous "Torgo theme" with its monotonous 4-note theme is still a popular in-joke between my friends and I. I still wonder to this day why they never made a soundtrack to this movie.

Hate someone you know? Send them this movie. Only MST3K made this movie bearable enough to watch (I enjoyed the "Manos" reference in the MST3K movie. Classic).

review_title: Manos, thou of primal darkness, mud-wrestling, and drug-addled easy listening jazz.
review_detailed_main: Behold, children, if you dare, Manos the Hands of Fate. The literal brainchild of star, director, writer, producer and crap-salesman Harold P. Warren, this is the Necronomicon of modern film; as you view it, your sanity is slowly nibbled away. It would seem given the experience of the crew, one shouldn't bash this film so badly. Wrong. A 10 year old could make a marginally better film than this stillborn brainchild of a fertilizer salesman. The characters and settings are so clichéd one of the only original things about this movie is it features a mini documentary of various bean fields and hills hosted by an Alto who sounds as if she's in extreme pain. Tor-goat seems like a bum they pulled out of the streets and slapped prosthetics onto. The "wonderful" subplot of him being a Satyr is killed by a deadly team of bad camera-work and sloppy writing. To those not in the know, he's just a creepy beard-man in serious need of more comfortable kneepads. He and the master's "eerie" presence is denoted by "eerie-er" free-style jazz that sounds like something Charlie parker threw up, Tito Puente cooked and Kenny G garnished and ate. No, that applies to the rest of the movie. It's just so mind-bogglingly bad that it's impossible to watch without heckling it. Probably the best way to watch this is with the help of Joel Hogsdon, Kevin Murphy, and Trace Beaulieu in the MST3K version.

Many people told me Manos is the worse movie they have ever seen. I couldn't believe, so I had a chance to watch the movie. Well it is extremely bad. The movie isn't that long, but it feels like it lasts 3 hours. It feels that nearly 50% of the movie involves watching the mountains and trees along the road. The other part of the movie is the couple that seems to be in a kissing marathon for three straight days and had nothing to do with the movie except being pulled over by the police on several occasions. Now the women wrestling don't even look as believable and the story line and plot? What story line. How about the acting. Well their acting is a as perfect as a three year old reciting poetry in front of the class. It is that perfect. The entire cast of actors have a true talent of appearing to be a three year old acting ability. The most ridiculous part of the movie are that unusual fat legs that walks wobbly. Funny why this guy with a leg problem cares to help carry the luggage, he can't even walk! If you dare to watch the real Manos the Hands of Fate, you will fall dead. Please watch the MST3K version. Be warned, you will go into comatose.

review_title: Truly One Of The Worst Horror films I've Ever Seen.
review_detailed_main:
This seems like it was a totally avoidable situation.

Why not turn around when you are clearly lost and your wife is suggesting it?

How could you possibly think it is a good idea to stay the night at the random house of some hillbily tweaker, who has a "master" that is "no longer with us, but with us always"?...with your wife and child, no less?

Why would you not up and leave when your dog is killed?

These are some of the questions that will leave you flabbergasted after watching this film.

Talk about warning signs.

There are just so many questionable decisions in this, that defy all reason.

All he needed to do was listen to his damn wife....once! Just once! And everything would have been fine.

It's all her imagination!?

I'm not sure who's trippin harder...Targo the hillbilly tweaker?...or this dude?...

Of course, by the time he grows half a brain and gets some sense...their car has broken down...despite running perfectly fine only moments before.

Then he's a total a-hole to the guy who is quite liable to murder them in their sleep, so that he can keep his wife as his slave.

And gets so distracted that his daughter just wanders off into the desert that just consumed their poor puppy.

Luckily for him, she wanders back with a doberman...saying she got it from "a dark place" "with lots of fun people".

These "fun people" happen to be "the master" and his six wives, who are stuck in some deep trance-like sleep.

Apparently Targo the tweaker only sticks around because he dreams of having one of his master's wives...though, now he'd prefer this dude's wife instead.

Quite predictably, he attacks the dude, and binds him to a tree, just as his master and his wives are awakening to the darkness of the night.

He's not Manos, himself, however.

Rather, a priest of Manos, who seeks to bring eternal darkness to the world in Manos' name.

Meanwhile, his wives are upset about a female child being brought into their realm.

Most want to kill it, so they can initiate her mother into their harem, as their master's newest wife.

So there is infighting between them, as the newer ones receive more attention than the older ones.

And as some of the older wives argue in defense of the child.

Eventually the dude escapes his bindings, and his family makes a half assed break for it...before inexplicably returning to this house of horrors.

Ultimately leading to the absolutely stupid conclusion of the film.

Literally nothing in the plot of this film makes any sense.

The acting is bad.

And the voiceovers are worse.

The soundtrack is overbearing.

And the camerawork is mediocre at best.

I'm honestly confused how any of this came to fruition.

Or why someone thought that releasing this was a good idea.

Let alone how it spawned an NES game.

It all really makes Birdemic look like a masterpiece.

One of the worst horror films I've ever seen, for sure.

1.5 out of 10.

review_title: Watching this film was the peak of my petty existence
review_detailed_main:
A true masterpiece of cinema, Manos will not disappoint. From the breathtaking views of the gorgeous, sprawling countryside to the terrifying horrors inflicted by the dark and nefarious Master, few things in life can match the visual and auditory splendor that is Manos (Hands):The Hands of Fate. I wouldn't want to spoil even a single delicious morsel of this, the epitome of cinematic storytelling, but I must say that watching this movie is the most fear-inspiring experience that any person, being, or object could ever possibly have. Written, directed, and produced by fertilizer salesman Harold Warren as the result of a bet and featuring REAL FOOTAGE of a snake from a Disney nature documentary, Manos is truly a work to behold.

If you are ever granted even the slightest, minuscule possibility to have even a tiny, insignificant fraction a chance to maybe conceivably see this movie, then TAKE IT! No matter what the cost, no matter what you would lose, YOU MUST TAKE IT! Nothing that could happen to you would ever top the experience of seeing this movie! I would give up everything I have if it meant i could see even part of Manos for the first time again! Seriously. Drop whatever your doing and watch it. It's worth it.

I can't wait for the sequel.

review_title: You know the film is bad when the only memorable thing is the villain's robe.
1 Fertilizer Salseman+1 Gigantic thighed actor= 1 disaster
review_detailed_main:
Wow. Anyone who thinks that this was a better movie than Baby Geniuses 2 obviously has never had to suffer through this sad 74 minute excuse for a feature film. I would have to say that I would rather watch an hour and a half of Public Access TV or even static than have to torture myself by viewing Manos again. If the government took suspected terrorists and made them watch this video until they gave up information, we wouldn't even have to interrogate them! The acting was terrible, there was no comprehensible plot and machinery at a construction site sounds better than its soundtrack. If you for whatever reason MUST watch this movie, then do yourself a favor and watch the MST3k version. And one more thing: "Manos" means "hand in Spanish, making the translated title "Hand: The Hands of Fate."

Drama (wait, there was drama in this movie?) Movie Score (1/10) Overall Movie Score (1/10) Not Recommended to anyone who does not want to kill off their brain cells

Manos was famous for being the undisputed worst movie ever, and now I look on IMDb and it's down to #11. I can understand some of these movies (monster a go-go) being voted worse than this, but not movies that sort of make sense (from justin to kelly, and don't get me wrong, this movie deserves a bottom 10 rating). Manos should at least be in the bottom 5. If you try to view this piece of sh*t without MST3K, you'll understand how dreadful this misadventure really is, and want to see it in its rightful place in history: on the very bottom of the bottom 100.

On another note, I've seen Superbabies (don't ask me why), and if MST3K were still around, this garbage would be on it. It's pretty damn funny, and truly as terrible as it's #2 rating would suggest. Superbabies is what an Ed Wood film would have looked like if he had a budget. Don't sleep on Superbabies, it's as bad as you think, but Monster a go-go and Manos are still worse.

review_title: One of the best... examples of a bad movie
review_detailed_main:
It is not just badly acted. It is badly cast. Even the dogs can't act. The wardrobe is hideous. The story is so lame it will be wise to have a nurse in the room while you are watching it to remind you to blink your eyes once in a while.

The little girl's mom must have been deeply in debt to the director or she would have been allowed to run from the set after the first five minutes of filming. Even a five year old could see this was a stinker.

The first to realize this film, or whatever it is classified as, was a bomb, were the musicians who scored it. The music is pitifully poor quality throughout. It must have been the only way for the horn players to keep their dignity intact, by trying to match the movie's rock bottom status with something that sounds atrocious. They were successful in reaching a depth of screechiness and an end song with lyrics that sought and found zero listenability.

I want to say something nice about the movie. The two 35 year old teen-agers necking in the car were not as bad as the deputies who mimed interest in gunfire at night in the desert. The catfight scene made other scenes in the movie seem better by comparison.

Do you suppose a real script of this exists today or ever existed? If there was a script would someone have saved it for some reason? Do you think there were any rewrites to the original story that might actually have been worse? Who was the doberman's agent? What did he have against dogs? Look at the sofa where the little girl sleeps. What are those garbage stains? This is otherwise a fine motion picture that every high school student should watch if they are sent to detention.

Tom Willett

review_title: Nice Cars & Pretty Women - Lousy Movie
review_detailed_main: There's so much to say about this movie from Torgo's extra eyebrow and messed-up legs - well, Torgo is just plain messed-up. I love the now classic cars. Diane Adelson as Margaret is a lousy actor, like everyone else in this movie, but at least she's attractive even though she can't seem to run for more than a minute at a time without falling and whining. The poor little girl lost her doggie, and all her dad can do is tell her to shut up. There's a lot more, but it's not worth rehashing. And, oh yeah, shouldn't the credits be at the beginning of the movie?

Some would have you believe that the best episode of the venerable MST3K series was the Manos: The Hands of Fate episode, I am quite afraid it was not. They have absolutely nothing to work with and it shows, even Hobgoblins and Future War had unintentionally humorous moments that Mike and the Bots could capitalize off of. Joel, Tom, and Crow were not so lucky here, for Manos did not even manage that, it is bad in the same way a failed comedy is. The only laughs come from stunned disbelief at how truly hideous this films is and even those will fade as the movie wears on and on and on and on.

As mentioned, the problem is that there is nothing to see in this film, nothing to laugh at or to spark the interest. Plan 9 From Outer Space was a bad film, but at least it had the benefit of being laughably inept. Most bad horror films share this, as, if nothing else, you can always laugh at the poorly realized monster and cheesy plot. Manos, on the other hand, is just there.

Is it the worst film of all time? Probably not, there's bound to be something out there that is even worse; a few completed films were never even released because of how bad they were.

Does it have the worst direction, acting, and production values ever? Doubtful, I am quite certain there is a student film out there somewhere that exceeds Manos in all of these categories. Besides, the crew actually managed to turn the camera on.

Is it the most loathsome film ever because of the ending? Not at all, there are many German films out there after all and they are quite bad all the way through.

No, Manos even refuses to excel at being the worst. Anybody who loves movies should see it though, just to see how not to make a movie, even a bad one.

As a horror movie this is a 0/10. As an entertaining movie this is a 0/10. As a movie where the expectations of the common viewer are to be met, this movie is a 0/10. But as a surrealistic movie this is a 10/10! Not all movies are about Santa Claus or good/evil... Well, the above is my comment: but something in the system doesn't let me say what I think unless I write a lot more. Well, this is my first review (in a language that is neither my first or my second) so I'm a bit shy. They (whoever they are) tell me to write at least ten lines - so I write ten lines. But, I've seen comments that were much shorter than mine. And I'm shy as a new poster and I'm stunned by the qualities of the film - this is not one of the ten worst films ever, it is one of the ten most misunderstood films ever (probably even by the directors!). And you have to stand it for at lest 40 minutes (well, yes the beginning is somewhat slow) before (and if!) you get hooked.

review_title: Textbook example of how NOT to make a good film...
review_detailed_main:
This film is a textbook example of how not to direct a film, write a screenplay, act, or compose a soundtrack.

Originally conceived by fertilizer salesman extraordinaire, Hal Warren, who directs, produces, writes, and stars, "Manos" is perhaps the worst film ever made. Warren knew some big shots in Hollywood and thought he'd try to play with the big boys. What he comes up with is one of the most painful experiences you can possibly imagine. Several times while watching the film (especially during the opening segment which features endless minutes of the main characters driving around) I thought I'd die from laughing too hard. This film makes your stomach muscles hurt. Even after the film is well over, you're still laughing, wondering how such a film could possibly be made.

While the technical mistakes might be able to be forgiven, make no mistake: Warren effortlessly throws in every bad movie cliche in the book without even knowing it, from the stereotypical "weak" female protagonist, to the laughably bad wrestling scene. To give you some idea, one of the main characters is nearly killed by women in white dresses who slap him.

Combine this with a script that is about three pages long, a plot that doesn't even make sense, banal music, and out of focus camera work, and you have a truly horrible and wonderful experience known only as "Manos": The Hands of Fate.
Its awful,boring and stupid,so bad,dont waste your time with this

review_title: Every Bit as Bad and Fascinating as They Say ...
review_detailed_main: Full Review on my blog max4movies: Manos: The Hands of Fate is a horror movie about a young family being trapped in a lodge in the desert, while its owner summons the evil demon Manos. Conventional criteria of quality can't really be used for describing the movie's features, as there are countless apparent flaws in the production, e.g., the plot, the acting quality, and the editing. However, in a way, all these problematic technical aspects sum up to a fascinating experience that doesn't bears any resemblance to what most come to expect from movies in general. Therefore, it can be watched for escapist entertainment, mocking the low quality or even for technical analyses. Ultimately, as a movie, Manos: The Hands of Fate, can only be recommended as a prime example of what not to do. Read my full review on my blog movie-discourse.

review_title: The absolute worst movie ever made.
review_detailed_main:
Like many of the other reviewers, the only reason I give this film a one is because it is not possible to give it a lower rating. Believe me, if I could I'd give it a negative ten star rating. It is just that bad.

There are so many things wrong with this movie:

1. The actors all just happen to be completely talentless, and I'm pretty sure that the majority of them are on Valium or something. They don't make the mistake of overacting, which at least would be entertaining to the audience. Instead, they underact in the worst way. No matter what the situation, the dull, drugged expression will not leave their faces.

2. The dialog, or rather the lack thereof, is simply atrocious. There is so much repetition, which might have been okay if the actors had only had any feeling or emotion in their voices.

3. The story. Some parts of this movie were so bad that I couldn't even watch anymore. I had to just close my eyes and force myself to breathe. I'm pretty sure that at one point, the overall atrociousness of this movie brought tears to my eyes.

4. The action. WHO taught these actors to slap? Who taught them to fight? Those fight scenes were pathetic, and no human could ever have been injured in one of those rows. Honestly.

There are at least three hundred other negative things to say about this movie, but if I got into those, I'd be here all night. I swear, I couldn't have made a movie that bad if I'd tried, and I doubt anyone else in the universe could either. It's almost as though they were trying to make THE worst movie ever, and succeeded.

The MST3K version of this movie is absolutely hysterical, however, and I think that everyone should watch it. Just make sure you don't make the mistake of watching the original version. You might not make it out alive.

review_title: A film that lives up to its reputation
review_detailed_main: I have seen quite a few bad films in my time but this one is up there with the worst of them. I wasn't even really entertained personally and I am glad MST3K made it more entertaining because by itself it is dreadful. I do have to say that John Reynolds, the actor who played Torgo, gave the most interesting performance. From what I've read, he reportedly spent a good deal of his time on the film high, and I think you could see that was probably true. But let's be honest, how could anyone agree to and then go through with appearing in this stinker without a little help from their friends? I don't do drugs myself, but I felt like I must've been on something to be able to sit through this snoozer for that long. This only became a classic due to the MST3K episode and there is no way this would have ever gotten a sequel without it. Yes, that's right, there's a sequel. Pick your jaw up from off the floor and either watch the MST3K version or don't bother.

What can be said about "Manos: the Hands of Fate?" "Manos" is simply the worst piece of cinema ever made. Bad color, half-ass sound dubbing, a written on the fly script, and really pathetic acting make this barely viewable.

I would "only" watch the Mystery Science Theater version, otherwise you might risk serious nerve damage

They should show "Manos" to prisoners.

This film is only good for a few laughs. The problem is that the laughable parts take so much effort to get to.

Telling anyone the plot wouldn't spoil anything. Family checks into a hotel that is actually a trap set by a Manos-worshipper to attract new wives.

Mostly, the charm of this movie is in its complete lack of both technique and style. It really looks like the same level of film making as a really bad silent movie. In fact, some of the scenes have absolutely no dialogue. Occasionally a clip of someone saying something is spliced into otherwise static scenes - either as an afterthought, or because of a compete inability to record spoken word.

There is no acting in this movie. There is only speaking lines.

To truly enjoy this movie on any level, you really have to see the Mystery Science Theater 3000 showing.

review_title: Arguably the most inept movie ever.
review_detailed_main:
This is probably the most famous movie in the history of MST3K. I heard for the longest time about this movie, but that still couldn't brace me for how bad it was. I was so dumbfounded at this movie that a occasionally forgot to pay attention to the jokes. Dubbed voices, lousy cinemetography, non-existent direction, horrible acting, inept editing and a soundtrack that makes Albert Glasser sound like John Williams. Not to mention a surprise ending that's both stupid and revolting (I'm thinking about the little girl here).

I guess it's appropriate that this movie was made by a fertilizer salesman because fertilizer is about the only thing this movie is good for. That and making a classic MST3K episode. The only thing scary about this movie is the fact that time and money were actually spent in making it. Good thing Hal Warren stuck with his day job.

review_title: no way the film makers were serious when they made this!

review_detailed_main: This isn't even fun. There is no plot. Three dumb people end up at a house in the country. There is all this whining about being tired and not going another step. Imagine one look at that guy and the strange surrounding would send anyone fleeing. Not these people. They go in anyway. Before they are bored to death, things start happening. What things. I don't care. They have all the time in the world to get back in the car and go. Good grief, they could have slept in the car. Then there are those two kids, necking in the other car. It must be a marathon session. They have been parking for about four days. Oh well. We get to meet the master who runs around in funny pajamas and apparently has a way with the ladies who do weird things, crawling all over each other. Of course, by the time they do decided to leave, the father can't get the car started. The wife wails and that insipid little girl just kind of stands around. The ending is so dumb, you have to see it. Well, that's a new low!

review_title: If you don't like this film, you're probably just stupid and ignorant.
review_detailed_main:
This is the very best film ever made. The direction of Hal Warren is amazing, and ranks at the top with other grand master visualists such as Kurosawa, Fellini, Bergman, Truffaut, Scorsese, Kubrick, Michael Bay and McG.

The acting is compelling. John Reynolds perfectly embodies the deformed "Torgo." Hal Warren display similarly impressive skills in _front_ of the camera as Michael, the dense man who, after being told "The Master will not be happy" about his family's presence at a creepy old mansion run by a weirdo who can barely walk, tells his wife she is "imagining things" when Torgo tells her that the Master likes her, and is dead, but not dead the way they are familiar with.

The screenplay is superb. Realistic dialogue flows like cheap champagne at one of Paris Hilton's parties. I also particularly loved the Bergman-style shots of nothing-ness -- for example, the opening, which is a ten minute montage of mid-west scenery. Kubrick would be jealous.

I also loved how all the conversation takes place through facial expressions. When Michael and Normal American Family first meet Torgo, no exchange of dialogue takes place for over thirty seconds. At first, I thought it was just due to Hal Warren being a totally incompetent director with very poor editing skills. But later, I realized it was all in the gestures of Torgo's face, as he stares at them with icy emotion. He's translating a message: "I'm here, I'm Torgo, I'm sad and lonely." What a beautiful, poetic and truly moving scene. It made me cry, Warren has transcended the genre here - this ranks in the top class of all films of the past century - forget "Citizen Kane," forget "Seven Samurai," forget "Pearl Harbor." This is the best movie ever made, and if you disagree, you're probably just stupid and ignorant.

review_title: 70 Minutes of MANOS Feel Like an Eternity: Still, Worthwhile as a Curio
review_detailed_main: It's just a shoddy 70-minute grade-Z feature, but watching it you feel like time becomes molasses, it passes so slowly. It's an ordeal to watch MANOS, it truly is. Good for a drinking game (like: which shots are in focus or not, or spotting continuity errors - Hell, the whole movie is a continuity error!), but only with beer, not hard liquor! Every 3 seconds or so something goes wrong: continuity, framing, dubbing, acting, editing (!!!!), dialogue, music, cinematography - EVERYTHING goes wrong, and all of the time. It becomes clear after the first 10 seconds that no person involved in the production had ANY history in making or starring in movies. The incompetence is unparalleled. Edward D. Wood Jr. (Glen or Glenda, Plan 9 from Outer Space) would rotate in his grave to witness such rampant inanity. They used 1 woman and 2 men to dub ALL the characters in the film, which was shot with a silent camera (Brilliantly, they did no record the audio separately, leaving the dubbers without a clue about what was actually being said!!!). MANOS is fascinating for two people involved in the production: John Reynolds, who played Torgo (and is obviously on LSD all the time - he killed himself shortly after production had wrapped and never saw the finished film - lucky him!) and Tom Neymar, who not only played The Master (whose plans remain as foggy as the cinematography) but also made his own costume and painted his self-portrait which is central to this movie. They're all dead now, including Harold Warren, who made this "film" on a whim. MANOS stands there as the epitome of cinematic ineptitude - but it's not funny bad, it's just bad. Now, if you really want to watch a so-bad-it's-good movie, seek out SAMURAI COP! Now, that's an entertaining fiasco. This one, it's just a fiasco.

I have tried, repeatedly to watch this movie all the way through and have never succeeded. I love movies like this, but wow. I cannot get over the continuity errors. Worst editing ever. The sound is so bad. But the score is actually original, but dated and slightly cheesy, probably recorded by some music major that the producers knew or something.

Plan 9 from outer space you can watch all the way through. It actually keeps your attention. If this was a concept piece like a Warhol film or something it would be more explicable at least.

Plot? Some family, with a kid who randomly disappears from the shot then reappears gets a flat tire, and meets some weird guy at a house, then you fall asleep for awhile due to lack of dialogue or anything and wake up drooling on yourself when the movie is over.

review_title: a masterpiece of crap, that makes you think well after you watch it
review_detailed_main:
'Manos' the hands of fate, how to describe a movie made by a manure salesman. well both products(Manos, and manure.) are pretty much have the same value, they both stink.

This movie will make you think, why? why just why. why are Torgo's legs like that? why did they only let 3 people dub this movie.

my suggestion, don't see this movie, unless you want your eyes to bleed.

the mst3k version is better, but not much better, buy it so you can get Santa clause conquers the martians.

1/10

review_title: Pile of You-Know-What Made By A Fertilizer Salesman!

review_detailed_main: Manos: The Hands of Fate. This "movie" is perfect example of how not to make a film. Gross technical mistakes(Shoot the camera already!), sickening dubbing, Torgo's retarded legs, plot which could be described as cheese treated with AP-bullets shot with AK-47s and outrageously bad actors. Combine this with maddening soundtrack and you have Manos. Hall Warren really is awesome guy. He managed to produce something worse than Plan 9 or Eternal Evil of Asia(reaaally classic Hong Kong-horror). If you don't believe this, just check it for yourself. But be prepared for mental mutilation(I can't shake Torgo theme out of my head). Only thing this piece of carbage can be used, is torture(Speak, or you'll watch Manos non-stop for week!). If you have relatives or friends you hate, just tie them to the chair in the front of your computer or VCR and press Play. Use gag if screaming bothers.

review_title: A must see! So terrible, it's fantastic!

review_detailed_main:
A family go on a road trip tosomewhere and wind up getting lost. This is within the first fifteen minutes. How did they manage to pad out a simple plot like that into a quarter of an hour? With tons of shots of the passing countryside as they drive! By the time they get to the house and meet a guy I believe is named Tardo (who has the kind of swag you'd only expect from a guy whose bones are made of gelatin (apparently we're supposed to be scared by gimp-walking)), and I'm not saying that as a joke, I literally think that's the name they call him, you'll be bored out of your mind. Then they get to the house and stay the night becauseI guess people were more trusting back in the day. We're given tons of shots of African furnishings bought from the local Pier One Imports that are supposed to be horrifying.

Anyway, the house is home to some creepy porn-star-cum-cult-leader who wears the stupidest looking poncho/robe I've ever seen. He has a harem of women and sacrifices people to the dark lord Manos. Blah blah blah he takes the family and turns them into his slaves and this movie has no point.

Everything about this movie is stupid. It's not helped by the fact the film is shot horribly and they dub over the film, because getting a microphone would have cost way more than this movie was budgeted! What's even worse is that this movie is seventy minutes and is padded out so much just to reach that mark! So many landscape shots and this pointless focus on a couple of kids making out in the desert (who keep coming back to the same spot again and again for some reason).

The only thing I can give the film credit for is a shot where we're shown the owner of the house and his dog and it cuts to a painting of the two. In better hands, that could have actually been eerily effective. I also thought that the ending, as cliché as it was, would have worked if I understood how the owner of the house survived being shot four times.

Manos is a watchably terrible movie, but it's still garbage.

I'm not even going to begin to try to add anything new to the avalanche of comments / review that you've read for "Manos: The Hands Of Fate". All I will say is that yes, do watch / experience this "thing of beauty". Secondly, try to then watch it again another time. It's almost impossible. It really and truly is: "Humanly Unwatchable".

P.S. The only good thing that I can honestly say came out of the making of "Manos: The Hands Of Fate" are the HILARIOUS reviews and comments that you read on this site. I never knew so many different adjectives could be put together in a sentence like you see here. Whenever I need a REAL laugh I just read some of them. No kidding.

review_title: Horror? Don't be fooled by this well done parody...
review_detailed_main: At least, I think I'm pretty sure this is a parody of other movies. At least....I hope. I just mention this because there's no way it could be a serious horror movie. The "monster" had big knees for a freakish deformity. And of course in most bad movies, the heroes lost. Except for this movie I was happy.

I wanted to swing an ax into my chest after watching this "movie". Did someone really make this on purpose? It seemed like just a bunch of random scenes were shot and thrown together. Like, 80% of the movie consisted of aimless driving and Manos' wives "fighting" it out. Oh, and the great scenes of the characters just staring at each other for minutes on end, I can't forget those.

The best part was when the wife looked for the child. She opened the one door a few inches, peered in, and closed it again. What a thorough inspection! Later we find that it's the same room where Manos (it feels ridiculous to write that every time) and his wives were hibernating. How could she not notice them!?!?! Joel & the Bots made it watchable, barely. Even they didn't have a lot of material to work with, having been reduced to saying, "'Manos' Hands of Fate" about 10 different times because they didn't know what else to say.

I am pretty depressed right now, and this misery will probably be with me for a very long time after watching the dreaded Manos. The pain that Torgo felt after the Master lit his hand on fire is nothing compared to watching this movie.

Movie made by a fertilizer salesman who must have ingested large quantities of the stuff while writing, starring and directing this disasterpiece. You will be simultaneously humored, baffled and incredulous as you watch the confounding plot, absurd characters and bad acting (and I use the terms plot and acting most loosely). If this movie had come out prior to the development of water torture, the Chinese would have just put the tape in the VCR and used the extra water on the lawn.

Worst cinematic mistake ever made.The only way to get through this piece of garbage is to see the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version I saw Plan 9 From Outer Space,and Manos ranks one notch below that movie.There are so many things wrong with Manos that its hard to mention all of them in one review. One of the recurring scenes that annoyed me the most was the "teen" love birds making out in the car.They appear 3 or 4 times throughout the movie as if their car has been parked the whole time.Also,I counted Torgo being murdered twice. Half th movie was made up of riding in the car . Its no wonder that 3 "actors" later wound up committing suicide

review_title: You MUST watch this movie. The master WOULD approve.
review_detailed_main:
An acquaintance at IMDb talked about this infamous turkey in a way that interested me: "If you can cast away your ideas of what a movie ought to be, you may be able to enjoy 'Manos: The Hands of Fate'." Truly, this is the kind of thing one treasures if they are into the weird world of ultra low budget schlock. And this movie, I could honestly say, is one of those little movies that's off in its own (dream) world. It plays out like the events of somebody's insane dream.

Basically, a family - mom, dad (played by writer / producer / director Harold P. "Hal" Warren), and daughter get lost on their way to a place named Valley Lodge and end up at a back-of-the-beyond abode guarded by an oddball named Torgo, played by John Reynolds in all his twitchy glory. Torgo's guarding an entity he dubs The Master (Tom Neyman) who lives with an assortment of "wives". Will this family act normally, and get the Hell out of Dodge, or fall into the standard movie trap of being Stupid People Who Do Stupid Things? You'll just have to watch and see.

The jazzy music score, by Russ Huddleston and Robert Smith, Jr., is just one of the hard-to-resist elements of this thing, which you'll likely watch while shaking your head, and laughing (sometimes simultaneously), or at least shaking your head. Warren stretches out moments to absurd lengths, presumably to get his movies' running time to over an hour long. Torgo in particular operates at about half the normal speed of regular people. And lines of dialogue tend to get repeated over and over - just to make sure we get the point. There's no danger of not knowing any of the character names here!

The acting and the pacing is all awkward, yet Warrens' fumbling of his own material gives "Manos: The Hands of Fate" a genuinely dreamy, out there quality that would make this a perfect midnight movie. One could easily watch this with friends while drinking and making their own wisecracks as it plays out. If they love bad movies, this one has to rank as one of the all time "greats".

Five out of 10.

review_title: Four good reasons to see this movie.
Is this a comedy or a horror?
review_detailed_main: I just watched the MST3K version of this movie (if you want to give it that much credit) and with out Joel, Crow, and Tom I would have killed myself. This is by far the WORST movie I have ever seen. The character of Torgo by himself could ruin any movie, (it looks like the world's biggest bee stung him in the knees). None of the kissing scenes have anything to do with the movie, the voice dubbing is horrible, acting awful, the script should have been used for toilet paper, and the worst sound-track ever. Crow put it best, "It's the haunting Torgo theme." the worst movie ever, but one of the best MST3K.

review_title: It had to be a Dare, it's the only logical answer!
review_detailed_main:
See, I read the guidelines for these review things and it asked me not to spoil any plot points to this movie.

Then I realized, if someone is watching "Manos: The Hands of Fate" for plot reasons they need serious medical treatment. This movie can be compared to this: Imagine if your best friend pushed you off a building, destroying your sense of touch by paralyzing you from the neck down. Then they put you in a chair, made you watch fat people in thongs do the Macarana. Next, they fill your mouth with Vegimyte (kill the whole Taste and Smell Sense with one stone). Finally I would fill the space with magnificent sounds of Gwen's golden voice in "This Sh!t is Bananas."

It is sad when a person starts to ponder in their tiny little head only six minutes into any movie, "Rocky V sounds pretty damn good now."

Well, I read all the comments and read all the reviews and I thought to myself, "This can't be that bad". Then, I saw it. Not only is it that bad, it's much worst.

I can't say much that hasn't already been said, but I will say it's the most disgusting, nauseating, depressing, boring, freakiest, loathsome, stupifying, pathetic, unredeeming, unpleasant, vomit inducing, grotesque, and suck-filled attempt at a movie I've ever seen. Absolutely every aspect of the 'film' is laughable to say the least. And it gets worse, much worse, as it sloooooooooooooowwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwwly plods along taking it's sweet time and leaving the audience in a dreamlike stupor.

And finally, to Mr. Warren whereever he is, I want him to know that he hurt me badly and I hope he suffocates to death in the fertilizer he so shamelessly sells in spends an eternity forced to watch this debauchery he created. Thank you.

review_title: So bad, we should send some copies of it to Al-Quaeda, to lead them to surrender!

review_detailed_main:
"In this macabre tale of a trip gone horribly wrong, an innocent family becomes lost and find themselves at a remote farmhouse. The only apparent resident of the property is a strangely deformed man named Torgo, who insists he is watching the place for 'The Master'. What our travelers don't know is 'The Master' and his demon-worshiping wives have awakened from their slumber to prey upon them for their sacrifices," according to the DVD sleeve's synopsis. Although John Reynolds (as Torgo) manages an interesting characterization, it isn't enough to lift this film from rock bottom, unfortunately.

* Manos: The Hands of Fate (1966) Harold P. Warren ~ John Reynolds, Diane Mahree, Tom Neyman

review_title: I wanted to see what many rated as the wrost movie ever.
review_detailed_main: I got through about the first five minutes before I hit fast forward. Another 5 minutes and I hit double fast forward to skip through it. It lived up to it's reputation as one of the worst of all time.
Truly the plight of man. An absolutely horrid film. I cried out of pure displeasure and I'm sure you will too. not worth it AT ALL

This movie has got to be one of the most entertaining and exciting film I have ever had the pleasure of viewing. This movie hits it on all the right levels. The acting: phenomenal. The script: exquisite. But most of all, I thoroughly enjoyed my favorite character, Torgo, played by the legendary John Reynolds. This movie will launch him to stardom. Particularly, the "Dog Storyline" will tear at your heartstrings. The strings of my heart were torn. And if that wasn't enough, the gripping soundtrack kept me on the edge of my seat. The composer gives Beethoven a run for his money. As for the other reviews of this movie, I do not agree tut-tut. They are mindless, clueless hooligans. So much can be said about this movie, but the most important part is that you must watch this movie RIGHT NOW! RIGHT AWAY! NOW! Please and thank you. The world is waiting. TA-TA.

review_title: If you give a fertilizer salesman a camera remember to deal with the sh*t he makes.
review_detailed_main:
Ouch this movie was bad. This thing makes "Troll 2" look like "Citizen Kane". At least in that movie stuff happens. In this I really don't know what is happening, and really don't care. It was really hard to sit through this thing, but I did it. Unfortunately I'm not getting the Purple Heart of movie critiquing out of watching this thing. All I get is a keyboard to unleash frustration on, and bad memories. Every last actor in this movie had no career after this or before. One actress was a script girl for a movie I don't know, and another was an uncredited actress in a TV movie I don't know. That is it. This film was just hard to sit through. Now if you excuse me I need to wash my eyes of this movie.

0 stars out of 4

review_title: So very bad but in many was so very good
review_detailed_main:
