I found Manos at the bottom of the IMDb list and like most people reading this HAD to see it, so bought a copy on ebay and with the help of my friends, who I watch many bad movies with, we watched it.

The plot is simple, a family of three out driving get lost and need a place to stay. They come across a house tended to by Torgo and owned by a mysterious master.

To review it fairly is difficult it's not a horror. Not one moment of tension, shock or terror is generated in this entire movie. Confusion and amusement will be your most likely reactions and the bad dubbing could even annoy you. It is filled with pointless scenes, repeated scenes and long periods of the character Torgo going through what look like facial exercises in the attempt to convey well something.

But i am not really being fair to this movie, for one thing it is not is boring. We were hooked from the beginning as the movie lived up to every bad review being as shoddy as we had hoped with amusing lines, the make out couple continuously making out (will they never learn), the cops attempts at a search, the master's amazing robes and of course Torgo.

I rated this movie low because in fairness it is a bad movie, badly made yes but I cannot recommend it highly enough.

review_title: Makes Plan 9 From Outer Space Look Like Citizen Kane
review_detailed_main: This movie will make you appreciate the directoral talents of Ed Wood. The only real way to enjoy it is to watch it with a group of friends and make fun of it. But the best way is by watching the RiffTrax version.

I read some of the other comments for this movie, and I happen to agree with most, "Who could watch this movie without MST3K?" Imagine the states of mental anguish observed by people who actually paid and sat through this entire movie back in 1966. Without the benefit of Joel and the robots. No amount of therapy or self denial could bring back those 2 lost hours. Let me think of things I would rather do than watch this movie: 1.) Watch a new coat of paint dry. OR an equally amusing task, watching linoleum curl. 2.) Volunteer to follow horses in a parade and scoop up manure. 3.) Slam my fingers repeatedly in a car door. Folks, the only thing I could think better than this would be to be in that theater wishing for deaths sweet embrace!

review_title: You can't get much worse than this.
review_detailed_main:
Manos, Hands of Fate is even stranger than it sounds. It has no point except for the "surprise" ending, which is about as strange and poorly conceived as the rest of the movie. In this mess, a family is going on vacation and accidentally gets lost. Instead of continuing, they decide to stay on a farmhouse even though the housekeeper Torgo said they couldn't stay because the master wouldn't like it. It turns out this house is full of some weird, stupid secrets, like the master's wives who all sleep on a wooden stake.

The main characters are idiots for staying at the house to begin with, and the daughter has a really annoying voice. The character of Torgo is another strange guy who is always repeating himself, which gets very repetitive. Another element that adds to the strangeness of the film is the weird jazz music playing nonstop. It is about the worst music to play during a movie like this, and I have no idea what made a composer come out with this.

Overall, this is one of the worst movies of all time, and I wouldn't wish it upon my worst enemy.

My rating: BOMB/****. 72 mins.

review_title: Manos... I shall be your slave forever!
review_detailed_main:
Hell yeah! This is surely the worst movie I've ever seen. After seeing Hotel Torgo (2004 documentary), I tell thee; go and see this ultra low budget-scars the ***t out of me-Z category movie! For the sake of Torgo if nothing else - this guy (John Reynolds) is soooo freaking' good in his role, he'd deserve a star on the Walk of fame. Actually, everybody involved in this project deserves to be seen in their "15 seconds of fame" roles. If for nothing else, they deserve to be "awarded" for their unconditional devotion to this crazy driven idea of a fertilizer salesman wanting to become the biggest director in El-Paso. Which - as it can be seen in the documentary - he actually did! To write anything about cinematographic view of this so-called movie just wouldn't be appropriate, as this sophomore dream of Hal Warren deserves to remain unbroken.

Although, I'm not sure if master would approve...

review_title: The Worst movie I have ever seen
review_detailed_main: This movie has no redeeming qualities. Everything one could look to for a movie to get enjoyment in, this movie fails. It is bad in every possible aspect. Harold P. Warren's tattered vision for an exploitation endeavor provided ideal fodder for comic riffing, instantly making it one of their finest episodes. However, jokes are no longer attached to the new Blu-ray edition of "Manos," which presents the effort in its initial state, trying to reclaim the no-budget charms of the production on its own terms, without ace comedians making the viewing experience passable. It's a dangerous, sobering proposition, but there's something intriguing about the distraction-free picture, revealing Warren's ambition to make junk food cinema through hasty experimentation. This very well may be one of the worst movies ever made, but here, on the Blu-ray, the viewer is now free to study what was originally intended and, in some cases, actually achieved. Do not watch under any circumstances.

Let me just begin by saying this movie is really, really, bad. Even watching MST3K with it is sometimes painful.

However, there is something about this movie, that you can't turn away from the film in all it's horror. It somehow appears to be a "snuff film," I don't know if such movies exist, but Manos: Hands of Fate is a good piece of evidence that it does.

Once I learned that the actors who played the Mother, the Kissing Girl, and Torgo had all committed suicide the same year the movie was made, I was freaked out. You almost think that the whole cult and sacrifice is probably real. It's probably not true, but watching the movie with a viewpoint that these people are filming a documentary about their cult gives you a whole other feeling, one of unsettling curiosity. Hey, maybe this movie could be considered the father (or Master) of "Blair Witch Project"!

Maybe I'm just crazy. Probably the whole reason this movie was made was so we could see the Master's brides wrestle in diaphonous gowns. Despite the wretchedness of the movie, Torgo is an incredibly unforgettable character. You can't help but think of what his ambitions, goals, and motivation. Once you really dig deep down in his character, you realize how disgusting it is, and try to free yourself from the grossness of it all.

Final word of caution: don't watch without Joel and the Bots.

Long Live Torgo!

the drama. the suspense. the sheer horror.

it was a incredible thrill ride. it kicks lord of the rings, the godfather trilogy and the matrix trilogy collective asses easily.

hell, i even got it on DVD. what a bomb. it firkin' rules.

now onto the rest of my review, manos the hand of fate was made by the most illustrious hal warren. where ever you are hal you are an inspiration to film makers everywhere! i love you!

the plot was well written. the SFX groovy as and the characters beautifully developed for number one viewing.

go see it or you just don't know movies.

review_title: not as bad as its reputation
OH MY GOD this is bad
review_detailed_main: This, what is this. I am a changed man after watching this movie. I don't know how you can top this as a bad movie everything about this is so boring awful and just down right BAD. I refuse to think this is a real movie. There's a few things that this movie does a lot of times one is like the hard cut used properly it can't be very effective but this movie does it at the most random times and it makes everything (Hard cut) very confusing. Another thing is the dialogue. It is so bad man like geez I can't even tell you how bad the dialogue (hard cut) is. Another thing is that sometimes the camera just goes out of focus then in the next shot it goes back to normal then it goes out of focus again then they do a hard cut. I hate this movie SO MUCH!! In almost every B-movie there obviously going to be some bad acting but geez this movie just keeps on impressing me. The acting is on a another level of cringe and bad, there's this one scene where the wife is crying and it is so obviously a fake cry it's like funny just like this movie. Then the Sound an audio is like words can't describe how bad the sound is. The movie score and the soundtrack, I can't handle it like one second the music stops then the next second it starts and it stops then it starts again and it does that for the whole movie it's fricken annoying. This movie redefines the word bad it's not even like "it's so bad it's good" it's just so bad. (Hard cut) that's about it if you made it to the bottom of my review thank you let me save you some time DONT WATCH THIS MOVIE!!!!!

I recommend only watching the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 version. The original is so stinky and smelly it is so...well... "It makes my prostrate weak and my bowels are full to bursting" Not only is the script comprised of well idiocy. It doesn't make sense. The whole thing didn't make sense. My head hurts so badly. I cant think anymore... Why was this movie made? Why!?!?! Seriously, only watch the MST3K version otherwise you will waste your time. They make it hilarious. Their silly banter and sarcasm makes it actually fun to watch. Why was this movie made again? What bet was made to make this movie? Did someone ever take this movie seriously?

A family gets lost on the road and stumbles upon a hidden, underground, devil-worshiping cult led by the fearsome Master (Tom Neyman) and his servant Torgo (John Reynolds).

I have a pet peeve with people who watch "Mystery Science Theater" and then come to IMDb and give the film they just watched a 1, causing it to end up on the Bottom 100. Roughly half the films on the Bottom 100 are there because of their being showcased on MST3K. And while I am not going to say they are not bad movies, they are not among the worst in the world (especially if you keep in mind the bad prints that MST3K often used).

That being said, "Manos" is an exception to that complaint -- it truly is among the worst films ever made. The plot has no rationale, the scenery is begging for something more... the extended drive time in the beginning is unbearable. Torgo is awesome, but we really never begin to understand his issues or why he likes to stuff his pants with pillows...

I see Shout Factory has a special edition of the film, and I think it would be worth picking up. Not because it is a good movie, but because I am just curious how much they could improve on it by touching it up and adding special features. As they say, you can polish a horse apple, but it is still a horse apple.

review_title: Know what, kudos to the film maker.
review_detailed_main: After hearing/reading about how notoriously bad this film was, and also wanting to introduce myself to Mystery Science Theatre 3000, I decided to watch this movie with the aforementioned show's treatment and kill two birds with one stone. What can I say? The movie itself sucks. Action is minimal, editing is terrible, plot is incomprehensible. And the whole thing is awkward and boring as hell. But you and I knew all that. The thing is, even if this is a crappy film, you have to give credit to it's creator. I mean, the guy was a fertilizer salesman who made a bet that he could make a full fledged movie. That takes some grit. In as much, I give the film an F for lameness, but an A for effort. Worth a single viewing, no more, no less.

review_title: What can be said about it?
review_detailed_main:
I see a good deal of movies given one star on this site, and it's pretty obvious that most of it is hyperbole. Yes, "Daredevil" was a bad movie. Was it abysmal, such a Technicolor abortion that it warranted the lowest score possible? I don't think so. This film, though...

Let me make something clear right now: I've only seen the MST3K version like most sane people. I couldn't put myself through the unedited version, though I tried the next best thing and just tuned the bots out. What you have left is a script that is just awful all across the board: dialogue comes off as either cheesy, hokey, or stupid. The characters are either stereotypes or make no sense, with the exception of the servant Torgo, who is purely by accident one of the funniest things ever to happen to movies. And of course, there's the cinematography, using the word in the loosest sense possible. The film was shot with an antique camera that could only record 60 seconds of film at a time, sound not included, and couldn't be moved. The results are just about what you'd expect from a fertilizer salesman trying to edit together an ungodly amount of 60 second clips; jerky, boring, and bad bad bad.

The story was pretty unamazing by itself. A family gets lost, finds a house/hotel/thing, and winds up right in the middle of a cult. THat's about the extent of what you get; continuity and cohesion go strait out the window here, and what little plot there is gets split up between scenes of The Brave Father trying to be brave but coming off as a clueless pecker-head, the Evil Villain being Evil, or some other mishmash. The "surprise ending" is laughable; by the time you hit it, you're just glad its over.

Look for three scenes in this flick: anything with Torgo in it, the gigantic cat-fight whose only plot purpose was to have fairly attractive women fight on screen while Torgo leers Torgoishly, and a scene where two officers of the law "investigate" the situation. UNfortunately, because the camera couldn't be moved, the "investigation" consists of three steps taken away from the car and a resoundingly satisfactory "Well, things seem okay here" from Cop Number One.

The Trivia section speaks for the rest. The voices were done by two people, no one got paid, and Torgo committed suicide after this was released. I can understand hyperbole, I can realize that yes, there are some truly bad movies out there today, but this one takes the cake. The true Worst Movie of All Time, saved only by a little show called Mystery Science Theatre 3000, where even with the nonstop jibes, the movie is still rough. If you feel, however, you must watch it, get some popcorn, strap yourself in, and see if you can survive the (non-existant) opening credits. You'll see what I mean.

This film is a bleak joyless train-wreck of a movie. It has no plot, no budget, and the acting is horrible. The premise of the movie is that the Master worships a demon in exchange, I suppose, for the ability to wed many women, all of whom he keeps in suspended animation in some room that is like a crypt or something. A typical middle-class family gets lost while going on vacation and winds up having to stay the night in the Master's home. All the wives wake up and bicker about whether the Master should marry the woman and her six year old daughter who are staying the night. It's a kind of creepy insight into the mind of the man who made the movie, actually. Not much more than that, though. No plot, no action, and a horribly depressing ending.

The only reason I ever watched this movie is that I had heard that the Mystery Science Theater 3000 treatment of it was pretty funny. Sadly Joel and the bots couldn't even make this one worthwhile.

While I enjoy watching a bad movie here and there, making fun of it, there is no fun to make of in this "Film". While most bad movies are the least bit entertaining and made with heart, this is not. It's just plain boring, and has no heart behind it. not a single member of cast or crew was paid for this monstrosity, not a single one. The director didn't care, he just wanted to contribute for himself, not the viewers, But himself. I can't even make fun of this movie it's so boring. I've seen this movie 5 times, so that's about 5 hours of my life wasted looking for at least one redeeming quality or something to poke fun at. I highly recommend to never sit down and watch this, it's a waste of time. That is what should be taken away from this film, It's a waste. I'd rather watch "Who Killed Captain Alex?", which was made with an estimated 200$ and is several thousand times more entertaining (and is one of my favorite films of all time, Unironically), and made with heart unlike this "Movie".

Avoid this "film" at all costs

The film is technically abysmal, and fails in every respect. But I have to say I have never seen anything like it, and the bizarre nature of the film does have intriguing novelty. By and large these strange moments (and that includes literally every single shot in the film) make you chuckle in disbelief. At the end of the day, even with all the unintentional humour, the film is an arduous experience. It's just not engaging. But as I said, there's nothing like it, and at the end of the day, with the nonexistent budget and non-professional crew, the film could have just turned out plain awful. Since it is instead bizarrely unique awful, I have to give it ten stars. It really is an achievement of sorts. Final remark: the general idea for the film is fine, and if someone had re-written the script and used professionals to produce it it could have been a pretty decent film.

You could not make a worse movie if you tried. Even watching the mystery science version (which I usually enjoy due to the fact that they rip apart bad movies) was unbearable. I could not even begin to describe how bad this movie was. It is supposed to be a horror film but is just horrible. Everything about it is bad. I could never sit through it again and I can't believe it is not ranked the #1 worst movie, but at this point I'm not about to watch Phat girls to see why it is worse. Watching it took 3 years off my life and lowered my self esteem. Be prepared to go into therapy after viewing it. It is by far the worst movie I have ever seen.

This is a candidate for worst movie ever - in the category of "no budget", "director with no experience", "non-actors", etc. I'm not trying to excuse it. It is a HORRIBLE movie. I mean, in one scene the camera is focused on the back of the actor's head while she is talking. But consider Red Zone Cuba. Here is a film with, granted, little or no budget. But you did have a director who'd done other films. Granted, they were bad films as well, but there was at least some experience. The actors in RZC had done a little "acting" as well. So, is it the worst? Yes, I think so - in the "no budget, no experienced director, no actors" category. In the "tiny budget, little experienced director, really bad actors (or "gimme my check" actors, ala John Carradine)" category I have to give the nod to RZC.

I can't see how anyone could give this movie a 10. It is pure garbage. I heard all the hype about the movie being so awful, so I bought the original version to get the full effect. You can't really understand how bad the movie really is until you watch it. Every person that I show this movie to has said the exact same thing. I think the reason why people are giving it 10's is because Manos has been the #1 worst movie of all time for a very long time. It's been the worst for so long for a reason. Manos should go down in history as the single worst movie ever created. It helps me sleep at night to know that I have seen the worst movie ever made. That is a fact that no one can argue. For all you bad movie collectors out there, watch this movie at your own risk.

There are hundreds of reviews here, but it is now early 2007 and I am appalled to see how many very recent films, like "Crossover" and "Bottoms Up," are showing up in the IMDb Bottom 100. Understand, folks, that the true art of bad movie appreciation takes research and effort. Lack of research and effort is why so few people remember such classic cinematic bowel movements as "Exorcist II: The Heretic" and "Boy, Did I Get A Wrong Number!" I am a bad movie fanatic. I have seen "Baby Geniuses 2." Yes, I have seen "Glitter," yes, I have seen "Justin And Kelly," and yes, I have seen "Gigli." I have seen "Santa With Muscles." I watched Robin Williams sticking a bedpan on his head in "Patch Adams." Going back a few more years, yes, I have seen "Halloween III: Season Of The Witch." Yes, I have seen "Smokey And The Bandit 2," and "Troll 2," and "Grease 2" (whoa, "Grease 2," that one practically vomited itself out of my unconscious. Man, was that a pile of toxic waste!). "Battlefield Earth"? Yup, saw that one, too. "Caligula"? Yep. "I Spit On Your Grave"? Ja. "Maniac" (the 1980 one)? Da. So, this is just a single vote to help bring the Bottom 100 back into balance. "Manos: The Hands Of Fate" is absolutely the Worst Movie Ever Made.

... was probably Casablanca. Or maybe Gone With The Wind. Perhaps one of Godfather or Star Wars movies. Whatever cinematic achievement holds this pinnacle in your personal top ten list, you'll almost certainly place the wretched "Manos: the Hands of Fate" at the other extreme.

When a movie really and truly sucks, the actors and actresses are usually the last ones I blame, since even the best performers can't do much with a stupid plot, dumb premise, poor direction, and nonexistent continuity. But in this case the talent-deprived actors should have realized halfway through the project that they'd be better off having gone back to their day jobs, whatever they may have been.

Are there any bright spots in this abyss? The only performer who displayed any recognizable talent was John Reynolds as Torgo. I write this under the assumption that the late Mr. Reynolds was not mentally handicapped, and that his pauses and stutterings were him desperately trying to bring his ill-conceived character to life.

Even Joel and the 'bots, our fearless bashers of stupidity, had trouble making this movie entertaining. What's there to say about a movie that takes ten minutes of dialogue-less driving? The Ultimate Raspberry award goes to "Manos: Hands of Fate", which should be placed in the condemned spot of Worst Movie Ever.

review_title: I would vote 0 if I could!!!
review_detailed_main:
Manos is a movie (hard to say that), which will haunt you the rest of your life. The burned images of Torgo and the master have rotted my brain and have shaken believe in humanity. This movie has to be in the top five worst of all time forever. You can argue between movies like: Monster A Go-Go, Red Zone Cuba, Hobgoblins...etc (yes I have seen them all), but Manos is my #1.

I have only watched the MST3K version because watching the original would be just plain masochism. I have seen many episodes of the show and I had never seen the bots and Mike/Joel struggle with riffing as much as this movie. At one point Joel shouts at the screen in frustration. You will never get the 70 plus minutes of your life back use it for a greater cause, trust me. If you want to be offended, angry, disillusioned and sick-to-your-stomach this pile of sh!t is for you.

review_title: Manos: A Fate Worse Than Death
review_detailed_main: There are many truly abysmal movies out there. I will admit that movies like "Glitter" and "Karate Cop" are pretty awful. They may even deserve bottom 10 slots on the worst movies ever list. But I can guarantee that no movie ever made, or that will ever be made, is worse than Manos: The Hands Of Fate. In the MST3K version, its badness is made tolerable, even entertaining by the merciless stream of satire voiced by the MST cast. However, the movie itself is one of the rare movies that can cause you physical pain the keep watching. No matter how bad you thought some movie was because no-one could act and the plot was cheesy, just say to yourself, "at least they had multiple sets, a special effects budget, and more than 2 people doing the dialog". because such joys hang upon Manos like a new steaming dog turd in the middle of an already turd-covered field. you are going to either rate this movie a 1 or a 10. A 1 if you watched the movie, and a 10 if you didn't but want to up-vote this out of the way of "Kazaam".

"Manos: The Hands of Fate" will go completely over the head of anyone but the super-intelligent. However, there is depth and metaphor in this divinely-crafted piece of art, which you will find nowhere else. If you ignore the misguided and uneducated popular opinion long enough to treat yourself to this gem, you will be rewarded for years to come. It is perhaps the most disturbing psychological thriller ever made.

Although, at first glance, elements like the protracted cuts of the car driving through the desert seem to be gratuitous incompetence on the part of director Hal Warren, they are actually expertly calculated devices designed to engender unparalleled tension (I felt like I was actually experiencing the horrific events myself). What is considered "bad acting" and boring, inane dialogue by most, is in fact Warren's almost supernatural ability to weave a sense of ultra-realism from his supremely skilled thespians. The delicious set design and cinematography are gothically postmodern, conveying an atmosphere of impending dread. Last but not least, kudos of kudos must be given to the brilliant score, particularly the haunting, minimalistic "Torgo" theme. All of these components converge to yield a profoundly subtle epic, a superlative achievement in innovative film-making - in short, one of the greatest films ever made. I could tell you more, but I don't wish to spoil a second of this masterpiece, nor its climactic twist, which would turn M. Night Shaymalan green with envy.

God rest your soul, Hal Warren. One can only imagine what other cinematic wonders you would have blessed us with if only your uncanny genius had been recognized and appreciated. Films like "Manos: The Hands of Fate" are the reason celluloid was invented.

review_title: Oh God it's so Painful! Why Hal Warren, there is no justification for this!
review_detailed_main: Some movies are just bad. Entertaining, yet terrible. This statement brings to mind films like Kazaam, Steel, and The Mangler. Few movies are so bad that even MST3K cannot make even remotely entertaining. Honestly I must ask the directer, why, why would you do this to the public. Have you no heart? Words cannot even begin to describe how terrible this film is. Why Hal Warren, Why would you do this. Have you no conscience. Honestly I would rather watch paint dry than to sit through this piece of cinematic crap again. It is actually painful to watch. It hurts just to endure it. Because that is what you do. You do not watch the MST3K version, you endure it. I WANT MY 90 MINUTES BACK JOEL.

Wow. I've seen bad movies in my time, but this one takes the cake. Never before have I witnessed anything like Manos: Hands of Fate. This is a movie where somehow, in some way, the people working on it managed to do EVERYTHING wrong.

Acting? Horrible. Costumes? Laughable. Lighting? Umm...What lighting? For the love of God, the film and camera used were even of sub-standard quality (and I mean by 1966 standards, not modern day)! This movie reminds me more than anything else of when a loving parent goes to their son/daughter's third grade play and video tapes it. Except the plot to that play is probably a lot more coherent, less disturbing, and the acting is only slightly worse. That is no exaggeration.

I can't really sumarize this movie since it doesn't really seem to go anywhere. A lot of it is downright confusing. There are several scenes of a young couple kissing that could just as well have been from another movie for all the impact they had on this one. Torgo, the only memorable character, has been given the sinister affliction of gigantic thighs. It seems he was intended to be some sort of goat-man, but that isn't really explained and isn't readily obvious. His death scene looks more like a massage than a brutal beating. Worst of all, in the end, our heroes (such as they are) fail to escape from Torgo's creepy Master, sending the uplifting message that evil pagan gods always win in the end. The final scenes of the movie also hint at pedophilia.

For all of the cast members, as well as the writer/director and I imagine the greater portion of the crew, this was to be their first and only film. A sequel is hinted at in the final credits, but thank goodness it was never made.

I have been trying and trying to come up with some explanation for how this movie got released in theaters. So far, the only one that made sense to me is that Satan himself appeared before the studio executives and made some kind of payoff. This is by far the worst movie I have ever seen, and although I have yet to see Plan 9 From Outer Space! (though not for lack of trying) I cannot imagine how it could exceed Manos in failure.

I should mention I saw only the MST3K version of this movie. I cannot imagine sitting through the uncut version. This movie churns my stomach as it is. Nothing can prepare you for this movie. It has to be seen to be believed and to see this movie is to take your life into your own hands. For those who have seen the uncut version...you have my sympathies.

You can watch Merlin, or Plan 9 From Outer Space, but even those don't beat this movie. If it comes to being bad from 12 minutes of driving in the country, or pants stuffed to be big, or perhaps, "Mike, I'm scared!" for no reason, this movie serves no purpose if your looking for something good.

"I am Torgos, I take care of the house while the master is away." *However its spelled*, the only horror in this movie is the fact that you watched it.

This movie comes down to deserve the rate of ONE. If someone gives it two, they are VERY nice.

This is definitely the worst movie that has ever been made, I have no doubt about that. It makes no sense really, and everything wrong with it is obvious.

This is a movie that serves only the purpose to make you laugh. If your not laughing, then your dieing from the abundance of stupidity.

review_title: A so awful they named it "Hands: The Hands Of Fate"
review_detailed_main:
When a person reads reviews for a notably terrible film, he or she expects that upon reading such a review, they should become armed with a sort of knowledge that will better enable them to enjoy some of the finer details of that film. But, as far as "Manos: The Hands Of Fate" is concerned, no amount of reading up or preparing will allow you to make the 74 minutes of your life that were just wasted return to you. There is nothing to be gained from watching this film other than the bragging rites that you had. Even this feels hollow, as you are bragging that you had spent time watching the so-called worst movie in existence.

There is nothing funny about this film. The poor acting, terrible plot, unsteady filming, and mind-numbing soundtrack do not combine to create anything other than a waste of time. I had expected that watching this film would be a humorous, tear inducing experience. In truth, it was little more than enraging. After the movie, the questions left unanswered did not make the movie entertaining to bash, but reinforced the feeling of anguish that the film left in its wake. I do not recommend that anyone reading this article should watch the movie. But, should you feel compelled to do so, bring a friend, this movie is not for the feint-hearted.

review_title: Makes Plan 9 From Outer Space look like Gone With the Wind
review_detailed_main: This really is the worst movie ever made, bar none, no doubt about it. When I first saw it, it was on MST3K, and while they made it funny, it was still abundantly clear that the movie was terrible. But then, I had the misfortune of watching it without the benefit of Joel and the Bots, which was one of the most difficult experiences of my life, if you ever have the opportunity to do the same, take my advice...go have a tooth pulled instead.

PLEASE...listen to me...I don't have much time...my mind...my poor unprepared mind. This 'movie' will bring you to ruin and has no redeeming values. The hurt inflicted upon your psyche will most definitely last a lifetime and may be inheritable. Being waterboarded is now my most enjoyed pastime, along with other 'unmentionable' things. Just say NO! Ohhhhh....my manos are starting to hurt, don't worry that's a good thing, it keeps my mind off of the horror I've witnessed. Yes, unedited, unMST3K'd, raw, limping, fetid, cellulose. It can't be..... It can't be... It can't be.. It can't be. It..............IS!

I have to agree with another reviewer: it's just not right to count the 10 scores for this movie. What else do they call a 10? "Santa with Muscles?" "Larry the Cable Guy, Health Inspector?" Sheesh! This is one of the times I wish IMDb had a way to exclude contrary votes; votes clearly intended to mess with the system. For MTHOF, I can see a 2 or 3 vote. Maybe a 4 if you find B movies acceptable in their own way, or if watched with the benefit of the MST3K guys (I wanted to give a 3 since Joel & crew gave me some laughs, then I remembered what I was rating). But a 10 vote!?

The votes for this had the bell-curve around 1, so the 10 votes had to be an anomaly. I wish IMDb had a way to kick the obvious irritation votes. For example, 1 votes for "The Godfather" and "Schindler's List." What does such an individual consider quality film-making by comparison? "Debbie does Dallas?"

(sigh)

This is a bad movie that is a must-see by any film buff. It gives a sense of scale. (It's a bit like taring a scale to 0.) The only way to possibly enjoy it is to watch it with the MST3K comments. When the master confronts Torgo, a full two minutes goes by watching him wordlessly approach Torgo and we watch Torgo struggle to his feet. After some funny patter during this scene, Joel finally screams "Do something!" The MST3K crew is the only life given to the film where aiming the camera at an average street corner would provide more action and plot.

Well. I posted one time, quite a while back, but I find that i lack the rich text that I could add to insulting (literally) the worst movie that was ever made. This movie was made on a bet by a fertilizer salesman, named Hal Warren. It doesn't surprise me that he didn't ask for Hollywood's help either.

..

He wrote the screenplay rough draft. He directed. He did all of the (craptacular!) "special effects". What more can I say. He did a fine job.

Of making himself look like a complete idiot.

Maybe it's just a coincidence that he died of cancer.

This movie lacks plot, characteristics, note-worthy actors. (If you look up the stats of the actors, you might notice that none of them were in any other movies. I wonder why.) It also lacks rich text, (...and sound), intelligent dialog, and actors that don't count bugs all day.

This movie was introduced to me by a friend (who sarcastically said that it was good.) I borrowed it from him... and I must say this is the first movie to drive me to the point of not knowing whether to cry, or to laugh hysterically. I did a bit of both.

I cannot refrain from lecturing the people who've seen this god awful excuse for a movie that they can still repent for wasting 70 something minutes of their time by going to see a movie that's actually good.

If I ever get married and have children... I'm not going to use this as a family movie. This movie will be to punish my kids.

They should change the name of the movie from "'Manos' the Hands of Fate" to "'Manos' who wrote this crap?" Rated: for alienated degenerates only.

Fertilizer salesman Harold P. Warren had a dream. He decided to invest $19.000 of his own money in making one of the scariest ever to hit the big screen. Except, Harold knew nothing about making movies, he had no professional actors and only had one hand-held camera that could film for only 32 seconds at a time. Without sound.

It's the story about a family who get stranded in the middle of nowhere and look for help in an old scary house. The only one who's there to welcome them is the creepy servant Torgo. Before the night is over they find themselves at the mercy of The Master and his evil cult.

Placed at a #4 spot on the IMDb bottom 100, this has got to be one of the worst movies of all time, right?

I think it depends on how you define a bad movie.

I've seen plenty of million dollar Hollywood movies that bored me to death. And Manos didn't. In fact, I loved it. Warren's pure lack of cinematic vision and experience is what gives this movie its unique atmosphere. The recurring library music, the choppy editing, the weird sound loops all contribute to the movie's surreal qualities. For instance the scene where Torgo (in my opinion, one of the most enigmatic heroes in B-movie history) tries to touch the face of Margaret goes on and on. In and out of focus. Nothing's really happening, but still you can't look away. It could have come straight out of a David Lynch movie. The fact that Warren probably didn't mean this scene to be weird and surreal doesn't mean that it's not working on a whole different level. It is what it is, intended or not.

I've never seen the MST version and I'm not going to. It's like kicking a dog when it's already down. Watch the great documentary Hotel Torgo instead to learn something about the movie's interesting and often hilarious background. And watch the normal version of the film. You might see Harold P. Warren's dream of making his masterpiece. He invested his money, wrote a script and made his damn horror movie. He followed his passion and the fact that he failed completely is utterly irrelevant. 47 years later, people still watch it. They love it or hate it, but they'll never forget it.

Now does that sound like one of the worst movies ever?

review_title: Hideous, repellent fun for the whole family!
review_detailed_main: Words cannot describe this movie. Ok, maybe they can, but they won't be very good words. One probably could not print them in the newspaper. Everything about this movie reeks: the dubbed-in voices (they lost the original soundtrack), the repetitive dialogue, the huge-kneed Torgo (you will see if you watch, although don't take that as a recommendation to see this), and the stupid plot. That isn't really a long enough list, but I don't think they would allow me to write the sheer amount of words it would take to describe how truly revolting this movie is in every way. If you really, really want to torture yourself, and you have plenty of experience with other bad movies (it helps to have seen such cinematic masterpieces as Hobgoblins and Red Zone Cuba), then prepare yourself for one heck of a ride. (Well, not really, but I just like saying that, since my therapist says it will help the healing begin.)

review_title: There was nothing redeeming about this movie

review_detailed_main:
I keep it short and simple. This movie doesn't even fit in the "so bad it's funny" category. It's so bad that you want to die while watching it and I watched the MST3K version and it still was pure pain and agony.

So all I want to say is that don't watch it. I repeat DO NOT WATCH THIS MOVIE. Although I know you will, so have fun.

review_title: "Let me get your complimentary crazy bread..."
review_detailed_main: I've seen Hobgoblins, Time of the Apes, The Pod People, The Beast of Yucca Flats, Red Zone Cuba, Skydivers, Eegah, Mitchell, The Creeping Terror, Parts: The Clonus Horror, The Girl in Gold Boots, The Wild Wild World of Batwoman, The Amazing Colossal Man, Cave Dwellers, The Sidehackers, The Brain That Wouldn't Die, Phase IV, The Crawling Eye, The Crawling Hand, Bloodlust, etc. Never before have I witnessed such inept "filmmaking" in my entire bad-film watching career. Despite Joel and the 'bots frequently hilarious banter, Manos somehow manages to pull ahead and, by the end laps the Satellite of Love by producing more pain than laughs. Now, to describe the plot......... um, well, there's this guy driving forever and he's supposed to be doing something. Then, there's this LSD-driven "guy" who has big knees, and he kind of interacts with this black robed Frank Zappa, who happens to have a dozen or so "wives" who wear next to nothing and tend to get into big mud-wrestling brawls. Then, these people drive and act stupidly and then other people drive to exactly the same place. It took months of therapy and multiple viewings to gather that synopsis for your reading pleasure. If you do view this on MST3K, then stay tuned through the very end for a hilarious encounter with Torgo, who now works at TORGO'S PIZZA (with free crazy bread!).

When the movie starts out with a family on a road trip singing "Row,Row, Row Your Boat" I just knew I was going to hate this movie, but I just had to see for myself just how bad it was. Oddly, the only vaguely redeeming quality was John Reynolds portrayal of Torgo, you know, the guy with the goat legs who "takes care of the place while the Master's away".(which still isn't saying much).The rest is painful to watch. The characters are incredibly stupid, made all the more so, because their voices were badly dubbed.

As bad as it is, I'd still have to say "Mac and Me" (which I reviewed a couple of weeks ago) and "Underdog" are even worse. On the other hand, there are many reasons why "Manos" belongs on the #3 spot on IMDb bottom 100, one of them being that it may have even contributed to the untimely death of John Reynolds. The apparatus he wore to give him the "goat leg" effect (Torgo was supposedly a satyr) resulted in permanent knee damage and his subsequent addiction to painkillers. He committed suicide shortly before the film's premiere.

As to being "so bad, it's good", Manos is too bad to be of any good. It's not fair to compare it to "Dark Star" or "The Lost Skeleton of Cadavera", two films I highly recommend. This, however is to be avoided at all costs.

Rating: 1/2* out of *****

review_title: "I wish those hands would just push him over..."
A Good Movie, If you are a twisted, sadomasochistic Lunatic
review_detailed_main: Renting a movie is always fun. Its like christmas in its own way. You dont exactly know what you are getting, but you know it has to be good in some way. Imagine coming down christmas morning, and unwrapping the gift from that Uncle who always gives you cool stuff. Instead of a toy car, or teddy bear, you are presented with a worm-eaten maggot infested rotting Kidney covered in vomit and faeces. Multilply your horror by one million and you have my reaction to this movie. Some movies are so bad that they are funny. This movie is so awful it's not funny, not pathetic, not deserving of pity, its just awful. I urge all of you to invade your local video rental outlet and burn every copy of this movie and every one by this fertilizer salesman.

First off, I applaud the idea behind this. The goal of creating a piece that wins over audiences in spite of a low budget is a commendable one, and had this had much merit, or even any, beyond said concept, I would be giving them props. Not so. It's surely all been said. The production value on this is zero... where did the money go? Credit for that, along with the summary, goes to my fiancée. Having read the Trivia, I still don't understand how this got to be this bad. The pacing is nonexistent. The plot... what there is of one... is rehashed and poorly told. The twist and the acting(save for obviously the voices, among other things, they don't mix them up enough) aren't(all) necessarily the worst ever, though the way it's captured destroys the very hope of what might have been(the fact that the main guy behind this was a stage person with no directorial training whatsoever explains a lot). The attempts to master the cinematic language are marred by dyslexia and a nearly incomprehensible dialect. As basic a matter as the focus wasn't always achieved. The editing is just... while they did only do two takes of everything, and it was all in 32 second segments, that doesn't actually mean he had to do such a lousy job of putting it all together. There is a single good cut in the entire thing. That's it. The effects and believability, save for the aforementioned exception, are simply painful. The lighting varies from uninteresting to "not there". The dialog, which there is a decided lack of, is uninspired. An almost unforgivable amount of this consists of people... standing around. It's not shot well, either. Where is the horror? The atmosphere? The mystery? The scares? *What* is the soundtrack? Who thought to have jazz in this? This builds no suspense and contains no thrills. The framing is downright ugly. Between the never-ending sequences and scenes, the house of maybe(but certainly no more than) three rooms total, the four characters that could be excised with nothing lost other than running time, this is really barely worth a viewing, and if you must, I suggest the MST3K episode(albeit you can tell they were struggling for material... it's limited how many jokes you can do on this without repeating yourself). I can't say that I would have survived it if it had been the straight version. This is a textbook example of how not to do a movie, if it does tend to make the same mistakes constantly rather than numerous different ones. The title has an inherent ironic ring to it, as this was clearly made by a crew with broken hands, and of course, arms. I recommend this to anyone into B-flicks, and/or whatever else is this awful. The common theater-goer may want to avert their eyes, as this is likely to induce bleeding from them(meanwhile, that would be cooler than anything you'll see in this). 1/10

I guess there isn't a lot I can say about this one that hasn't been said already, but oh my God it stank!!! Literally titled "Hands, the Hands of Fate," this movie belongs in the bottom echelon of forgettable tripe, worse than the worst of Ed Wood. The plot and acting are non-existent, typical of grade z films of its day, but the writing and direction are so inept, so painstakingly bad, one wonders how and why the person responsible was allow to remain at large. We can only be thankful he didn't go on to make more movies, thought he couldn't possibly have made any worse ones. I'm told this film was made on a dare, I believe it!

review_title: My New Guilty Pleasure Next to Wild, Wild West with Will Smith
It's so much fun to watch....
review_detailed_main:
...the MST3K version!! Well what did you think I meant, this movie!?? This is a must see for everyone, simply because no explanation could convey the experience. It's like aliens from a distant galaxy received a grainy 30 second transmission of a Ray Dennis Steckler film and used it as the basis for writing "Manos". Of course we all know Hal Warren deserves the blame here. Blaming it on aliens is not fair to the aliens.

Oh and good job by the IMDB staff, for cleaning out all the erroneous "suicide" listings in the various actor's info pages. The only one who committed suicide was John "Torgo" Reynolds. Too bad, he would never know how famous he would someday be.

This movie is bad. It has a couple of good story ideas but most scenes have nothing to do with the story or go on for far too long. Its main offense is that it is dull. The film production values are poor, but not atypical for an old, low-budget horror movie.

This movie made me re-evaluate what a one-star rating is versus a two-star rating. I think a poorly made movie that was a good try is a two. In my opinion, the worst movies have no charm, are offensive to the audience or have a poor effort on the part of the filmmakers. There is a charm to this movie. I like the last scene especially. The kids in the car are funny as well.

Not the worst, at all.

Manos: The Hands of Fate. What a f@cking horrible movie this is! The writing is atrocious, the direction goes nowhere and the actors just read the lines like they have no idea what the hell they're actually saying! Oh; and the 16mm-32-second-filming-camera REALLY shows when you watch the movie. The abrupt cuts, the ear-bleedingly-bad music, and the AWFUL white balancing makes this a TRUE pain to watch; unless you've seen the MST3K episode roasting the sh## out of this steaming turd from the past. Now THAT's the way you watch this movie: with deservedly deprecating commentary!

There's nothing good about Manos: The Hands of Fate. EVERYTHING about it is horrible. And it's BORING on top of all the pre-determined awfulness! It's 1966's Battlefield Earth!

Manos: The Bottom of the Cinematic Barrel! 0/10 (even though I rated it 1 because IMDb).

review_title: Indefensible garbage - and I just love this kind of stuff.
review_detailed_main:
One can't really compare this to other "so bad they're good" films. This is unmitigated trash.

Plan 9, Horror of Party Beach, etc had plots one could actually follow even if they weren't creative or credible. This is more in line with Robot Monster where nothing really makes sense. Not having a clue what or why things are happening interferes with any possibility of getting some schlocky entertainment value from a badly done movie.

I love 1950s B-grade horror and sci-fi so I have a real tolerance for nonsense and low-quality. But I can't recommend anyone bother with this mess, it's not worth the time.

Well, although it is extremely difficult to explain how bad this movie is, people have a done good job I think. Actually I don't have much to say about it's poor acting, non-existent plot or completely irrelevant "the make-out couple". I am going to evaluate the movie in a completely different manner. Think about this: years after our time, mankind is completely eradicated from the face of the earth. And some kind of alien species finds the earth and decides to send an expedition team to discover if any kind of intelligent life form exists. And during their search,they find "Manos the hands of fate" and somehow manage to watch it. Wouldn't they think they are wasting their time researching a species (us) that created this movie (and possibly enjoyed) as a form of art? There will be no one else to explain that this is the worst movie ever! And they will leave us to our fate! Mankind will be forgotten forever. So, I'm saying that Manos is not just a bad movie, It's a crime against humanity.

review_title: Bad...but not nearly as bad as I expected
review_detailed_main:
First off, let me stress that I watched the MST3K version of this, so that may have helped to cushion the blow. I also prepped myself for this movie by reading a ton of reviews about it. Therefore, I was expecting this to be an insanely mind numbing experience that I would never be able to make it all the way through. After having seen it, I have to admit that it wasn't the monstrosity that I built it up to be. Make no mistake, this is NOT a good movie, but I wasn't as astounded by the poor production of this movie as others. To me, it came across as a high school production of a play written by one of the students. Knowing in advance that the vast majority of people involved in this movie knew next to nothing about making films helped me be a little more forgiving of the vast array of technical flaws. The basic story that Hal Warren devised could have worked in the right hands (no pun intended). What he didn't understand was how to take that idea and turn it into a full length feature film. Hence we get pointless scenes of endless driving, teenagers making out, people staring at paintings, girls wrestling, etc.

I'd love to see a remake of this movie with the following changes: First, I'd spend more time in the beginning with the family before they leave for this trip, to help us identify with the characters. Maybe the relationship between husband and wife isn't going so well, and they hope that over vacation they can try to bury the hatchet. Then, I'd lose those teenagers and change the cops to detectives investigating the disappearance of six couples over a period of years in one small town. These six couples would represent the Master's six wives and his male slaves. I'd change the circumstances of how the family winds up in this house. Big change: Torgo. I'd make him appear completely normal, albeit quirky (think Norman Bates). This serves two purposes - first, it would be easier to believe that the family would stay there in the first place. Second, it would help throw off suspicion of any wrong-doing. As for the Master, I would make him Manos, instead of having Manos be the deity that the Master worships. He would be a Devil-like creature - the epitome of all evil. He would have very definite powers such as the power to possess and the power to shapeshift. I'd probably have the Torgo character and Margaret find a mutual attraction, to add motivation for Torgo to defy the master and to add conflict between Mike & Margaret. This is just an example of the many things that could possibly make this movie an enjoyable experience.

In the end, I have to give Hal Warren a little credit. I'd be willing to bet that there are far worse things that were put onto film by well known directors on their first try - I don't mean their first feature film, I mean the very first time they ever rolled film to try to tell a story. Hey, almost 7,000 people have rated it on the IMDb, and I'm sure that thousands of others have seen it. For a horror movie that was made 40 years ago on a shoestring budget by someone who'd never been involved with the movie industry, I'd say that's pretty cool. Worst movie ever? No, and here's why: Hal Warren & the entire cast and crew just didn't have the know-how to make a better movie. I'd reserve the honor of Worst Movie for something like "Charlie's Angels: Full Throttle", where EVERYONE involved should have known better.

Family man Michael (Hal Warren), his wife Margaret (Dianne Maherr) and daughter Debbit (Jackie Neyman Jones) travels on vacation as they stumble to the Valley Lodge. They soon find a creepy mangoat-like fellow named Torgo (John Reynolds) helps them to their rooms until his evil master (Tom Neyman) traps them into a horrifying nightmare.

One of the worst films of all time! this stinky abortion of a movie has one of the worst plots in the history of film plus rotten acting, horrible production values, lethargic pacing, and all that sort of thing but does have a good jazzy soundtrack which helps the level of this excretment. Thank god for Mystery Science Theater 3000 riffing this mess apart and you can feel the pain they suffered through this movie.

Watch only the MST3K version.

review_title: Forget Citizen Kane. This is the sh¡t!
review_detailed_main: Best. Movie. Ever. Period. Simply, everything in this movie is perfect: from plot to acting. Location, set, lighting, soundtrack, poster, everything. It was even made in the year I was born! I have no idea why most people don't know this movie exists. Probably, because it is so avant-garde! You know how most people hate good, that is, artistic movies. So... And all this time, I thought only the French, or the Swedes, can make good movies. No! The best movie ever made is an American movie! I particularly liked the couple that spend the whole night kissing in the desert, the catfight between the wives who never stop arguing and that the little girl was dubbed by an adult. If, like me, you have a very good taste, you'll love this piece of... art!

review_title: Dear movie gods, why was this film made!?

review_detailed_main:
More than five times as many reviews have been posted of this film on the IMDb than of 'Last Year at Marienbad' (whose total number presently stands at 125)!

Having once again come across this title mentioned in passing as a legendary stinker, I decided to give it a whirl on YouTube and was pleasantly surprised to find that it's in colour, and thankfully runs less than an hour and a quarter. Distributed by Emerson Film Enterprises (who four years earlier had gifted us 'The Creation of the Humanoids'), like most films famous for being really, REALLY bad 'Manos' certainly isn't up to much, but is hardly THAT bad. Anything made around that time by Elvis Presley or Andy Warhol is a far greater trial to sit through; and turning in a lousy film on a microscopic budget doesn't take much doing.

The attention is engaged throughout, whether by the annoying jazz score, the swarms of moths that flutter about during the night-for-night scenes, The Master's foxy coven of wives in diaphanous white robes, glossy red lipstick and sixties permanent waves, and the enormous red hands printed on The Master's ceremonial robes that make him resemble Kenny Everett as Brother Lee Love; all in glorious sixties Eastmancolor!

Jackey Neyman as young Debbie never seems to be paying much attention to what's going on around her, while the late John Reynolds - whose beard I could never figure out was real or not - staggers about as if he's recently suffered a stroke.

'Manos' is definitely a poorly made movie, but I just cannot bring myself to say that it is the worst of all time. I feel that it was one of those things that slips through the cracks or cheats its way into the public consciousness. 'Manos' has a lot things that shout amatuer filmmaking -- but it successfully brings to the screen a story and yes it has a plot. I am not going to sum this movie up like so many other people do. The plot is simple, a family encounters something dark and horrific. The problem that so many people have with this movie is the lame script, disasterous sound effects, the muted color, and the meandering plot. You know what, that is comparable to a lot of people's opinions. Say what you may, but I have seen so many "works of artistic expression" that are the equivalent to 'Manos.' Yet, these people were constantly lied to about how great their poem, short story, painting, etc. was. It was the level of amatuer that kept these pieces of artistic expression from the public eye. As stated before, 'Manos' just simply slip through the cracks. Also, it did not try to exploit me, say like a _Gigli_ or _Batman and Robin_. 3 out of 10 stars

review_title: Come on people, it isn't that bad.
review_detailed_main:
Just taken as a film, sure it stinks but is it the worst movie ever? No. Is it the worst movie ever shown on MST3K? No, that "honour" goes to Angel's Revenge, the movie that literally made me consider suicide.

And it has Torgo, I mean when I think of memorable film characters, it's Hannibal Lecter, Atticus Finch, Bill the Butcher and Torgo.

They just need to give Torgo his own franchise and cast an A list actor.

I want to see a remake of it with an all star cast, shot the same way.

Michael could be George Clooney, the master could be John Malkovich, Torgo could be Ewan McGregor, the wives could be like Halle Berry, Lucy Liu, Gabrielle Union (The Master could be assembling a Benneton ad here), etc.

But getting to the point, sure this movie stinks but it isn't the worst movie ever.

For decades, until this movie was discovered by the show Mystery Science Theatre 3000, ( a small cult comedy show that forces its lead character to watch really, really, REALLY bad movies ) no one was aware of the absolute horridness of this movie. But now, cult film fanatics, fans of the show, and film critics alike have almost unanimously dubbed this film "the worst movie ever made."

But what makes it so bad? Let's see: corpse-like emotionless acting ( except perhaps Torgo who is the best character the movie has to offer ), the worst editing I've ever seen ( and I've been editing high-school DV videos for 4 years ), audio dubbing reminiscent of old Godzilla movies, and a script that makes "poorly-constructed" seem insignificant, for starters. I gave it a 2 just because of the possibility that the filmmakers weren't serious and that it has maybe one or two good transitions/ideas.

Plot summary: you know the drill, lost family in the desert winds up at a house where they need to spend the night with a weird housekeeper named Torgo who guards the place while the "master" is away. Things get worse and worse until they discover that it is home to a dark cult who worships a deity known as Manos. Throw in some bad plot deviations such as teenage romance and feminine competition... it's so fragmented it's impossible to do an accurate plot summary.

Bad? Definitely. Fun to watch? Absolutely. I recommend the MST3K version though, or else you might just consider suicide, as that is exactly what 4 of the people involved in the making of this movie, including John Reynolds (Torg ) did after its release. No, I'm not kidding. Oh, and not to mention, the commentary is hilarious. In the case of a worldwide nuclear crisis, all United States missiles and those of friendly nations calibrate their weapons on the town of El Paso for allowing this movie to be made in their town.

The End ?

review_title: Oh my god it real is pooh pooh.
review_detailed_main: This has one of this one of the worst horror movie of all time. The story line is awful. The acting is awful. The ending is awful. It is not scary. This is a pile of pooh. It is so campy. And real stupid. It real pooh. Do not see it. It is one of the worst movies ever. Do not see it. It is a big pile of pooh with pooh on it. It is stinker then pooh. Do not waste your time. And do not waste your money. Do not see this movie. It is not scary at all. It is the worst horror movie ever. Do not see it. It so stinky. It could not be any stinker. It is an awful movie. Do not see this movie it is pooh. It is awful. Troll 2 is a better movie.

review_title: Friends don't let friends watch Manos
review_detailed_main:
I think that every aspiring filmmaker needs to give Hal Warren a big round of applause: He lowered the bar for independent filmmakers. On a more serious, much more appreciative note, Manos the Hands of Fate deserves respect not for the film, but for the fact that this was a movie made on a whim that managed to get made, despite many setbacks. Even more surprising then it getting made, is that it got picked up by a company and was distributed to major theaters.

And nowadays, the film has a large fan base. Well, I would hesitate to say it is a "Fanbase" seeing that many of us are dedicated to hating this movie. It is a God awful film. Though I would have to say that if it was a better film, the ending would have been seen by many as edgy (though only a year or so ahead of its time). Though it really didn't matter how it ended, because most people couldn't get through the beginning.

I warned people that this movie is not for the weak. They must have thought I meant weak stomachs because they laughed it off. I have had so many people come up to me and tell me just how much they despised the movie. I guess they thought ten minutes of dialog-free driving was an exaggeration. The script was written within one week, but it's not like it's a complicated story. Family takes a wrong turn, ends up in a lodge run by a cult. It's about them trying to escape their clutches. Bad dubbing. Bad camera work. Good acting destroyed by bad dubbing. This just is a bad movie that seems to drag on forever.

And I am proud to own this film. Seriously. Some movies are so bad they are good. Some are just so bad they are, well, bad. This one is the latter. So unbelievably bad that one can call themselves a fan but refuse to watch it time after time, because they know the horror that is Manos: the Hands of Fate.

review_title: Why did this not get an Oscar?
review_detailed_main: The most amazing film I have ever seen. Schindler's List is like Power Rangers compared to this. The master even liked it, and he is hard to please. Two thumbs up, WAY up!

Oh gosh I cant even start... But only that this is probably one of the worst movies I have ever seen and hopefully i wont watch anything else in the future that makes this movie look at least 3 percent better. Lol

review_title: A terrible punishment heaped upon 2 innocent Bots ( and 1 Human )

review_detailed_main: When I first got into MST3K and went hunting around for what are the best episodes of the show. Of course, right on the top of the list, is Manos. And for many reasons this should be right toward the top of the list of great episodes. But, it is painful to watch even with a great riff on top of it. The thing was made by a manure salesman from Texas so you know it's quality. A friend and I sat down and watched this one night and it about killed us. It's the film equivalent of getting hit by a car. It's not enjoyable but it makes for a good time when you commiserate with others about your experience. I own the DVD of this that has the mst3k version and the unriffed version and I've never been stupid enough to watch this without Mike and the bots. It's a good ep. of the show but be prepared, it is a slog getting through this movie. Long Days and Pleasant Nights, Tom Snapp

review_title: Yeah, this movie's about as satisfying as a bowl of cold oatmeal.
review_detailed_main: Okay, so this movie is REALLY bad, but it's not even in the top (or bottom) ten percent of bad movies; at least it has some vestige of a plot, (if you're into avant-garde jazz) a really cool musical score ("hey, get that cat off the piano"), and is creepy (which means it elicits at least SOME emotional response). Now, if you want to see one of the contenders for the worst film ever, check out "The Castle of Fu Manchu," which has absolutely no redeeming qualities whatsoever.

I'm sorry, but I really have to weigh in on this puppy.

I think everyone is making way too much of 'Manos'. Sure, it's fun to queue up and pound away at this pathetic punching bag of a movie, but that's hardly a worthy challenge, is it. One might as well stuff a runty, two-day old kitten into a pair of wrestling Speedos then drop Andre the Giant onto it like a bomb. Wow. What a contest.

Part of the problem (well, my problem) with the reviews, springs from the tacit notion that this film is legitimate. That is to say, legitimate to the extent that there is a general assumption that because it actually made it into the theaters, it belonged there at all. With that legitimacy lent, it then became fair game and, hence, worthy of any level of consideration. But knowing that the film's creator attempted to distance himself from his own creation, leads me to believe that, ultimately, 'Manos' was never intended to be released into the world of Man. (Well, at least not into the world of THIS man.) Consider: Should the impromptu Super 8's of your infant nephew Stevie explosively pooping into his Pampers hit the local Cineplex? Of course not. So your Sony camera caught all the hot action when that errant barbecue spark got to your new Ferrari Modena which then sent your flame-engulfed great grandmother on her merry way through the garage door. You really want moviegoers to sit through that sort of thing? Come on.

And something else. There is no great profundity or meaning in the fact that some cast members took their own lives, and perhaps due to the incredible shame they felt in participating in such a crumby venture. No one kills themselves over appearing in bad movies (although some should). It is more likely that anyone disturbed enough to volunteer for 'Manos' is disturbed enough to "off" themselves without 'Manos' as a catalyst. 'Manos' was symptomatic; it wasn't the cause. Those four actors? I feel for them, but their days were numbered long before 'Manos' ever steamily plopped into the theaters. Okay. It's possible that 'Manos' accelerated them toward their common doom like an F-16CJ in full afterburner. Still, it was gonna happen. Further evidence as to the psychological state of the cast members? (Notice that I avoid calling them actors.) The performances throughout. Case closed. I won't waste IMDb server space on this one. Although, going by Torgo's performance, one could be forgiven for assuming that his suicide preceded the making of 'Manos'. That would nicely explain much of what I saw (and smelled).

With that said on the suicides, it's quite possible that the four in question faked their own deaths in order to escape the ignominy associated with their hideous doings. Sort of an augmented version of the witness protection program, although, in this case the witnesses are also the perpetrators. Doesn't seem fair, does it.

Final Comment: I was 10 years old and in Brooklyn when 'Manos' was released. So it's highly unlikely that I had anything to do with it. I just wanted that out there for the record. Thank you.

review_title: Not all bad. Just mostly bad.
review_detailed_main:
Yeah, the acting is pretty bad, the plot is never really explained, and the camera work sucks, but everyone here seems to forget that those things alone don't make the movie the #1 worse of all time. The fact is, this movie is almost bearable to watch, which is more than I can say for other movies. Manos is really more pathetic than bad.

Reasons:

Plot: Ok, it sucks. A lot. But look at the bright side. At least it has a beginning, middle, and end. Once again, I have seen movies which do not.

Acting: Again, it is bad. But at least you can make fun of some of the acting, laugh at it. The rest is just pathetic.

Action: All the "action" scenes in this movie, of which there are very few, are pretty lame. Moving on.

Humor: The only thing funny in this movie is Torgo, though he is not meant to be.

Music: Heh, well, let's just say it is really, really bad.

All of these things are reasons to rate Manos as being a very bad movie, but the worst movie ever? Hardly. Here is how I would rate Manos:

Here is my scale for bad movies

Level 1: Standard bad movie . Level 2: A movie so bad it is funny. Level 3: A movie so bad it has stopped being funny. Level 4: A movie so bad it is even worse than 3. Disturbingly bad. So bad every copy of the movie deserves to be burned.

I rate Manos, Hands of Fate as a Level 2.8, one of the worse ratings I have ever given a movie, but not the worst.

review_title: Manos - the hands of fate. Boring or entertaining?

review_detailed_main: This is a good movie. I have no idea why they all badmouth it, and I don't get the "Bottom 100" thing. Sure, for some, it was a box office hit, and for some, it hit rock bottom and made a permanent home there! Someone still worked hard to tape it: I've lifted a full-size film camera before on my shoulder and it's really heavy! Sure, the special effects and actors were worthy to be turned into dogs and tortured by little children, or into ants and squished by nearly anything! But, your opinion still counts. But, I'm not one to blast my counterparts. Your opinion still counts, and if I say it's great, and you say it made you get cramps from how bad it was, that's fine. The choice is all yours...

I'd heard of Manos but only just recently got around to finally viewing it. And yes, in the bad movie department it doesn't disappoint. While worse than Plan 9 From Outer Space, it's still not as bad as Monster-A-Go-Go. And of course to make this movie worth watching you should watch the MST3K version.

The acting is horrendous, the lighting is poor, the sound is bad, and the video a bit fuzzy. Typical for amateur, low-budget movie efforts. Also typical for low-budget movies is the plot. Travelers get lost, find a group of weirdos, then try to escape from said weirdos. Tell me you haven't heard that one before. And yet another typical amateur low-budget mistake are many scenes which seem to go nowhere, along with confusing plot lines. But you have to see the Master's wonderful cloak.

Interspersed with the plot are a couple of policemen who don't seem too keen to investigate anything except for the couple who seem to be interested in making out in a sports car 24/7.

If there is one bright spot in this cinematographic dungheap is that the character of Torgo really did come off as creepy. I understand reading the trivia was that the actor was on LSD at the time which caused his twitchy, out-of-it behavior. That's not to say that the part was good or that he was a good actor, though, but you really wouldn't want to spend the night with Torgo.

I can understand why this movie bombed at the premier and why it's consistently been rated as one of the worst movies in history.
Far better than salmon bhois radhe.mmmmkkhgifchfhxu Yusuf Leona outskirt hi.

review_title: only good when aired on MST3K
review_detailed_main: If I had seen this movie anywhere else but MST3K, I would have run away screaming. If I had rented this movie for free I would have tried to get a refund. But even on MST3K, it was hard to watch. It was the only movie where there were so many gaps in action that the robots started getting bored. You know a movie is bad when you see a car driving past a corn field and they show how long it takes to drive through Iowa in real time. I drove through Iowa once, it seemed shorter than the time it took to watch this movie. The fact that one of the main actors killed himself soon after this movie was made, tells you how bad he feels about what he did to the American Public.

This has got to be the worst movie ever made. The thing looks like a home movie that was filmed on an 8mm camera. I'm serious. This movie is just horrible. Don't ever watch it unless it's the MST3000 version.

Manos has a great reputation, but it isn't true, the trully worst movies aren't even noteworthy, this however sits securely in the bad pantheon along with the works of Andy Milligan, Herschell Gordon Lewis, and Ed Wood. For me the best worst movie remains 1989's Things. I need in my collection now - Birdemic, The Room and Troll 2.

So. As I understand, Manos isn't a famous movie. For that, I hate people who say that movies like "Surf School" or "Gigli" or "Crossover" is the worst movie in the world. I think that if you haven't rated Manos then before rating movie 1/10, it should give a warning like "You haven't yet rated Manos, are you sure you want to rate this movie 1/10?" when you want to rate any movie to 1/10. This movie is SO bad, that its unexplainable in words, but I'll give my best.

First of all, the camera-work is the first bad sign you notice watching this movie, which doesn't matter that much if the movie were good. The other thing that really bothers me is that The actors are so bad that I think a bum in a garbage bin outside would do a better job acting. Also, the movie is supposed to be a horror movie but its a different kind of horror! You don't get scared by any monster but the movie itself. You can't keep watching this movie after 20 minutes without help. You will have fear for going blind and deaf.

I seriously recommend to watch this movie if you ever think of watching anything from the bottom list.

review_title: The Worst Movie of All Time
review_detailed_main: This movie was simply MADE for Mystery Science Theatre 3000. It''s people standing around saying things (sometimes known as a poor excuse of "acting") and a dead limp plot untill someone in the movie gets SLAPPED TO DEATH. Slap (no pun intended) on an mst3k filter and youve got one of the funniest movies of all time. See this movie!

review_title: If it wasn't for MST 3K, it would be unwatchable
review_detailed_main:
I saw "Manos: The Hands of Fate" on what is probably the most famous episode of "Mystery Science Theater 3000" (or "MST 3K" for short). That show showcases bad movies and manages to make them watchable thanks to a host and his robot friends constantly making fun of them, but this particular movie was almost beyond saving even for "MST 3K." Anyone who thinks that many filmmakers in mainstream Hollywood today are inept should probably take a look at "Manos." I didn't think it was possible to get absolutely everything wrong while making a film, but the people responsible for this movie managed to do it. The whole thing was shot by a camera that not only couldn't record sound, but couldn't even shoot more than thirty seconds of footage at one time. As a result there are countless clumsy jump cuts, continuity errors, and dialog that was (very badly) dubbed in later by only three people. When you combine that with horrible cinematography, limited lighting, ugly sets, uglier music, and repetitive dialog you get what probably deserves to be called one of the worst movies ever made.

Despite all of these shortcomings, "Manos" has gained something of a cult following among fans of so-bad-they're-good movies. While I wouldn't go as far as to call myself a fan of this movie, I can kind of see why it would have such a following. There is a certain charm to this film that suggests that everyone involved was really trying their best to come up with something good (they were just really bad at it, so they failed miserably). The plot, which centers on a lost family stopping at a lodge in the middle of nowhere and being tormented by its mystical "master" and his (oddly likable) satyr henchman, probably would've been salvageable in the hands of the right filmmakers. There's also a somewhat creepy atmosphere that almost makes itself felt through the film's shortcomings. Sadly, it isn't enough to save this mess (only enough so that I can give it a score of two out of ten instead of a one).

If nothing else, I can honestly say that "Manos: The Hands of Fate" is one of the most bizarre movies I have ever seen. I don't know if I could recommend it to anybody that I would consider a friend. I would tell them to watch the "MST 3K" version though, if only because it proves my theory that that particular show is at its best when the movies are at their worst.

review_title: Manos - Worst film of our time
review_detailed_main:
This film is only watchable in the Mystery Science Theatre 3000 DVD featuring this film.

Otherwise it should be categorized as a torture device to those with good taste.

The MST3K (Mystery Science Theater 3K) episode showing this film is truly MST3K at it's best.

Even though the director has not received any noteworthy recognition in his lifetime, the family should be told that this movie is the benchmark for all that is wrong in Independent Films.

When I saw this movie without the MST3K comments I became very bored and watching anything but this would be welcome. Even watching Joe Versus the Volcano in HIndu would be more interesting.

If you do not decide to make this movie the worst film of all time either you don't know how bad of a movie this is or you have watched Who's Harry Crumb and are upset it wasn't nominated for an Oscar.

Face it. This movie is in violation of good taste and the movie making process in it's entirety.

If you don't think so, please watch it again.

Clearly the cinematic equivalent of getting lost in a strange town and going around the poorly-run sewage plant several times. I don't see how anyone could possibly sit through this garbage without Joel and the 'bots--and even Frank and Dr. Forrester apologized while they were showing it! I could only imagine what was going through the minds of those poor souls who actually saw it at the drive-in during its brief original theatrical run. If hell were a drive-in, it would be located next to a sewage plant and "Manos" would be on screen eternally.

review_title: Torgo the Hand of Manos. Comedy Horror! Dracula without Fangs or Blood, mixed with Twilight Zone. Haters should watch modern action candy cgi film instead.
THE SINGLE WORST MOVIE OF ALL TIME
review_detailed_main:
"MANOS" THE HANDS OF FATE is the worst movie there is. I find it hard to believe that so many people were able to sit through this unforgivable mess, even with the MST3K commentary!
