Furthermore, I find it impossible to believe that anyone actually liked it! 541 people thought this was great? You fools! That's like drinking hemlock and calling it Koolaid! I am not exaggerating here, there has never been a movie worse than this. Some say that GIGLI is the worst movie ever made, but they are simply overreacting to a fresh stinker (I mean Ben Afflec and Lopez are irritating and all, but they could never make a movie worse than this!). I am voting in to tip the scales and put this trash on the bottom where it belongs.

The film opens with a seemingly endless series of establishing shots that are so lifeless, it would be a compliment to call them 2 dimensional. After what feels like 20 minutes of boring travel, our heroes: a couple, their daughter, and a dog, come to a house in the middle of nowhere. That's when we meet the freak Torgo, who has giant kneecaps. The husband talks to him asking if they can stay the night. Sounds simple enough, right? They can't even finish a simple sentence without stumbling and pausing for small eternities! They are allowed to stay and the "horror" unfolds very slowly. Later we meet The Master, who wears a cape with hands on it as he worships Manos (which means hands, making the title a pathetic redundancy). The Master has wives who wrestle for his favor in nightgowns. All of it is presented in static shots, on very low quality film, which are all held for too long. The dialogue, acting, design, script, direction, music, photography, you name it, it all stinks! In fact, it is all the absolute worst it can be. The movie is such an enormous failure, one wonders if they were even trying. It all builds to a weak horror-movie conclusion and the mercifully ends. The 74 minutes it takes to watch it feels like about five hours.

This movie makes PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE seem like CITIZEN KANE. I myself am one who can enjoy a movie when its bad enough (why else would I watch MST3K?), but this thing is just too terrible to enjoy, on any level. The only reason to watch the MST is to hear the comments, which still don't protect you from the utter pain of viewing the movie. MANOS is a one of a kind pain, rivaled only by THE INCREDIBLY STRANGE CREATURES WHO STOPPED LIVING AND BECAME MIXED UP ZOMBIES. The film, the director, the actors, and the entire crew should have been publicly burned for this crime against the cinema. It doesn't get any worse than this!

review_title: Probably the Most Boring Horror Movie Ever Made
review_detailed_main:
Back in the mid 1960s, a Texas fertilizer and insurance salesman named Harold P. Warren made a bet with screenwriter Stirling Silliphant (writer of In the Heat of the Night) that anyone can make a horror movie. Soon afterwards, Warren created his own horror movie on a budget of $19,000, with random people cast to play the characters, and a 16mm camera that could not record sound, causing the film to be dubbed in post. The result was Manos: The Hands of Fate (literally translated to Hands: The Hands of Fate), which despite going largely unnoticed for many years due to only playing in drive-ins and one Texas theater, it soon developed a cult following after MST3K lampooned it and turned it into a famously bad film. Me personally, I wish this film would remain obscure, for it's not even so bad it's funny, it's just pathetic.

The film revolves around a vacationing family who end up getting trapped at a lodge run by a pagan cult, and they try to flee them as the cult's members decide what to do to them. Now this plot may seem really basic on paper, but with the right amount of pacing and momentum, this film could elevate its thin narrative into something with lots of substance....that is not what happened. Really, the whole movie could be cut down into 10 minutes, not only because of several insignificant scenes, but also because it drags certain moments on for no reason. There are many times when characters just stand around doing nothing even after they're done talking, and it becomes very awkward and even frustrating to watch. In addition, a whole mini plot with a couple making out in a car feels like it belongs in a completely different movie. Even an out of place catfight breaks lose with the cult master's wives, showing off pure incompetent storytelling as far as the eyes can see.

Now I'm well aware that Warren could only use nobodies to play the characters, but ho'boy does nobody look like they have any idea what they're doing. Warren plays the main character Mike, and it looks like he's trying to figure out what to do on set rather than giving a performance. Same can be said about the rest, especially Mike's wife Margaret, the daughter, and the infamous Torgo. Speaking of Torgo, he's probably the most interesting character in the film from his design alone, mainly because his actor John Reynolds was high when he played the character, making his scenes hysterical but also questionable. The only other actor who seems to be having some resemblance of fun is the one playing the cult master, but he feels like a hammy cartoon villain with all the wackiness sucked out. Also, it is painfully obvious that the movie was dubbed in post, down to the young daughter clearly being voiced by a grown woman, but they had to work with what they were given, so I'm sure they tried in that aspect.

Lastly, in spite of the shoe string budget, there's way too many infamous technical deficiencies to behold. Probably the biggest sin is the editing and continuity flaws, showcasing the never ending scenes and confusing side narratives that have nothing to do with anything. There's even a moment where you can clearly see the clapperboard right when the film cuts to the makeout couple. In terms of story errors, Torgo is supposed to be a satyr, so John Reynolds wore metallic rigging, but he accidentally wore it backwards which made him look more like a man with oversized knees. Also, it is never once mentioned in the film that Torgo is a satyr, so anyone watching this film will forever see him as some weird deformity. Not to mention, the soundtrack is poorly synchronized, and they even repeat the same tracks and voice recordings multiple times just to pad things out. Lastly, the whole opening showing the family driving feels like it was meant to have opening credits that were never added in, proving that the best solution would have been to trim the scene down, like the rest of the movie.

Overall, Manos is a painfully incompetent and abysmal watch that can only be admired by Mystery Science Theater and RiffTrax fans for its disastrous technical failures and horrendous writing and acting. It's true what they say, nobody ever sets out to make a bad movie, and I admittedly do respect Harold P. Warren for actually making this film out of a bet, no matter how incomplete it is. Besides, plenty of filmmakers have proven to make their own successful horror movies on shoe string budgets, such as George Romero with The Living Dead series, John Carpenter with Halloween, Peter Jackson with Bad Taste, Sam Raimi with The Evil Dead, and more. However, given that those people have talent and experience in film-making, Manos is an example of why films need to be made by people who actually have some background in the techniques of crafting films, not fertilizer salesmen who make bets with Hollywood writers with a rich profile. Unless you're a cynic who adores riffing on the worst of the worst, I think Manos is better off left deep in the heart of Texas where nobody will ever seen it again.

review_title: Like being stuck in a nightmare
review_detailed_main: This was like being stuck in a nightmare. The movie NEVER ENDS!!! And the knees.. the knees!!!! Without MST3K, I think I would have exploded. As it was, I was barely holding on. I'd rather watch mud dry. It's at least not going to turn my brain into goo.

I would have never guessed that "film" could be so terrible but I was corrected and beaten over the head with that correction. This was a serious attempt at film making, and I felt uncomfortable being in the same room with my cousin when we watched it! There are literally MINUTES of film with NO dialog, NO movement, AND NO POINT!!

review_title: Watch with friends for true enjoyment
review_detailed_main: Very slow. Recommend watching it with a friend group or a date that likes bad movies. I found it extremely difficult to enjoy this disaster alone. 1 star for holding up to being one of the worst mainstream movies of all time.

I would love to see the American Medical Association do a study of

the risk of severe mental depression in people who have seen

Manos versus those who haven't. The results I guarantee would

be staggering. I mean...that film was so bad...it robbed me of my

will to live. I've seen some baaaaad movies before, but usually I

can find some unintentional comedy to get me through the

hobglobins and killer klowns from outer spaces of the world. I

would have rather been getting my wisdom teeth removed with no

anesthesia than even watch that opening sequence of them

driving around, sprinkled with porn music and stock footage. I can't

say anything that hasn't been said, but I just want to warn you, you

might want to keep any means of committing suicide locked and

away from your person if you're going to watch this film.

a negative 30 million out of 10 stars.

Surely it is easier to make a mediocre movie than it is to make a bad movie. Hollywood effortlessly cranks out the same pedestrian two-star drivel year after year. But to make a truly bad movie, a movie that sinks below the schlock and makes a name for itself in the annals of badness, takes a special kind of effort.

A mad kind of deluded genius can give you PLAN 9 FROM OUTER SPACE; inexplicable mass ineptitude can yield HUDSON HAWK; a sick mind seeking to stretch the limits of depravity can come up with FREDDY GOT FINGERED.

But nothing can explain MANOS, THE HANDS OF FATE. This is a new level of bad, an unapproachable, incomprehensible kind of bad. So bad, so very very bad, that it flies off the low end of the continuum and emerges... where???

Note that the most popular user rating for this movie is 1, and the second most popular vote is 10. Why? Because this movie exists outside the known universe, in a place where 1 and 10 occupy the same space. Charles Foster Kane reaches out into the void, and there he finds... Torgo.

Imagine cinema's finest moment, its absolute high point: perhaps the anguished face of Maria Falconetti in THE PASSION OF JOAN OF ARC; or the fog-enshrouded final moments of CASABLANCA; or THE GODFATHER'S operatic tableau of baptism and bloodshed; or LAWRENCE OF ARABIA emerging from the sun-distorted haze of the Sun's Anvil...

Now go one step further, one step beyond the edge of abyss, where the very fabric of celluloid is infinitely distorted and space folds back upon itself...

Step through, and you will emerge in MANOS, THE HANDS OF FATE.

My rating is for the non-Mystery Science Theater 3000 version of the movie. I'd give Alienator's review a 10 out of 10 if there were multiple vote spaces. I've rarely seen such a thoughtful review on a message board site. Most of the time, people either gush about how great a movie was or gripe about what a miserable failure it was. I've been guilty myself of doing both in the past. I've also managed to write some balanced, thoughtful reviews too. It's not easy to do, especially if you have very strong feelings either negative or positive about the film. This Alienator person should be a professional movie critic like Roger Ebert if he or she isn't one already.

Personally, I find the non MSTK version of this film to be very bad, but not the worst ever. The MSTK version is quite funny at times due to the trio's antics. I won't go so far as to say that it is the worst film of all time though. Like Alienator, I agree that given the conditions the film was created under and the skill of the filmmakers it's actually an amazing achievement that the film is still well known after all these years. Think of all the bigger budgeted, better casted films that have been made that have been all but forgotten. "Dr. Who and the Daleks" anyone? I'm a Dr. Who fan and own many of the TV episodes and movies including this one and even I think the movie is pretty horrible. I'm not sure that a non-Who fan could stand to watch it. How they ever got the great Peter Cushing to be in it is beyond me. Must have been really low on money.

Or how about the great Orson Welles' version of Macbeth? He worked on it for a very long time and was never able to make a polished movie out of it. I really like most of Welles' work but Macbeth is terrible. Talk about poor editing, timing, lighting etc. The only saving grace of the entire film is Orson's acting. Every other aspect of the film is pretty bad. It was made early in his career and he was still learning. The main difference between Welles and the guy who directed Manos is that Welles didn't give up after his early attempts and kept trying and got better. Maybe with enough encouragement, funds and a lucky break or two the guys who made Manos could have done better in future movies instead of giving up after their first one.

review_title: OMG-This is the greatest flick ever made
review_detailed_main:
If you want to experience nirvana, please watch this classic film without joel and the bots. They take away from the wonderful cinematic bliss that is Manos, the hands of fate. From a fertilizer selling director comes this tale of a wrong turn leading to a hellish man who takes women as his own for his satanic harem. With him as always is Torgo, he of the huge knees and great theme music. With shots that go nowhere for ten minutes, and a maddening plodding pace, manos exhibits the best of Stanley Kubrick's 2001 and was undoubtedly an influence on that masterwork. If you wish to discuss this further with me, please message me.

P.S.: This is the best film ever made in a vacant lot.. lol

this movie exceeds the hype about being the worst movie ever made. you need to be a genius to make a movie this bad. wow I watched it RAW. i almost died of laughter. not sure which is worse birdimic or this.

I believe this movie deserves a reward. no matter how bad you are you cannot reach this level. no sir. you could make a better movie using your iphone with your dog. you will laugh because parts of this movie does not make any sense. why there are 2 teenagers getting filmed being caught by a cop TWICE? while a family stuck in "the masters house"? these guys never meet nor it adds ANYTHING to the story. JUST WHY???. why is it called "manos" which means hands in Spanish?. why there is a guy with weird knees who guards a tiny house of "the master" while "the master" doesn't use it and sleeps in the middle of the desert???.

I feel sorry because some actors committed suicide after this movie. they should know that they have a cult following that may made them feel better. may they rest in peace.

review_title: The worst film i've ever seen (and that's saying something!)
review_detailed_main:
The MST3K version roasting of this turkey is one of my favorite episodes of the classic "Joel" era of that once great show.

Just recently some friends and i actually found a copy of the original Manos in a run down video store and decided to test ourselves by trying to make it through it without the assistance of Joel and the Bots. Sadly, we just couldn't do it...........

rating:1

review_title: Was it meant to be this scary?
review_detailed_main: "Manos, the hands of fate" was made thanks to the people of El Paso. You see, they ran a competition in the town back in the 1960s. The competition was that anyone who has written a film script should write their name on a piece of paper. All the names were put into a hat - the stuff of legend for yes, indeed, this was Torgo's hat! - and a name would be drawn. The person whose name was drawn would have their film script made into a movie, and that name was Harold Warren. Alas, the greatness of this movie has been overshadowed by the Torgo curse. It is when one commits suicide after completing a movie of such acclaim. For shame El Paso!

What a masterpiece, truly the pinnacle of Hal P. Warren's film career. I really enjoyed the driving sequences in the first 20 minutes of the film, truly haunting! Torgo was a brilliant character as well, from his very sexually appealing passes at the women in this film (how did they resist the charms of Torgo?) to his amazing strength that only requires him to tap Hal with his death stick to knock him out. Other great features of this movie include: the Master's beautiful cape, Hal's widows peak in the mirror (what a camera shot!), and of course Torgo's knees. 100000000000000000000/10!!! The best movie ever, period.

My girlfriend and I watched the original version of Manos last night (the director's cut-- so that we could see Hal Warren's vision in its pristine glory) and yes, it was lousy filmmaking. The actors had to keep moving before someone made furniture out of them. The editing was poor. The fights and killing scenes were ludicruously bad (the "wives" massaging Torgo to death made me laugh for whole minutes).

Still, I can't say I hated this movie. It was lame and laughable, but harmless. It didn't alternately bore me and p**s me off the way _Ringmaster_ and _Armageddon_ did. Highly paid entertainment executives and writers who made six, seven, and eight figure salaries produced those steaming piles of offal. They should have known better. Sure it was stupid, but given the source, what did you expect? Besides, it wasn't obnoxious, loud, and, (because it was so easy to laugh at its absurdities), it held my interest.

So, yeah, it was bad. I've seen worse.

My friends and I watched the MST3K movie a long time ago. We also tried to watch it without MST3K. It can not be done. I have to give credit to Joel and the bots, they made a REALLY bad movie funny. (I guess that is their job :)). I could not image having to sit through this movie and try to make it funny. There was absolutely NO continuity to the movie. It is funny to see all the shots filmed at different times of the day. One shot will be at dusk and the next will be at high noon and back to dusk. Plus, the sound was just horrible. Plus, I think there might have been a plot around here somewhere. Oh well, MST3K made it most bearable.

Yep, it's a real stinker. I've seen both the MST3K screening, and the whole thing in its glory. It's just incredibly painful to watch. Be sure to have plenty of beer on hand. I guess that I need to see Yusei oji (ranked lower at time of writing) to see if in fact anything worse was ever committed to celluloid.

Although this is possibly the worst movie i have ever seen, i have not laughed at any movie so much as i did in this! The crapyness and cheese and all over bad everything just left me in stitches for the whole session. I actualy had the privelage of seeing this film on a big screen, at the Wellington Incredibly Strange Film Festival 99.

review_title: Hal Warren yet again succeeds in outstanding movie-making progress
review_detailed_main: Never has the opening sequence of a movie gripped my by the throat and never let go. The non-stop action in the first ten minutes of the film took me on a mega roller coaster ride of suspense. The audience barely has time to catch it's breath before confronted by the most genuinely frightening character since Boo Radley in "to kill a mockingbird". I literally had to close my eyes to avoid being overly terrified. Torgo set the stage for characters such as Hannibal Lecter and Leatherface. For I'll forever be haunted by Torgo's menacing voice and the terrifying theme music which will always challenge my sanity. There's no question in this author's opinion that there will be a much anticipated sequel. With such a terrifying movie, one can only hope that the second time around will be half as frightening.

Every shot, every line of the "script", every "set", every human emotion that was attempted to be portrayed by the "actors" (it's as if they weren't actual human actors at all, but clones, who never experienced fear before, and certainly didn't know what a film was, but had it explained to them by a director that never saw one before either....but I digress).... every moment is either highly entertaining awesomeness or madness inducing, pushing one to a full-on psychotic break. There is no in-between. I wish you, viewer, the best of luck, and my all the gods have mercy on your soul.

There are some movies that are beyond description for a good reason. This is not one of them. Some things are best left unsaid, unreviewed, unexplained, unmentioned and unwatched. This is one. Some movies should be run over, trampled, shot, poisoned, microwaved, burned, urinated upon, buried, and labotomized from the collective conscious. This is definitely one. At the risk of sounding repetitive, watching this movie or ones of this caliber without MST, is slowly being accepted by the medical community as the real reason for aneurisms. Hey Nate.

I will not "spoil" this "movie" for anyone with the "plot" or my interpretation of what I think was supposed to by happening, but suffice it to say this movie has to be watched, and here's why:

Often you will come across a movie that just came out that someone has headlined "worst movie i've ever seen!" in an IMDb comment box.

Very often a viewer will have to great an expectation due to hype. Often you will be told "YOU HAVE TO SEE HOW BAD THIS MOVIE IS!!!" and the film in question turns out to merely be campy, or misunderstood in its entirety, or in need of some lighting, or a better director, better acting, plot modifications etc...

Then you get to "Manos", the Hands of Fate and you 'quickly' discover that nothing will ever, ever, ever be the same again.

Where once before you saw a terrible, over-hyped movie, misunderstood, contrived movie ... now... well now when you watch THAT film you can breath a little easier, taking enormous amounts of satisfaction in knowing that it will, indeed, not be "Manos", the Hands of Fate.

review_title: Beat yourself with a blunt object
review_detailed_main: First off this is one of the great MST3k episodes, but strangely this movie is so bad I still felt sick afterwards.....Torgo and his theme are hilarious, but you are far stronger than I copuld ever dream of being if you can watch this one alone, uncut....I would bow to you as my god, in fact...This movie came from Hell I'm sure of it...

You know how great films get better with each viewing, because you see things you you hadn't noticed before? Well, same with "Manos, the Hands of Faith," except of course in reverse.

The best thing about this thing is the comments. I almost bust a gut from laughing at the spectacle of people struggling to convey their shock ("I didn't believe a movie could be that bad!"), pain ("My brain hurt"), disgust ("Can't think about it without retching"), scorn ("Hands, the Hands of Fate") frustration ("If I could give this a minus score, I would.") and pity ("I can understand why there were three suicides after this"), in order to describe this, this . . .

Next is the debate over whether "Manos" is one of the worst or THE worst. No other possibilities. When I think of other classics like Puma Man or Teenagers from Outer Space, I can understand how people of good will might disagree.

Why don't we do this: Whether or not "Manos, the Hands of Fate" is actually the Worst Movie in history, shouldn't we just go ahead and vote it "Number One," as the perfect paradigm of the bad movie?

The best thing that could have happened to this movie did: it was picked up by MST3K. If you were forced to watch this movie for "entertainment" purposes, WITHOUT the benefit of the 'bots, you'd either cry real tears from pain or laughter. But make no mistake; this movie is bad. Worse than "Supergirl". Awful. Wretched. Honestly, a group of high school students could have done better. This ain't a real high falutin' review...but Manos isn't worth it. Watch it for the laughs on MST3K, but don't say you weren't warned.

review_title: Your "average joe" could not comprehend the horror that is "Manos: Hands of Fate"
review_detailed_main: I could not tell you what the worst movie ever made is, for I have not seen every movie ever made. But I can tell you with great confidence that "Manos: Hands of Fate" is the worst movie I have ever seen. Like most people,I have only seen this "film" in it's MST3K version. Even then, I almost had to turn it off. I can only shudder to think what the original version was like. My hat is off to those brave souls who have actually seen this monstrosity in it's entirety. How they managed to get through the final extended "landscape" scene at the end without the benefit of Tom Servo's hilarious monologue without shooting themselves is a wonder. People say Ed Wood was the worst film ever. Not by a longshot. At least he knew how to keep the damn camera in focus. Others talk of "Ator" or "Space Mutiny". Those were just stupid and inept products of mediocre minds. Hal Warren makes those guys look like Kurosawa. If you want to know how bad it can get, rent "Manos: Hands of Fate. From then on no matter how bad a movie you are watching, you will say to yourself, "at least it's not Manos: Hands of Fate."

review_title: This movie can very well destroy man-kind...
review_detailed_main:
This movie is by far the worst movie i have ever seen and probably the worst in man's history. I literally felt sick after watching it ( no joke! ), and nearly threw up. Wether these are side-effects of the movie or not who cares this movie was bad. Im sure some of the people who read the other comments are thinking " this movie cant be that bad, can it?" The answer is YES! I want you to think of all the things that made Shawshank Redemption ( or what have you ) magnificent and take all that and completely flush it down the jon. Now if my useless rambling isnt enough to convince you then check out some of these facts.

1. The director and overall creator ( Hal Warren ) was a fertilizer salesman before this movie. 2. Hal made this movie on a bet that he could make a decent horror film ( wonder who won that one???) 3.Manos is spanish for hands, therefore the true title is "Hands, The Hands of Fate. 4. The camera Hal used could not record sound and could only record 30 seconds of film before the film was replaced

Now if this isnt enough, then hey watch the movie. Trust me it is even difficult and agaonizing to watch with the help of the bots and Joel. I suppose some of the people out there think i am being too critical, and maybe i am, but i dont care. I will grant those people something and that is they are right that some newer and more expensive movies have been made and come close to this one. The only good thing about this movie is that it can substitute as a sleeping bill. Overall a movie with solid bad directing, acting, writing, and all the other stuff. 2/10

" There's no way out of here, it'll be dark soon, there's no way out of here"

What is this movie sitting as the 'worst' of all time, the very bottom of the bottom 100? Fair enough it doesn't have superb special effects or a particularly meaningful storyline, but Hal Warren has done his VERY best, is that not good enough for you people??? No...obviously not, what more can you ask from a man who's only trying to earn a living? I pity those who vote '1' for this movie, if anyone wants to criticise this movie they should keep it to themselves. Because from my point of view Hal has produced the highest quality of features for his tight budget. Not only has he had to direct it, he even plays an important role in it. Anyway, movies that are being worked with multi-million budgets have been a disaster...Vertical Limit? A complete waste of time! Watch it, try not to pick out it's faults and appreciate Hal's work. After all, he didn't spend a lot of valuable time to make a movie that would get criticised so much

review_title: One of the Bottom 3 films of all time
review_detailed_main:
This, one of the Bottom 3 films of all time, was screened last week in New York, where it likely made more money than in its original theatrical run.

I spent about two-thirds of the film's run time shouting " What is this god-damned movie even about? " For its final third, I didn't care what it was about, I just wanted it to end. Seriously, I couldn't even tell you what genre this film could be classified as, nor could I tell you what the plot is about.

Apparently, filmed in a matter of days, on a budget of only a few thousand dollars, and screened only a couple of times in El Paso ( where it was filmed ) , and then lost for decades, until its rediscovery by Mystery Science Theatre 3000, this is seriously one of the worst, most excruciatingly boring films ever made. It's barely even mockable, let alone reviewable. The music score consists of competing sax, and ivories being tickled in the most obtuse, out of place fashion, seemingly intended for some other movie, and it's used throughout almost every scene. Most times I've heard the title/ lead character's name spoken, it's MAN-os, but in the dialogue in the film, it's pronounced like MAH-nos. However his name is correctly pronounced, I kept waiting for his dog to bite him. No such luck.

A middle aged nuclear family ( a grumpy old man in ridiculously over-sized trousers, his whiny, nagging wife, and their young daughter, who serves absolutely no purpose in the plot of film ) are driving in the desert ( for the first nine minutes of this movie ) and lose their way. They babble about the weather, are stopped about a broken taillight by a cop with nothing else to do, who later hassles a young couple kissing in a parked car ( and the visible guy holding the clapperboard ) on the roadside. The female half of this couple is clearly bored, as she repeatedly delivers her lines while looking directly into the camera. Was this nine minutes long scene really necessary in setting up the plot of this movie?

The family comes across some type of home, inhabited by Torgo, a 25 years old man in old age make-up ( because that always works so well ) , hobbling around, who repeats almost every line of dialogue twice. After their car won't start, they're stuck in this desert overnight, where slightly weird, but mostly just interminably boring, things happen. Torgo tells them " The Master " is dead, but eventually, a hidden, sort of Satanic-looking room is found, where " The Master " is shown apparently alive after all. He's a John Astin lookalike in black robe with red hands, acting grandiose, in front of a group of women, who do little more than sit around and talk for several scenes, before a catfight erupts. The family from the first half disappears for most of this second half, while the John Astin clone and his six wives do ... stuff, ... possibly killing Torgo, because yeah, sure, of course they do.

The kissing couple appear again, at night. It looks like they're parked next to a gas station, judging by the lighting equipment reflected on their car.

About an hour in, it's revealed the father from the first half has a gun... ( ! ) He's been armed for this entire time? He shoots ( shoots at? ) The Master, then for some reason, a lesbian couple is introduced in the last scene, and it appears as though the entire plot is starting again, as this pair of girls get lost, with writer/ director/ producer/ star Harold Warren standing in for Torgo.

A lame joke in the closing credits reads, " The end? "

Yes, it is mercifully the end.

" Our sincere thanks to the city & county of El Paso for their cooperation " I bet they just LOVE having their name attached to this one.

I then shouted at the screen, " What? "

It even has 666 in its url!

review_title: Manos and the Mothers of Invention-Joe's Garage Part VI
Can't get it out of my Mind
review_detailed_main:
This film has taken up far more space in my head than it should have. After seeing it on MST3K, I'm left with nothing but questions that continue to nag me:

-Did this thing really get a theatrical release? If so, who would have agreed to do it? Assuming even the filmmakers, much less a 'distributor', actually watched the darned thing, don't you think someone--anyone--might have pointed out that the footage shot from the window of a moving car could be trimmed by, say, ten minutes? -Who thought it would be OK to film in silent and dub dialogue later. It's a tough enough task for a major Hollywood facility to do properly. Godzilla, anyone? -What provolked someone to make this story, or lack thereof, into a movie? A dare? A bar-bet? Shades of "The Producers" if you ask me. -Is the cast's acting style a salute to German expressionism of the 20's? Or was everyone simply fatigued from their day-jobs and lacked the energy to move at normal human speeds? -What's the deal with Torgo? Knock-knees is an affliction that is neither frightening nor sympathy inducing. If it's such a chore for him to move, as evidenced by the incredibly long sequences of him loading and un-loading luggage, shouldn't he sit down and rest those weary limbs from time to time? -Isn't that tiny two room shack a little small to be housing all that evilness? Wouldn't the mean old Master have a bigger place?

The questions go on and on--and I continue to be baffled by the whole project. So many "why's" and no good answers.

Usually when sitting throughout the latest MST3K abomination, I can laugh along and savor the cracks made by Mike/Joel and the 'bots. I, having a strong stomach and willpower, can sit through any assault on my senses as long as the MST3K buffer is there. This was the ONE exception. I had to stop halfway through and allow myself 24 hours to mentally recover before bravely pushing the play button again. I think even Mr. Ed Wood would have been too embarrassed to release this waste of perfectly good film. "Plan 9 from Outer Space" look like Citizen Kane compared to this turkey.

Obviously from these other reviews, there is a deranged, almost indecipherable plot, no-talent acting, extremely bad acting and the real kicker: the whole film was shot out-of focus and almost no lighting! It actually hurt my eyes to watch it! Even Plan 9 was in focus! What really made me question my sanity was the soundtrack. The bulk of the music(?) sounded like a jazz pianist and clarinet player noodling around for an hour! To this day, I have nightmares about this movie. Not because of the evil dude with the iron-on hands on his zippered, polyester costume, and not because of the skeevy, one-too-many-sessions-on-the-stairmaster Torgo. I have nightmares because it was so bad, that not even the geniuses at Best Brains could save it. It was physically painful, and should be considered by the chinese as a new form of mental torture. I realize that one should not expect Scorcese-like quality from a director who was really a full-time fertilizer salesman, but gez...I think a retarded slug could have made something a little more palatable.

review_title: So Bad I Can't Think of a Clever Title
review_detailed_main: This is it, the absolute worst movie of all time. First of all, the title is redundant and stupid, as anyone knowing any amount of Spanish will tells you that the title is Hands: Hands of Fate. Also, the villain in the movie has hand prints on his cape. Clever. Saying that this movie had a shoestring budget would be an insult to shoestrings; this movie had no budget. In fact, the director and star was... a fertilizer salesman. What can I say, the story is not unusual, a B-grade horror story, but what the director does with it is stuff of legend. The acting is done by the guy's family and friends, and it is obvious. No one here had any inkling on how to act. Second, with the exception of the mysterious Torgo, none of the characters have the least bit of... characterization. The film is blurry, shot with a camera that had no sound. And all the dubbing was done by 2 people! So when someone talks, it's hard to tell who, because all the voices sound the same and you can't tell whose lips are moving. There are points where the movie is so lost that even the keenest of spectator will have to laugh out loud at the movie. An absolute must of bad movie buffs. But be warned, this is not your average bad movie... this is... pain-inducing thriller, Manos, Hands of Fate.

review_title: It's either the best movie or the worst ever made
review_detailed_main: I am only rating this movie one star because it either deserves to be recognized as the best or worst film ever made, and I really doubt that it will be recognized as the best. Being honest, I'd rate this around a 6. The story is bad, the acting is bad, the music is bad, everything is bad-but really enjoyable. Sure the story is really the most basic horror plot possible, but it's unorthodox style prohibits mundanity. Of course the acting is bad, but it is unintentional and not overconfident overacting, it is enjoyable not just some Hallmark style acting. The music is bad, well, it's actually good, really really good(I listen to the album almost weekly). Everything is incredibly watchable about it, kinda like Rocky III (1982). Except Rocky III(1982) wishes it could be in the same league as the epic Manos: The Hands of Fate.

review_title: could have worked on better budget
A true classic - nothing can compare
review_detailed_main: No movie comes close to this classic film in many respects. Hal Warren's top notch directing (and starring role) made this film the instant classic that it was. His lead role of "Michael" was a true inspiration for many up and coming actors like Leonardo Di Caprio, Jerry Seinfeld and Mako. Tom Neyman's depiction of "The Master" was awe-inspiring and evil. He displayed almost a divine aura on the screen. The true gem of this film was the depiction of the quasimodo like "Torgo" by the unforgettable John Reynolds. Its a shame the film world loss such talent due to his unfortunate suicide in 1966.

The fact that someone actually paid to make this movie and thought it was a good idea is proof enough that PT Barnum was right: "Theres a sucker born every minute! Watching this movie without Mystery Science Theater 3000 commentary is quite possibly more impossible than getting a steak away from Rosie O'Donnell.

review_title: Manos-Hands of Fate...? AKA Torgo-Big Knees(TM)...
One of the worst films EVER . . avoid this movie.
review_detailed_main: This is one of the WORST films ever. The direction and script are terrible; during the opening scene, the camera shows a view from a moving car and immediately dissolves into the SAME shot! There isn't much of a story to talk about, so just do the smart thing and avoid this movie.

This film is unbelievably bad. Those 133 votes for "10" are pushing this film out of its deserved position, right at the top of the 100 worst movies list.

I'm going to the MST3K website now, to buy my own copy, so that I can inflict it upon my friends and family...

review_title: How is this no longer the worst movie ever made?!
review_detailed_main:
I have seen this film several times, and after the first or second time even Joel and the Bots can't save this one.

After having used this film almost as an instrument of torture, and as such having endured it several times, I feel capable of going through the SAS selection course or the Royal Navy's Perisher course.

If I can get through this movie without gouging out me eyes and poking out my eardrums, then I can do just about anything. Screw kryptonite, let's see old' Superman put up with this movie.

This film looks like a home movie at Ozzy Osbourne's house and sounds like it was dubbed by the same 3 people using a public restroom as a recording studio.

review_title: It is the fate of all people that go to hell to watch this movie
review_detailed_main: It is difficult to determine what exactly is the epitome of awful, but Manos: The Hands of Fate is just that. If anyone reads this, please, please do not watch this move. You will want to kill for the hour and a half of your life back. The plot is awful, the acting is awful, the lighting is awful--everything that makes a movie good is awful in Manos. There are absoulty no re-deeming qualities about this movie. Even the wise-cracks from Joel and the robots from Mystery Science Theater 3000 can make this movie bearable. It upsets me that some contributers to this site gave this movie a rating of 10. Either these people think that they are funny, or they are just plain stupid. Either way, no sane, intellegent person would even consider giving this movie anything more than a one. Keep voting one, so that this movie can be glorified as the worst movie ever made!

review_title: terrorizing....I think not....well I did watch it.
review_detailed_main:
OK, this is where I would normally say, "This was the worst film I have ever seen", but I can't say that. Try Death Tunnel. Anyway, if it were not for the guys from MST3K I wouldn't have made it through the whole thing. I looked into why this piece of crap was even made, and I found out a lot of information that kind of made me take a second look. The film was made because Harold Warren made a bet with a friend of his that he could make a movie. The guy was a fertilizer salesman. Made and sold it apparently. He didn't really know anything about making movies. Well, he had this junky camera that had to be wound up to film. It only filmed 30 seconds of film at a time and it did not record sound. He and another guy and some woman did all the voices for the film after filming. I didn't even realize that until I read it, so I got to give props to the guy for being inventive enough and to be able to have the patients to do all that work that had to be done to make an actual story. Not a good one, but still a story. He tried to make a sequel, but for some reason was turned away about it. The sequel was written as a book, but I unfortunately do not know the title of it. For some strange reason I would like to read it just to see what else Harold had in mind for a sequel. Its like a train wreck, I shouldn't be looking but I can't look away. I just don't think a sequel to this movie would work without Torgo.

Yes, it is a bad movie. Yes, it has really bad acting. Yes, if you haven't seen it, get the MST3K version. Yes, if you are a fan of "so bad it's good" kind of movies, check it out.

review_title: Can we give this one a negative number?
review_detailed_main:
Why, oh why, was there no Surgeon General's warning on the video tape box:"Warning-Watching 'Manos, The Hands of Fate', will remove years from your life!" Yep, folks, it is every bit as bad as everyone says!

The first third of the film is this family driving around aimlessly. They drive. And they drive. Then they drive some more. And when they're through, they drive. The highlights of this part is the thrilling "Getting pulled over for a busted tailight scene", and a scene of a couple out to break the Guinness Book of World Records record for longest time kissing in a car, while drinking what appears to be Coppertone suntan lotion.

Finally, they come to the "Lodge". And now we meet the experience that is, Torgo. Torgo cannot be fully explained. He must be witnessed. But, let's try. He moves about as if he's walking on Jello. He talks in this kind of up-and-down sing song that sounds like someone is giving him a very slow wedgie, kinda like Foster Brooks, and every time anyone asks him a question, he looks like his thinking process has been permanently removed. But he does have delightful theme music, as long as you like four notes being played over and over until blood comes out of your ears.

I thought the best actors were the moths that circled around the lights on every night exterior shot. The master's wives looked hideous. The scene where they're bickering while he's scowling at them is as good a testimony against poligamy as you'll find.

Did anyone count how many times Maggie's (the female victim) kerchief appeared and disappeared? It was really starting to annoy me. How did you like Torgo's "execution"? The biddies slapped and massaged him to death, but at least he was able to walk away. He wanders out of the movie, probably looking for someone to give him a hand! (sorry).

The ending was abomidable. Bad enough we've been subjected to nearly two hours of utter disregard to our psyche, but to offer as climax the father as Torgo-lite, the mother and child (app. six years old!) as new additions to the harem is sick! Depraved. Disgusting.

The worst part is, a movie like this was once made. Such a movie can be made again. And, next time, MST3k won't be around to protect us. I must go now. ThE mAsTeR iS cAlLiNg!

This film is odd, very very odd! I have only seen the MST3K version, but I don't think I could sit and watch the 'uncut' version.

The acting is sub-par, and the sets are desolate, dark, and moody. Had it had a better plot, and a better written script, this movie could have been good!

It's a great movie to make fun of. But in the end, sadly the guy who played Torgo, committed suicide after the movie was laughed out of Texas moviehouses. He had wanted to have a big career in movies..

I know I'm not saying anything terribly original here, but HA HA HA HA. Hal Warren should have crawled into a corner and hurled after seeing what he wrought. There are only two enjoyable characters, old "Mighty Knees" Torgo and the little girl's dog, and it's a tough call as to which was the better actor. I will say this, though - MST3K found a true gem here. A worse movie never has been and, God willing, never will be made.

I feel like the director found this movie locked up in a dusty attic, never to be seen by the general public. Its cursed in every way and I feel like I've invoked an ancient curse just by watching it.

review_title: The worst 'movie' I have ever watched.
review_detailed_main:
I bought this movie on DVD. Well, not exactly: I bought the MST3k version, and I must complain about one thing: the absence of the uncut version in the same DVD. I would have liked to see the whole thing without Joel & the Bots to have a better idea of how horrible it really is. I even don't know if it's possible to find the original Manos, anyway.

Nevertheless, I have no doubt that this film is the worst one I have ever had the 'pleasure' to watch.

But I have to point something important: this film is an amateur film, although it was released in a theater. It's uncommon to see an amateur film get into a cinema theater. Maybe that's the reason why it's so bad. It's like a third division soccer team playing at the first division, it's like my local basketball team playing at the NBA. It's a matter of mathematics that it will go right to the bottom. There must be lots of amateur movies even worse than Manos, but they will never be shown at a theater, so they will never be known and rated. Manos is an exception, and MST3k has a lot to do with the film's immense popularity.

In a few words, I must admit that this is the worst film I have ever watched, but I also must admit that it's just an exceptional amateur movie which had a lot of luck to be picked by Joel & the Bots.

this movie was absolutely the worst movie I have ever seen. and i have beheld such horrors as Dragon Wars and Speed Racer The Movie. the movie was excruciatingly painful from the very beginning. my friend said i needed to watch it so i sat at my fathers computer and watched it on Google Video. Third worst mistake of my life. as i observed the opening sequence i began to cringe. after 45 minutes, i began furiously clawing at my eyes. near the random all-out wrestling match between the wives, i was emersed in desperate, pointless hate and rage. i wanted to burn my house to the ground and throw myself into the flames. but i refraned from such activities as i feared hell itself may be Manos on an endless loop. God help us all.

This is a movie so awful that even the folks at Mystery Science Theater 3000 couldn't make it funny. About the only positive comment I can make is that it's not boring -- believe me, boring would be a great improvement for this piece of cinematic detritus. There is something ineffably awful about the film, like it was created by an acolyte of Cthulhu who wanted to capture the horrors of the cosmos on film.

Hilariously bad, Manos gets more out of the few dollars (read very few) that is spent to create one of the worst, but funny horror movies ever made. That pseudo-avant jazz soundtrack was probably the only thing done right in such a stinker of this magnitude.

Well, this film must rank as one of the all time greats! It has everything; Comedy, horror, gripping tension.... I could go on. Well acted and with fantastic location. The way the family get lost in the back of nowhere is creepy too. In short... Pure class.

review_title: worse than death-less torture.....oh wait it is death-less torture
review_detailed_main:
i saw this film i think about a year ago. did i just call it a film....whups! i think the correct word would be something along the lines of.....no nevermind, there isnt a word strong enough to describe the emmence pain, the feeling you wish you'd just die so you wouldn't have to witness this vial, vial, abomination. and thats with the gods of mst3k. and i love them, they are the funniest people alive. but this they couldn't make funny. i kept waiting in unimaginable pain for them to say something funny. but they couldn't. there's nothing there. for stretches that prove god hates us all, nothing happens. its a meaningless piece of ************* *******, with absolutely nothing they can even be identified of molecules of plotline. there are probably less than 50 words in manos, including all of them repeated, (which they are, e.g "whos there? whos there?"). the dubbed "dialogue" changes tone color constantly. the mst3k guys are desperately apologetic. the only thing they can say is the title over and over (which i admit became kind of funny the umpteenth time) because there are no lines and everything in it is far, far, far, far beyond unintentionally funny. it doesnt cross that line - it vomits on it, hacks it to pieces, shoots it with an automatic weapon, and destroys it with the most powerful nuclear bomb. the running time is really short but it feels like a quadrillion years of constant, sadistic torture. i regret ever laying eyes on its contaminated, poisonous box, videotape, and anything else that has to do with it.

if you ever have the choice of a slow death that inflicts the most pain possible or watching this, take the former.

and will god help us all by deciding we learned our lesson from this vile thing that brought hell on earth.

review_title: Worst movie of ALL time!!! (I love it!!)

review_detailed_main:
Without a doubt, Manos: The hands of fate is the worst film ever made. Worse than Plan 9, worse than the Killer Tomatoes. Manos takes the cake. No acting, no plot, no dialogue, no nothing except a waste of time and film. Funny with MST3K, but I can't imagine anyone watching it without them. A must-see for bad movie people, but if your normal NEVER watch this movie, if you can call it that.

0 of 10 stars. 0 of 4 stars.

review_title: Hal Warren -- The Lloyd Kauffman of his time.
review_detailed_main:
I hear all these negative comments about "Manos" The Hands of Fate and I just don't get it. "Manos" was fantastic. A great film.

Yes, let me repeat that: A GREAT FILM.

No I'm not sick, I'm not insane, and I definantly have a clear sense of reality.

"Manos" was a great film. It had it's charms. No it wasn't well made. The production values sucked. The acting (thanks most probably from the dubbing) wasn't spectacular.. But the movie was great. It imbodied the central idea of an independant film.

It showed us that even a fertilizer salesman from El Paso can make a film that gains any sort of status (in this case, cult status.)

Sure, Hal Warren's dead and gone, but "Manos" is still here, it lives on, and look at where it is now? It was on MST3K, and the main reason why any of us really know the movie exists. You can go online or to your local video retailer and pick up the MST3K version. Heck, oldies.com is selling the original version of it.

What I think "Manos" really stood for was that anybody could make a movie. Hal Warren did in 1966, and it's something people still do today. Sure it's more difficult now. But look at Lloyd Kauffman and Troma entertainment. He's doing the same thing now that Warren did in '66, and people love his stuff.

If anything, that's what "Manos" is a good movie for... That and Torgo. I don't think anyone can ever make a more memorable character... The master would not approve... It'll be dark soon.

So, so bad. Am I the only one who thinks Torgo sounds like Bette Davis?

Giant knees and death(?) by slapping. It's either Manos or Monty Python. Either way, it's hilarious.

Needs to be seen, but no doubt it's a 1/10.

This is one of those movies that is so incredibly bad that it's not even enjoyable as trash. This movie is really unpleasant, even to look at. Ugh. Without Joel and the robots this movie is unbearable, even with Torgo. Torgo, however, is great. The goofy looking innkeeper with the huge knees and the "haunting" theme music, how can you possibly dislike this guy. I just wish they had seen time to make a name for Torgmeister, and feed Mr. Warren some of his own fertilizer.

review_title: MTHOF: Worst Movie Ever Made- let's keep it so!
review_detailed_main:
If any of you have seen MTHOF then you know that without a doubt, by far, and unquestionably it is the worst movie ever produced: the cinematography is horrible, I think they only had one camera; the plot... yeah, what plot; the, um, actors? Sets?? Anyway, having seen it, I feel almost a personal bond to it- and would like to keep it as the worst movie ever, so vote 1 to keep it at the bottom of the list. I wholeheartedly recommend watching this film, for it is not until you have seen the lower echelon of the very bottom of the barrel of filmmaking that you truly can appreciate a cinematographic work of art. If you can make it through the film (try the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version, it helps), you will never forget the experience as long as you live, and you will have a newfound appreciation for the movies at the top of the list. So, long live Manos! in the number 1 position.

I Take Care Of The Place while the Master is Away,

Carter

review_title: Truly Amazingly Terrible- I loved it
review_detailed_main:
Sound score- 0/10 Cinematography- 1/10 Plot and storyline- 2/10 Comedic value - 8/10 Honestly, such a bad movie but it was so bad and incoherent it was good. Not like The Room level quality of good, but I definitely got a few really good laughs Out if it.

Everyone should watch it for the cultural experience.

review_title: If Manos is NORAD and the audience are nothing than just a bunch of nukes, the world would have ended in Apocalypse by now.

review_detailed_main:
I love this movie and everything about it! This is the kind of movie that with a little work could have been my favorite cult-type movie of all time. Torgo had skills in acting, and I wont deny him anything. He made his own braces for his legs, so that he would walk funny, rather than just having huge knees. But he didnt do his own voice.

The whole film was shot silently and then redubbed. The only people that dubbed in their own voices were Mike, Margaret, The Master, and the Wives. Im sad that the actor who played the Master dropped out of sight after this was made, and very sad that Torgo killed himself(It was because of family troubles). With better camera shots, a better actress to play Margaret, destruction of the pathetic policeman scens with the teenagers,if the hands of fate actually did something perhaps, and better sound quality especially for Debbie, I would love this film much more. I find it disturbing that Manos was left unfinished(Director couldnt get funding). I imagine Torgo would have made a return to save Margaret and the rest. I give it a 6 out of 10 for some mistakes, but whos perfect?

review_title: It's a waste of time commenting it
review_detailed_main:
Imagine a cross breed between Dracula and The Stepford Wives done with the budget and inspiration for one episode from a south American soap opera and you get MANOS The... hands of fate. Luckily for me I've watched in the MST3K version, but this was really bad. I mean, bad bad! The previous movie I've commented on I marked as 2 and since I watched it from start to end I can't rate it 1, I need a 1.1 mark here :)

The film features the most pathetic devil worshiper ever, the cutest evil hound, the most annoying harem, the jerkiest husband, the most Xanax filled wife (and daughter) in US cinema, the teenage duo with the Guinness record on kissing and a wonderful elevator music soundtrack.

It's a must avoid!

review_title: Not the worst, not even close
review_detailed_main:
I have repeatedly come across comments that "Manos" is the worst movie ever. How can you resist and not see it for yourself? Even though I'm very poor with my free time and choosing what to spend it on, I couldn't resist my curiosity. I watched it, it's bad, very bad, but nowhere near the worst. I've seen a couple of thousand movies and some were quite worse than this one.

Basically, the idea and the script aren't that bad at all, the problem is that it was shot totally amateurishly, with an obviously ridiculous budget and equipment, by people who barely knew what they were doing. It's as if someone without any film experience filmed a home movie for the fun of it. It could pass as the first attempt at a feature film by first-year students, but mostly it looks to me like a recording of a theatrical performance of some amateur theater. Seen from the latter perspective, it is not so catastrophically bad. I wouldn't even rule out the possibility that it was done that way on purpose, because at times it has a vibe of a misunderstood art.

All in all, "Manos" is a very bad movie, but it's not bad enough to deserve the cult status of the worst, nor is it bad in the way that some movies turn the game around and fall into the "so bad it's good" category. Any way you look at it, it's a waste of time.

3/10.

review_title: Am I missing the point here?
review_detailed_main:
I really have a high tolerance if it comes to boring scenes, but seeing a car drive round for 15 minutes is really it, I can't take anymore of that without reviewing this as a bad movie.

Though I must say the evil-master's-slave Torgo made me smile, but that surely wasn't because of his interesting monologues.

I still can't quite understand why this movie is in the bottom 100 and has been on 1 for so long, I've seen worse movies. (For example: Vampyros Lesbos, Samson VS. The Vampire Women, Hercules in New York)

Overall a bad movie with some nice things and especially the 10 minute fight of the 9 shrouded wives was worth it.

review_title: Technically the worst movie ever, however it's doesn't even deserve to be classified as a movie.
review_detailed_main: The worst movie ever? No not all all. The worst thing a fertilizer salesman has ever done? You better believe it. It doesn't even deserve to be called a movie!

review_title: The Worst Movie of all time being the Best thanks to MST3K!
review_detailed_main:
I got stick my two cents in here about "Manos, The Hands of Fate".

This is it folks -- the Winner and Undisputed Champion of "The Worse Movie Ever Made".

The only thing that made it worth watching as "The Best-Worse Movie Ever Made" was MST3K ripping it to shreds. Those guys (and puppets) took this gosh-awful film and made it one of the best gosh-awful films you MUST not miss.

I never laughed so darned hard in my entire life. You can't even use the word "bad" for this film, that is being too kind. Whether you see it by itself (and God help you if you do) or via Mystery Science Theater 3,000 (MST3K) which I say is THE best way to view this with any redeeming qualities what-so-ever, its the pits.

It's low, low, low, low, low, low, low, low, low budget. If they spent more than $300.00 to make this back in 1966, I'm shocked.

The acting is horrid. The sets are horrid. The story is....what story?!??! The filming is...well if they used a five year old drawing a storyboard it would have given this film a quality.

This is a film where you grab your rowdiest friends, your loudest movie lover friends..you know the ones..order all the junk food available..partake in kegs or wine or whatever gets your party going and enjoy to your heart's content. This IS a "only have a few good friends over for Halloween because I'm too old to go out trick or treating" kinda film. Do NOT watch it alone. Do NOT watch it with intellectual people. This is a party film if ever one was made.

You'll laugh -- till you cry, its that bad. Rent it today via MST3K. You'll be glad you did!

review_title: It's not as bad as they say... It's worse.
review_detailed_main:
I truly wish that I could leave a negative star rating for this film, but that option is not available.

If you truly must see how bad this movie is - I suggest you watch the Mystery Science Theater 3000 version. Otherwise, you will truly be upset with yourself.

The writing, acting, camera work, costuming, sets, sound are all B-A-D. This 1966 masterbad was made for $19,000 by a Texas fertilizer salesman.

He knows his fertilizer.

It is excrement from beginning to end - that serves as an endurance test for those who must watch the absolute worst of the worst. With Ed Wood type films you can laugh at the mistakes and blatant continuity gaffs with some semblance of a story but THIS... Ugh!

I honestly feel that anyone regardless of all lack of knowledge and talent in film making - with any budget - could make a better movie than "Manos, The Hands of Fate".

Anyone involved in this film should not be allowed to attend any film convention - for fear that viewers may try to accost them out of sheer revenge.

Please do not hold me accountable - I tried my best to warn you.

This is without doubt the worst film I've ever seen. Once famously Quentin Tarrentino is said to have called this film his favourite comedy. In my opinion he couldn't have been further from the truth, this film is so bad its not even funny.

Everything about this film is bad but its where to start that is the problem on commenting on this film.

For me it has to be the terrible editing of this film that makes it stand out, with every cut of the camera the characters have changed position and appear to jump about the screen and in one scene you can see the clapboard going down.

Then i would have to comment on the music. A really terrible score possibly the worst use of music in a movie ever. The way music follows Torgo around is very odd indeed.

The plot or lack of it has to make this the worst movie ever after 30 minutes in i decided to go through what had actually happened; family going on holiday, couple kissing in a car to the dissatisfaction of the police, meet Torgo, look at picture of the master, nothing really happens and when something happens it happens with no logic at all.

The script and acting also makes this film the worst ever with exceptional note on the character of Torgo (John Reynolds).

I could go on but i think by now you should have got the picture of what I'm trying to put across this is th worst film ever. Yes worse than "plan 9 from outer space" and yes worse than "The man who saved the world AKA Turkish star wars"

JA JA I finally have the Manos the Hands of Fate DVD! The worst movie of all times? Nah! This is more like the next best cult classic behind Plan 9,Barbarella, and the first japanese godzilla movies. A movie with this "feeling" of old good horror, is awesome!

all my friends in Mexico are voting 7 or 8 for this cult classic!

and to answer you wich is the worst movie of all times I have only one word... ...Gigli

After reading everyone Else's reviews, I had to give Manos a 1 instead of following my gut and giving it a 2. When the film was over, I truly had to say that it wasn't the worst film I had ever watched. Mind you, I watched the actual movie first, not the MST3K version. (I ordered both, followed the original with the MST3K version... Yeah, I don't appreciate money, I know.) Anyway, the acting, the script, the production quality, yada-yada... It all sucked. I did find that Torgo's theme implanted itself into my feeble brain and I'm struggling to remove it, (actually, I am typing this while trying to position a drill to my frontal lobe.) I do wonder if this thing was made so poorly on purpose. If so, what a success at failure! I must admit, I am glad to own the film in both versions because now I have the ultimate torture device for my b-movie loving friends. I can tolerate a few watchings of this film, especially if someone else can feel my initial pain. Sadistic and cruel feeling on my behalf, but not as sadistic and cruel as this film.

Fertilizer salesman by day... fertilizer producer by night.

review_title: 1966, England win world cup, Eric cantona is born, this is film is made!
You could not make a worse movie if I paid you.
review_detailed_main:
There are no words to express how horrible this movie is. I say that having only seen the MST3 version, which was just funny enough to get me to the end. The first twenty minutes alone is footage after footage of driving. By the time the family gets pulled over you start cheering only to find you're just halfway through the torturing drive.

The only thing remotely redeeming is Torgo and how ridiculous a character he is. His wobbling and slow-witted speech will have you rolling on the floor with laughter. Don't forget to look at his death scene near the end where he pulls a Keyser Soze and runs off screen.

The only thing worst then the acting is the editing. You will be amazed at the appearing and disappearing people and objects. Not to mention when you're watching a scene and it suddenly changes perspective and dialogue. As a last piece of advice I warn all not to watch this movie unless it's the MST3 version or you just might die from stupidity.

review_title: So Bad It's Hard Not To Watch
review_detailed_main: So amazingly awful one can't look away. A young family off to their vacation destination gets lost (naturally dad doesn't take the opportunity to ask for directions) and ends up on a desolate desert road. They come upon a house and are greeted by Torgo the caretaker. Although uninvited dad decides they'll stay for the night. If you listen to the inane dialog you'll notice that most of the women sound alike as do most of the men probably because the film was shot without sound and dubbed later using only a few of the cast members to provide the voices. Settling in to the house it's unbelievable that anyone would consider an overnight. The place looks like it was decorated with items discarded to city dump, a horrible picture of the master with his evil dog dominates the room and the deformed caretaker should scare off anyone. The atmosphere is claustrophobic even when folks venture outside. Still morbid curiosity kept me watching. Devil worship, satanic rituals and human sacrifices and even girls wrestling in nighties round out the build up to what happens to our vacationers and to our caretaker Torgo. Unless you see this you won't believe it. The only film I can come close to comparing this with is "The Beast of Yucca Flats" which at least had the fairly well known Tor Johnson running around the desert as far as I can determine no one in this film ever appeared in another movie before or after this spoiled turkey..

review_title: best worst movie of all time
review_detailed_main: i have never had the privilege of seeing this movie bot-free, but it would be interesting to see it un-mst3k-ified. one can't deny that it beats battlefield earth in quality, acting ability, coherence, continuity, and lighting, however, it really is a sucky movie. apparently the actors couldn't deal with it either, as their careers or lives evidently all ended afterward. considering the primitive nature of equipment employed in the filming, it's a wonder that it looks as good as it does. in all honesty, if it were a student film, it would be considered a fine piece of beginners work. after all, it does have a beginning, and middle, and an end, which is more than one can say for some multimillion dollar films. in the final analysis, it is an historical curiosity that stands outside the continuum of film making--an example of what someone with a big idea and some money can accomplish if unhampered by talent or experience. 1 out of 10, folks.

I hope that any guy out there who sees this movie takes notes on Torgo's mack vibe. Did you see him throwin' game at that honey? She acted scared, but you could tell she wanted it. And who wouldn't? Seriously, this film makes for amazingly bad viewing; I was squirming in my seat after 10 minutes. And I was watching the MST3K version! To their credit, Joel and the 'bots did an incredible job with this piece of crap: they actually made it semi-watchable. However, I have no idea what they would have done if it wasn't for Torgo. "Ripping on Torgo" probably provided 90% of the laughs during this show, I'm not kidding. This is just about the only movie MST3K has ever shown that I had a really difficult time sitting thru at some parts, even with the wise-ass comments. You have to put in some work to watch this thing all the way thru, and I consider the fact that I survived the whole thing to be a major plus on my side. I give the MST3K folks a ton of credit for pulling this one off.

review_title: This movie sapped my will to live.
review_detailed_main: And I was watching the MST3K version! This is one of those movies that just sits on your head and smothers any strength you may have against bad movies. The "acting" was so bad it defies description, the plot was laughable, the music annoying in the way only the sound of a spoon in a garbage disposal can be, and the ending is downright offensive. I find it appropriate that Hal Warren was a fertilizer salesman. Avoid this movie like the plague.

review_title: The Movie So Bad They Named It Twice
Must remain at the top er... bottom
review_detailed_main:
Please... this is indeed the worst movie ever made.... lets make sure it stays #1!! I mean Monster A Go Go is indeed very inept...almost to Manos' degree but Manos should remain at the top. And while Coleman Francis films were ugly...they at were crafted much better than either of these two. Coleman may have had utter comtempt and hatred for his audience but at least you felt it. And he could use stock footage right up there with Mr Ed Wood (who looks like a genius in this company>) We should all bow our heads in submission to Hal P. Warren's masterpiece of badness...."Hands" The Hands of Fate Remember to watch out for snakes!

Go MYSTIES!

Absolutely one of the best-worst movies ever. If you are a fan of MST3K.. you gotta see this one. It ranks up there with Squirm and Pod people as one of the best MST3K's done. The Direction is absolutely horrible and the acting is.... well, it's horrible also. ENJOY!

review_title: It kept me all night... wondering how something could be so bad!
review_detailed_main: It was, by far, the most horrid movie I've ever seen. It doesn't make sense how something could be so bad, I mean it wasn't even funny. I saw it on MST3K and I, who adores that show, couldn't stand to watch it any longer! In fact it was so bad that nobody that was in it ever stared in another movie, and three of the actors committed suicide the same year it was made... creepy. Do not see this film unless it is through MST3K, I warned you...

review_title: Tell me they do it on purpose..
review_detailed_main: I went to see Manos as part of an 'Incredibly Strange Film Festival' my local theatre put on, even (well, okay, 'especially') after visiting this website. I love bad movies, but I didn't know they got this awful! The film was full of oversights (how many times did Torgo 'die' before running off into the night with his sleeve on fire?), bad dubbing, worse lines, and much time-wasting to cover up the fact that nothing happened. The audience were laughing themselves silly at the stupidity of it all - even the soundtrack was funny! (not only due to the record being restarted every time it finished....) After the (admittedly BAD) ending, the audience stayed through the credits and applauded, with the biggest cheer saved for Torgo. You must see this film. "It's shocking!"

Manos: The Hands of Fate is a masterpiece ineptitude. The movie is hilariously bad and nothing short of a train wreck. Manos is slimly plotted and barely coeherrant. The acting is horrible and amateurish. Hal Warren is a terrible director even for a fertilizer salesman. It has even less camp value and lower production values than Plan 9 from Outter Space. The story behind the Manos and the making of the film would probably make a much better film. The film would certainly have toiled in obscurity if not for Mystery Science Threatre 3000. Manos is now a cult classic and landmark is cinematic Crap. Manos is likely the Worst Film of All Time. Beating out the likes of Battlefield Earth, Plan 9, and Garbage Pale Kids the Movie. The movie belongs back at #1. 1/10 Bad Stuff.

This is so horrible. Words cant begin...

Let me put it this way. Have you ever hit your thumb with a hammer by accident? Remember how, in that split second before the pain comes, you're in shock and cant make any noise for a moment? Well, putting the tape in the vcr is like hitting your thumb with the hammer. When the movie's playing you are in shock, silent and unable to comprehend what you just did to yourself. Then when you scream and curse due to the pain inflicted by the hammer, well thats exactly what you do when the credits roll. Thats the only way I know how to describe 'Manos".

review_title: So bad it MUST be seen
review_detailed_main: Being a fan of MST3K it was almost inevitable that I would see what I have been told is the most requested episode of the cult TV series. Now I am no stranger to bad films, but this one is so unbelievable I feel that it must been seen in order for one to appreciate just how bad it is. Poor camera techniques and dreadful acting are just two horrendous elements that make up "Manos". In my opinion, Ed Wood's Plan 9 is better made than this. Despite the sheer atrocity of this film I feel that it must be seen in order to properly enjoy a good film. I mean, how can one say a film is good without experiencing a truly bad one? When I read the book 1001 Movies You Must See Before You Die, i was very surprised that this was not in it. I feel that it is a film that must be seen, if only for 90 minutes of gut-busting enjoyment.

review_title: There is nothing like this...spool of film.
review_detailed_main: I have never seen anything like this -- it is just randomly bad footage taken out in the desert with a character called Torgo running a coven of badly dressed people with no lines. Then things get super-scary when Torgo comes out into daylight, he and his group assaulting people. Or something. I could have shot this in 8mm film outside some desert town myself.

review_title: "Tonight, Manos gets caught in a deadly game of cat and mouse..."
review_detailed_main: Thank God for Joel and the bots to get us through this one. Of all the MST3k experiments it's the only one I ever saw make Servo cry. Good for unintentional laughs, the worst movie I have ever seen. Internet rumours abound of a modern-day remake (!)

I was disappointed everyone said this is unwatchable. One of the worst films ever made. I disagree. I've seen worst. A lot of Troma movies such as nuke 'em high 2 and 3 were much worst. I actually turned those off.

What I didn't like about this movie. The soundtrack doesn't fit this movie at all. Tons of overdubs that made this film just lazy and look incomplete. The story can be explained in about 2 sentences how much "Depth" there is to it. The shots are poorly spliced together like something you'd see by a film student today who swears they can fix it in post production. The bad guy and his dog are about as intimidating as an old lady walking a kitten on a leash. What will I remember about this movie.. the sweet jacket. The only reason I'm putting a 10 star so a more deserving movie can have the honor of being the most worst movie ever made. Though calling this a movie is a bit of a stretch.

If Torquemada had this film available as a tool for torture, the Inquisition would have been over in a week.

The one redeeming quality of this horribly written, badly filmed (so bad it does not even deserve the damned-by-faint-praise comment "It was in color!") was that it provided a rich romp for riff by robots (Tom Servo and Crow T.; although I believe only one survived with its circuits intact). Alas! The film stock! The film stock! -M.

review_title: Bad in many ways, but still atmospheric
Awful Acting and filming kills what could have been a decent popcorn horror flick

review_detailed_main:
This movie was so mind-numbingly awful that I had trouble even watching the MST3K episode that heckled it. Is there, you may ask, at least some aspect of this movie that one could point to and say, "Well, at least some other movie did it worse"? No. It looks like it was shot over the weekend on drug store-quality 8mm film by people who were making it up as they went along. I'm not going to waste time going into detail about this movie's flaws, because its very existence is a flaw.

This is, in my long experience of cheesy movie-watching, the bottom of the barrel. If you wish to torture your children for misbehaving, keep a copy of this movie on hand.

quite possibly the worst movie of all time, which in turn, makes it the best. one of those films that is hilarious and doesn't even know it. definitely watch the mystery science theater 3000 version, or else you'll go stupid

review_title: Hey, I may be lonely but at least I'm not one of the Master's sheet-clad wives!!
review_detailed_main:
going through a little heartbreak right now - so I did the only thing that always makes me feel better. I popped in this movie. OH, I should say the MST3K verison that is...the only experiment in which the mads actually APOLOGIZE to Joel and the 'bots for how bad it is. That should tell you something.

And then for days after watching it, you'll have all the haunting theme music in your head....the cat on the keys piano, the elevator music (little Manos takin' us up to news time here), the Shirley Bassey, and of course the haunting Torgo theme.

A MUST SEE.

"There is no way out of here. It'll be dark soon. There is no way out of here....."

review_title: required viewing for all aspiring filmmakers
review_detailed_main:
I am going to diverge myself from the typical 'worst movie of all time' byline by saying "Manos: Hands of Fate" isn't that bad. Cheap and poorly dubbed, the filmmakers must be commended for pulling such an absurd concept off with a straight face. Tom Neyman, as "The Master," could've made a career out of playing quirky bad guys, and Torgo (John Reynolds) would have fit in nicely with that midget on "Seinfeld."
