The film is proof that indeed, anyone can make a movie. It's not a matter of professionalism, but of having the right resources and a handful of friends available for a whole weekend of shooting. In that respect, it's required viewing for any disillusioned person attempting to 'break through' in the industry. By the way, this is also one of the best episodes of MST3K, and my star rating pertains only to that version.

8/10

Yeah, it's shocking that a movie this bad was ever allowed to be made. At least the writers of South Park admit that they use hallucinogens to come up with some of their material - what was the excuse here? How can anyone possibly sit down and take the time to write something so unbelievably boring, uninteresting, and just plain stupid? Thank God for Joel, Tom and Crow...

review_title: Just as bad as a movie can be?
review_detailed_main: Low budget movies, even horrors, are not bound to be failure - take the original Texas Chainsaw Massacre, take Evil Dead, take Halloween. Howver, if you still consider them bad, it just means you don't have a clue of what Manos The Hands Of Fate brings up. From start to finish, it's just one big mistake, coincidence, lucky shot which somehow made it to the screen, VHS, and to DVD, and will make it to any new format in the future. And whenever you watch it, you're gonna ask the same question: how something like that could have possibly happened? I'm not going to get into details here, as there's not enough space for this kind of elaboration. But every time I even think of this movie I immediately ask myself, Are those guys serious? Or is it just one big joke of the audience? This way or that, this movie is BAD, throughout and forever. And due to this fact, and undeniably MST3K, this movie has become some kind of a classic, and a must-see for all those who enjoy, or at least THINK they do, low-budget b-movies.

With multiple incoherent jumps in scenes and a horribly dreary plot, even with the help of MST3k, this movie is unbearable! Torgo is reminiscent of Brad Pitt in 12 Monkeys (but with HUGE knees!) and everything else just sucks. If you're even THINKING of renting this one... Just say no!

The only way to actualy describe Manos, the Hands of Fate is to spout off adjectives dealing with the word bad. So here it goes. Bad, Terrible, Unbearable, The Worst, Unwatchable... I saw this film on MST3K, and as much as I love the bots, I still couldn't take this movie. This was the abosolute worst.

This movie was surprisingly terrific... on Mystery Science Theater 3000! This is definitely as bad as movies get. Please, whatever you do, don't watch this film thinking that it might be something interesting. It can only be viewed with the helpful comments of the MST3K gang, and even that isn't enough at times. This movie is freaky looking. It looks like it was filmed in one day in someone's back yard. Awful acting, awful plot, and some of the worst dialogue in history. I would like to meet the people that voted 10's for this film. Why... why... why would anyone do that? This movie is incredibly bad and that, unfortunately, may be its only interesting quality. But Beware! Stay away from this one! Overall, a 1 out of 10.

review_title: The most disturbing part of the 'film'...
review_detailed_main:
... besides Torgo's knees (which still wake me up at night with a hearty laugh), is at the end of the 'film'. We are shown the master's wives, all tied to posts around his altar... and then we are shown THE SIX YEAR OLD GIRL as one of his wives!

No!

NO!

BAD MOVIE!

BAD BAD BAD!

Thank you, and goodnight.

My immediate thought after finishing this movie was, why oh why did i just not listen to the reviews on IMDb.

I have watched a few awful movies in my time but this...this really takes the cake.

I cannot name one thing I enjoyed about this movie. I mean, half of it was people standing and wobbling whilst it seemed they had forgotten there lines. But no, apparently that was acting. Then when they finally did speak, it was the same repetitive lines over and over. If I was held at gun point and told to make a good movie out of the script, I would have shot myself.

My recommendation: If you like movies, don't watch this.

Manos. You will believe a film can suck.

I agree with other reviewers: Do not try to watch this without the kind

assistance of Joel, Crow, and Tom. While other films may earn their "negative stars" rating for bad writing ("To be like the hu-man! To think! To feel!"-- Robot Monster), special effects that come from Special Ed (cardboard tombstones--

Plan 9) or acting that a high school drama teacher would have trouble praising (Invasion USA), "Manos: the Hands of Fate" has it all.

Torgo deserves special attention. While the ostensible title character mopes

around in goth gear, the director must have told actor John Reynolds "Act weird" without expanding upon it. That role is played in the self-conscious style that is usually reserved for sighted actors playing blind people or average intellects playing developmentally disabled ones.

Whenever people criticize amateur theatric productions, I remind them that this (and other badfilms) were made by professionals. The MST3K staff must have had multiple orgasms when they discovered this.

There is nothing at all redeeming about this horrendous travesty of a film. The acting is poor, the story lame, the sets lousy and the sound awful. I ponder the reasons any cast member other than Hal Warren agreed to take on such roles. Surely they read the script before hand. How could they ever think this film would be something somebody would want to watch. I've read that the city of El Paso held a gala premier for this awful film. Did they know nothing of the script or production? If one reads how actors in the film snuck out of the theatre at it's premiere, one must conclude that all involved in the production had blinders on during the making of the film. Was Hal Warren was such a feared tyrant of a director that no actor or crew member dare suggest a dialogue be reworked or a scene re-shot? Maybe the entire crew (including Hal Warren) thought they were making something great. I know nothing of Hal Warren besides his career selling fertilizer. I must admire the fact that Hal Warren somehow convinced a distributor to distribute this film and had the city of El Paso hype it up for him. I even heard he had other ideas. Maybe another effort behind the camera would have been much better as Hal Warren learned from the mistakes made in Manos The Hands of Fate. It would have been a great opportunity because the film presents every mistake a film maker can make.

UPDATE 2009- I was in a low budget film produced in my hometown. Well, they only gave me the pages from the script that involved my scene. I did not get to see the rest and assumed the rest was a "good movie". I was wrong. It was a confusing collage of action scenes and dialogue. Maybe a few actors in "Manos" can explain away their participation as having been involved in a situation similar to mine. Also, my hometown hosted a grand premiere at the city's most elegant theater. I guess getting municipalities to give poor films shot within their city limits unworthy premieres is more common than most would think.

review_title: All Bad In All Its Glory
review_detailed_main:
The story, Effects, acting all have in common that their all bad. The score gives an ambience to distract you how terrible the overdubbing in dialog. The main family are somewhat the only thing that could be a positive.

This film is a textbook to those of what not to do in making a film. It's hard to follow the story when it diverts you in awkward moments from a cop harassing a couple trying to makeout on a freeway to a cult trying to assume to control the family staying.

This is a horror film but it's only cringe is of how little to no budget was given for it. It is a warning to those first time watchers that this will not scare, will not give suspense but will keep you on the edge of your seat that feeling of embarrassment.

review_title: The Hands of Fate have doomed whoever watches this atrocity
review_detailed_main:
Every once in a while, there comes along a film so epically bad that any attempt to discern the possible rhyme and reason behind it (I.e. artistic ambition, greed) would be an absolute exercise in futility. There is not one single thing this film has going for it. The music seem more appropriate for a third-rate dance routine. The acting is best described as constipated. The cinematography is horrendous. The plot (a family checks into a satanic lodge and a whole bunch of nothing happens) makes no sense. The protagonists are bland and unlikable. The antagonists are hammy and impossible to take seriously. Torgo provides a few fleeting laughs but he is ultimately as repugnant as the rest of the films.

To add insult to injury, there are implications of rape, necrophilia, and pedophilia. So not only is this film bad and impossible to enjoy but it is also unpleasant and sleazy. What stoned insane masochist could find this film entertaining? This only serves as a cautionary tale of what not to when making a movie. For example, don't make a film just because you were bet into it like Hal Warren, this film's actor and supposed "hero", did. Ambition often exceeds actual talent.

The MST 3K version hilariously tears this film a new and makes the flaws even more apparent as if that were possible. View this version only for the sake of your time and sanity.

review_title: Handed down from the fates: it's awful!
review_detailed_main:
Well, it doesn't get much worse than "Manos, the Hands of Fate". When I saw this on MST3K, I couldn't believe that it was a real movie. It looked like something I would've made with my Dad's old movie camera in junior high, but a lot worse.

Even with my robot buddies and Joel, I found this extremely difficult to sit through in any kind of coherent state. I think I actually drifted out of consciousness a couple of times, crippled by this "film's" horridness. My sister actually managed to watch every agonizing minute, so she's made of stronger stuff than I am.

Torgo and his leitmotif cracked me up (especially when reprised at the end of the MST3K version), as did the ridiculously redundant title (as pointed out by another astute viewer here). I just have flashes of this movie in my mind, like something from a surreal, horrible nightmare.

At first, I was going to say that "Manos" should be able to inspire anyone to make a movie, since there's a pretty darn good chance that it would be better. Then again, someone could just go out and inflict another "Manos" on an unsuspecting world.

"Manos" proves that the movie camera is a weapon that can inflict real suffering on viewers and should never be used lightly! Watch this movie with extreme caution!

review_title: The stories about making this film are more intersting than the film....

review_detailed_main: Forget Plan Nine From Outer Space... if any movie deserves the crown as "Worst Movie Of All Time", it's this one. Not even watching it filtered through MST3K made it bearable. I gave it a "1" on the IMDB voting list, only because the ratings don't go into negative numbers. This one inexplicably has a cult following... avoid this one at all costs, unless you for some reason feel the need to punish yourself.

review_title: Who can ever make a movie this bad!!??
review_detailed_main: Can movies get any worse!? the first 10 minutes or so is just nothing but a card driving through fields, after that almost nothing else happens any way. The characters are awful the acting could not get any worse the plot is stupid, there just is no worse movies, I have absolutely no idea how a movie like this can get a score as high as 1.8 out of 10! If it possible I would rate this movie as high a negative score as possible, numbers don't get low enough to rate this movie! Its filled with flaws you can even see the zipper on the back of one of the costumes! this movie gives me nightmares it was just so awful nightmares that the director is coming over to visit me. This movie made my life not worth living, don't watch it, if I knew how bad it is I would never watch not for a million dollars, I will never be happy again now that I saw this.

This movie is the ultimate in the 'so bad its good!' genre. Forget about Ed Wood, this movie takes the cake! Torgo is brilliant. ! the kids act so well, I cant hardly believe it. Admittedly, its not as much fun when not watching it on MST3K, but it is still a hoot all by itself.

Manos: The Hands of Fate is quite possibly the worst movie of all time no hyperbole. Everything from its technical issues, pacing, story and acting shows no redeeming value whatsoever. However, like most bad movies it fascinates you in to what went behind this monstrosity of a film.

The movie was shot on a camera that could only record approximately thirty-two seconds of footage, explaining the overly long takes used in the film. The whole movie was also dubbed since the filmmakers had no sound equipment.

Actor John Reynolds, who plays Torgo, was reportedly high on LSD while filming and his performance consists of him displaying confusion, twitching and other strange mannerisms.

Manos has gone into infamy as one of the all-time bad movies and it's no wonder why...

Rightfully regarded as one of the worst horror film ever made. A family (mother, father, daughter and a cute little dog) get lost in the middle of nowhere. They soon find themselves under attack by a Devil-worshipping cult led by the Master, his six wives and servant Togar. It's just incredible how terrible this movie is. It was shot without sound so all the dialogue was (badly) dubbed. The plot makes little sense and ALL the acting is terrible! There's no suspense or horror at all. Frankly it's just boring! No action either. The closest we get to something exciting is when the Master's six wives are fighting each other. Even then it's so badly staged it's laughable. It all leads to a stupid surprise ending that had me wanting to throw the TV out the window! It's incredible how this movie did everything wrong! You can safely skip this one.

review_title: Would you like some wine with your CHEESE?
review_detailed_main: Could anything be worse? I mean, anything? When they did the "Top 100 Worst Movies" in an MST3K marathon a few years back, I basically predicted this as the #1 worst. I guess MST agreed with me. Note to all fertilizer workers aspiring to be film makers: don't bother.

There is a lot of debate about what makes a movie truly, so bad its good. There are so many it's hard to choose sometimes. When I first saw this films opening credits, with its Shriley Basey like lounge song over the opening credits(its supposed to be a horror movie)I knew that this was going to be hard to beat. Everything about it is poorly executed, acting, camera, lighting, editing, and music(a saxophone piano and drum trio!!!). Not only are they bad they transcend themselves(ei: the sax theme for Torgo). Even films like "Beast of yucca flats" have some professional crew people(the film is in focus, for example) Manos is a totally unique film and deserves to be at the rock bottom for as long as film are made and viewed. I know it sounds cruel but it's a compliment really. Everyone who loves bad movies should get online and keep this film right at number 1.

This is, without a doubt, the worst movie I have ever seen. Even viewed through the MST3K filter almost wasn't enough. Was it the bad acting? The bad script? The bad sound? The hilariously tacky music? It was all of the above. Small wonder that no one who appeared in this film ever appeared in anything else.

While not the worst of the worst (there"s still a few out there vying for that title) Manos is like making a sub sandwich then finding out the bread has mold. The plot had potential but was wasted on bad shooting, acting, sets and costumes. Who exactly is this Master? Does he sleep like Dracula in the open air? Is Torgo retarded or evil? Is the hero, Micheal, a complete moron? Why the tour of a boring Texas landscape? What evil cult leader actually choses southern Texas as his base of operations? So many questions, so little concern. What does the Master want with all those wives when he appears to be a dork? I give it 2 1/2 thumbs down. Best viewed after 3 beers.

review_title: I ended up with a massive headache.
review_detailed_main: To say that this movie was bad would be the understatement of a lifetime. There aren't enough negative words in the English language to convey how I truly feel about this movie. It was so horrible that I couldn't even watch it all the way through. I had to stop the tape in the middle because I had a headache and started crying. There are plenty of movies that have bad acting or a cheesy story or bad costumes. This movie could only be improved by adding those things to it. Aside from there being no discernible plot or acting skill, the movie was physically filmed poorly. Sometimes, the frame wasn't even in focus, making it painful to watch. I think that in the deepest level of hell, this movie is on permanent repeat and all the damned must watch it sitting perfectly still with their eyeballs taped open.

Masterpiece. Tom Neyman blows the screen away. Never has one movie captured the essence of the human spirit like "Manos,the Hands of Fate." 10/10... don't miss this great classic. Great supporting roles from John Reynolds as Torgo and Diane Mahree as Margaret.

Rejoice, this finally made it to its well-deserved place as the #1 worst movie ever made! This film is so bad, its unforgettable. And come on, who doesn't like Torgo? MST3k's riffing of this is one of that show's best episodes ever.
